loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve M. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Eve is 35 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees for the children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Rosca

texts.en: Rosca O. has 16 years of experience in agriculture and launched his own small business six years ago. He owns 0.9 hectares of Sauvignon grapevines that produced 2,000 liters of wine last year. He also cultivates seeds on 1.3 hectares of land to support his family and their animal production. This agricultural activity enables Rosca to cover his family’s consumption needs. He plans to plant a 0.8-hectare vineyard of table wine grapes. In the long term, O. hopes to open his own grocery store.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Luh Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a mother of five children who runs a ‘buy em, sell em’ clothing business in the Bush Market. She also finds time to raise pigs. Alice lives in Nkwen where she sells her clothing. She will use her loan to purchase clothing to resell at the market and to buy piglets to raise. 
 
This is Alice’s sixth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2002. Her clothing business has been running since at least then and she knows her customer base well. She plans on changing locations with this new loan and understands what it takes to sell her clothes in a different market. 

Her past loans have gone into her clothing business. The profits from those loans have helped her buy textbooks for her children’s education, as well as to pay for the farm’s rent. This particular loan will help her to rent a new farm and buy fertilizer for it, as well as continue to fund her children’s education. 

Alice has not had it easy living in poverty. Both she and, at times, her children have had to go without enough clothing.  She has also had to experience the death of her brother and sister. Alice stands strong, however, with her clothing business. She prefers to use GHAPE because the loan conditions work well for her. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and piglets

loans.name: Mukangango

texts.en: Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda!  E. Mukangango is currently seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda worth 500,000 Rwandan Francs.  She owns a shop selling secondhand clothes in the Kimironko neighborhood of Kigali.  With the loan, she hopes to expand her business by increasing her stock of secondhand clothing.  At this time, she buys the clothing in bulk and sells it at retail value so that she can earn a profit.  The loan will enable her to buy more stock and increase her sales.  With the increased profits, E. hopes to pay school fees, buy more food for her family, and reinvest in her business.  E. is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She also cares for three orphans.  She began her business in 2005 and currently employs two people to help her run her shop.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ghenghea

texts.en: Ghenghea I. is a farmer in the village of Cobani, located in the north of Moldova. He has worked in agriculture for more than five years. He came to Microinvest to borrow a loan that will allow him to increase his working capital. Ghenghea now has loyal clients, so he is able to sell more products. His favorite aspect of this job is earning clients' trust. With the money he borrowed, Ghenghea will buy ten more hectares of arable land in his village, as well as seeds to grow more varieties of vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase ten more hectares of arable land in his village

loans.name: Mukankuranga

texts.en: Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda!  J. Mukankuranga is currently seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company in Rwanda.  She lives and works in the Kimironko neighborhood of Kigali, the capital city.  She has owned a butcher shop there since 2004 and employs three people to help her run the shop.  With her loan, J. will purchase a freezer for her butchery.  This will permit her to store meat for long periods of time without it going bad.  She anticipates that it will result in an increase in profit, and with this profit she hopes to buy more food and goods for her home, pay school fees, and reinvest in her business.  J. is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children.  In addition, she cares for three orphans.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for her butchery.

loans.name: Nicoline

texts.en:
Nicoline is a mother of two children. She runs a hair dressing salon at Mile 3 where Nicoline lives. She will use this loan to purchase a hair-drying machine and hair treatment, and use it to cover her transportation and rent costs.   
 
This is Nicoline’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. Nicoline trusts that her business will be a successful one because she thinks she her salon is in a good location. Her customer base is also consistent and Nicoline is very skilled at styling hair. 

Like most entrepreneurial mothers, Nicoline plans to use the profits from the loans to pay for her children’s school fees. The profits will also go towards purchasing food and clothing for the family. Nicoline enjoys being a GHAPE member and likes the group of entrepreneurs with whom she works. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a hair drier and hair treatment lotion

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of five children who runs a "buy-em, sell-em" fast food business by the roadside. She also finds time to raise pigs. Pauline lives in Mile18 Mbengwi, Cameroon where she sells her gateaux (small cakes). She will use her loan to purchase flour, yeast, groundnut oil, piglets and animal feed. 
 
This is Pauline’s fourth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2004. Her fast food business has been running since at least then and she knows her customer base well. Her community will benefit by being able to have their breakfasts with no difficulty and less expense.

Her past loans have gone into her clothing business. The profits from those loans have helped her buy textbooks for her children’s education, as well as to pay for the farm’s rent. This particular loan will help her to rent a new farm, buy fertilizer for it, and to continue to fund her children’s education. 

Pauline has not had it easy living in poverty. She has had to go without enough clothes and, at times, her children did, too. She has also had to experience the death of her brother and sister. Pauline stands strong, however, with her clothing business. She prefers to use GHAPE because the loan conditions work well for her. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast, groundnut oil, piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.en:
Maria Lucrecia is 24 years old and is originally from Xeatzac, a small village about 3 kilometers outside of Tecpan, Guatemala. 

Maria Lucrecia raises and sells animals, which she has done ever since she was a little girl and used to help her father. She is now married and her husband works as a construction assistant. She raises animals to contribute financially to the household and to help earn enough to build their house and pay daily living expenses.

For the past five years, she has had pigs and just one cow, from which she sells milk. She is requesting a loan to help her invest in another dairy cow. She also needs capital to purchase food and supplements to help care for the cows and to aid in producing more milk. Her hope is to increase her income and to have enough money to improve their home.

*************************************************************************************


Maria Lucrecia es una mujer joven, tiene 24 años de edad,  es originaria de la aldea Xeatzac a 3  Kilómetros del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala,  en el departamento de Chimaltenango.  Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales,  se inicio desde muy pequeña en esa activad productiva, ayudándole a su padre. Luego se caso, y su esposo se dedicaba a ayudante de construcción. Maria Lucrecia para contribuir económicamente con su esposo, y para construir juntos su casa y sufragar los gastos según sus necesidades se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, hace aproximadamente 5 años y a la venta de leche, actualmente tiene los cerdos y una vaca.  Ella quiere invertir mas en otra vaca lechera, y necesita capital para comprar 5 quintales de concentrado,  para crecimiento, y 5 quintales para engorde,  con el fin de tener mejores ingresos, y con un capital propio para mejorar de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase a new dairy cow and food for livestock

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yesica es una mujer emnprendedora que incio su negocio de venta de zapatos para poder ayudar a su familia y salir adelante con los gastos de sus 3 hijos, asi como poder brindarles mejor calidad de vida. 

Poco a poco gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado hacerse de  clientes, iniico vendideno solo entre sus familiares y amigos y ellos la han ido recomendando por lo que su cartera de clientes ha crecido y asi ha incrementado sus ventas, ahora ella necesita de un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella podra continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesica is an enterprising woman who started her shoe sale business to help her family and come out ahead with the expenses of her three children. She also wants to provide them a better quality of life. Little by little, thanks to her own efforts she has achieved establishing a clientele. She started by selling to her family and friends, and they have been recommending her thereby increasing her client portfolio and her sales. All she needs now is a loan for MXN $4000 that she will pay off in 10 two-week installments to buy merchandise. With your help she will continue operating her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Oscar Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar es un cliente conocido por la institución, hasta ahora ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. Se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos, labor que realiza en la ciudad de El Alto, Bolivia; con este trabajo mantiene a su pequeña familia que esta compuesta por él, su señora y sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes aun están en edad escolar. Vive en una humilde casa alejada de la ciudad. Tiene un problema físico, que encara de manera poositiva con el apoyo de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is well known at this lending institution. In the past he has demonstrated punctuality in repaying his loans. Oscar sells athletic shoes in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. With this business he covers the expenses of his small family, which consists of himself, his wife, and their two small children, who have just become old enough to attend school. He lives in a humble home outside of the city. Oscar has a physical handicap, which he faces with a positive attitude and help from his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased capital

loans.name: Penn Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a mother of four children. She runs a firewood and palm oil business. Pauline lives and sells her products in Bamenda, Cameroon, near GHAPE. She will use her loan to purchase firewood, palm oil, rice, corn and beans to resell at her store on Foncha Street. 
 
This is Pauline’s seventh loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2001. She has had her business for long enough to know that she will be successful with this loan. She sees that her customers, that is, her community, benefit from her business because they do not need to travel as far to have access to firewood and her food products. She also sells her products at moderate prices, so she believes she is competitive.

She has used profits from previous loansto buy items for her business’s kitchen, essentially investing in her business. With this loan, she hopes to use the profits to pay for her children’s school fees and their books. Pauline prefers GHAPE loans because they allow long-term loans and that has helped her be able to invest in her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor Hugo, vive en la zona de Chamoco Chico, un populoso barrio de la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica al diseño gráfico, dueño de una pequeña imprenta. El Sr. vive con sus hermanos menores a quienes mantiene en alimentación y estudios.
El Sr. Trabaja con la institución desde hace un año, solocitó este microcrédito por la necesidad de comprar de materia prima para elaborar invitaciones, además tiene la necesidad de arrendar un pequeño local para instalar su imprenta, se proyecta como un cliente emprendedor, razón por la cual será fondeado por Kiva.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo lives in the Chamoco Chico area, a populous neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He is a graphic designer, and owner of a small press. He lives with his younger siblings, whom he supports, providing them with food and an education. Victor Hugo has been working with the Institution for a year, and is requesting this microloan in order to buy materials to make invitations. He also needs to rent a small shop to install his press. He appears to be a hard working client, which is the reason he will be funded by Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and renting a shop

loans.name: María De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora María M. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de tortillas en su municipio de Chinandega en el mercado Central donde posee nueve años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

Actualmente con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio dedica su tiempo a preparar el maíz todos los día para su respectiva elaboración y venta de tortillas y esta vez ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dicho maíz. Espera ser beneficiada con este crédito para así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria M. makes tortillas in the municipality of Chinandega in the Central market, something she has been doing for nine years. With great effort and sacrifice she dedicates her time to preparing corn every day in order to make and sell tortillas. She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase corn. She hopes to receive this loan in order to be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw material

loans.name: Petrona Cecilia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega la señora Petrona E. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras las cuales son comercializadas por ella misma con el propósito de mantener a su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos a los que debe de mantener.

Es importante destacar que ella ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel y hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito para la compra de sus verduras y así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinadega, Mrs. Petrona E. works hard selling vegetables. She sells them herself with the goal of supporting her family. She has two small children whom she supports. It is important to note that she has been able to make progress thanks to the loans provided by Ceprodel. Today she is requesting a new loan to purchase vegetables and continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa S. es una dama que se dedica a su actividad de venta de comida en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a laborar desde hace cuatro años con gran ahínco y dedicación en su trabajo.

Con el fin de salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su hogar, la señora Rosa ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para comprar la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos ya que requiere de esto y al tener el dinero proceder a la compra de los alimentos. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente porque mejora sus condiciones en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa S. is a woman who sells meals in the La Terminal Market in the city of Chinandega. She has been working there for four years with great enthusiasm and dedication to her work. With the goal of improving her situation and supporting her family, Rosa has come to Ceprodel to request a loan which she needs to buy ingredients to make food. Once she has the money she will purchase food. She will benefit greatly from this loan because it will improve her business conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Raihona

texts.ru: Райхона уже получала займ на КИВА. С прошлого раза в ее личной жизни произошла большая перемена – Райхона развелась со своим мужем. Теперь она проживает одна со своими детьми. Несмотря на тяжелую экономическую ситуацию Райхона продолжает заниматься предпринимательством, так как это единственный источник дохода для ее семьи. Полгода назад она ее ездила по окрестным базарам. Сейчас она арендует небольшой прилавок на центральном рынке города и там торгует. Уже на новом месте она приобрела много новых постоянных клиентов. Сейчас наступает сезон продажи весенней одежды и Райхона решила обратиться в Микроинвест для получения нового займа.
texts.en:
Raihona has already received a loan from Kiva. Since the last loan there has been a big change in her personal circumstances - Raihona and her husband divorced. Now she is living alone with her children. Despite the tough economic situation, Raihona continues as an entreprenuer, as business is the sole source of income for her family. Six months ago she traveled between the outlying markets. Now she rents a small stall at the city's central market and sells there. She has already earned many new and regular customers at the new location. The sales season for spring clothes is beginning now, and Raihona decided to request another loan through Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for the spring season

loans.name: Soima

texts.ru: Соиме исполнилось 39 лет, замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России как и многие в ее кишлаке. Он присылает денег на содержание семьи, но дети растут и чтобы покрыть все расходы семьи Соима занимается мелким предпринимательством – продает детскую одежду и обувь. На данный момент постоянной работы в регионе для женщин нету, те работы, которые есть низкооплачиваемые. За товаром Соима ездит за 170 километров от дома на оптовый рынок. Постоянного места для торговли нету и Соима ездит на окрестные рынки. Торговля неважная но получаемая прибыль покрывает все расходы по бизнесу и также остается на расходы семьи. Соима планирует немного расширить свой бизнес и пришла в Микроинвест для получения займа. На полученный займ собирается закупить новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Soima is 39 years old, married, and is raising 4 children. Her husband is working in Russia, as are many from her town. He sends home money to support the family, but the children are growing and to cover all the expenses Soima has a small business - selling children's clothing and shoes. At this time there is no permanent employment for women in the region, and that which there is is very low paying. Soima travels 170 kilometers from her home to the wholesale market to buy her goods. Having no permanent place to sell at, she travels between the area's markets. Sales are not great, but the profit covers the business's expenses with some leftover for the family. Soima decided to expand her business a little and came to Microinvest for a loan. She plans to use the laon to buy a new assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new inventory

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El sr. Alfonso, es viudo desde el año 2005, muy buen cliente, vive con su nieto quien es como su hijo, esta todavía en edad escolar. Tiene su movilidad de la cual recibe la renta cada semana. Se compró recién una casita, ya que antes vivía en alquiler, pensando en dejarle algo a su nieto. El crédito será invertido en la compra de llantas para la movilidad. Como segunda actividad lava automoviles para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Alfonso, a widow since 2005, is a good client who lives with his school-aged grandson and whom he raises as his son. He owns a taxi, which provides for his financial needs. He also washes cars to earn extra income. He recently bought a house -- he had rented previously -- hoping to eventually leave it to his grandson. The loan will be used to purchase tires for his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Xushbaxtchon

texts.ru: Хушбахтчону исполнилось 22 года, он неженат. Закончив школу стал подрабатывать на местных рынках и продавать сухофрукты. Живет вместе с родителями, получаемый доход приносит в семью. Прибыль небольшая, но позволяет покрывать некоторый расходы своей семьи. Узнав про Микроинвест он решил обратиться сюда за получением займа и планирует закупить оптом сушенные абрикосы. Полученный займ собирается погасит  в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Xushbaxtchon is 22 years old and unmarried. After finishing school he went to work selling fruit at the local markets. He lives with his parents and he brings his earnings home to his family. The profit is small, but it permits him to cover certain family expenses. After learning of MicroInvest, he decided to ask for a loan, and he plans to purchase dried apricots in bulk. He aims to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dried apricots

loans.name: Umarhoja

texts.ru: Умарходже 30 лет, женат. Его жена нигде не работает, сидит дома с 3-мя малолетними детьми. Ранее Умарходжа ездил в Россию на заработки, но постепенно те места где он подрабатывал не покрывали его расходов и он решил приехать в Таджикистан и начал здесь заниматься предпрнимательством. Направление его бизнеса – это реализация электротоваров (электропровода, лампочки, предохранители и тп). Бизнес налажен и имеет постоянных клиентов. В данном бизнесе не помешает привлечение дополнительных денег и Умарходжа решил обратиться в Микроинвест за займом.
texts.en:
Umarhoja is 30 years old. He is married. His wife is unemployed - she is a stay-at-home mom. Umarhoja used to do seasonal work in Russia but with time his earnings stopped covering his expenses, and he decided to come back to Tajikistan and start his own business. Now he sells electrical appliances (wires, lamps, etc.) The business is run well; Umarhoja has regular clients. Since in business extra cash never hurts, Umarhoja decided to get a loan from Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: LA sra. Wilma es una cliente antigua y muy puntual de la agencia, se dedica a realizar manualidades, como pintado en tela, bordado, macramé, muñecos en soft. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad, sus nietos siempre están pendientes de ella. Dicta clases a señoras que deseen aprender a bordar y pintar en tela, y otras manualidades que ella sabe hacer. El crédito será invertido en la compra de material, como pintura, tela, hilos, etc. para dictar clases.
texts.en:
Wilma is one of the agency's oldest and most punctual (re-payment) clients. She dedicates herself to various craftworks such as fabric painting, embroidery, macrame, and doll-making. Her children are now adults, and her grandchildren always keep an eye out for her. She teaches classes to women who wish to learn how to make craftworks like fabric paintings and embroideries. The loan will be used to buy materials such as paint, fabrics, threads, etc. for use in her classes.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase craftwork materials

loans.name: Mukamarhon

texts.ru: Мукарамхон активная клиентка Микроинвест. Получаемые ею займы и ее собственные деньги успешно оборачиваются в ее бизнесе и Мукарамхон довольна. Она по прежнему ездит за товаром  на дальние оптовые рынки. В ее бизнесе много трудностей, но Мукарамхон хорошо справляется. Она мечтает о тех временах, когда сможет накопить достаточно денег и приобрести маленький магазинчик и торговать там. Успешно погасив последний займ Мукарамхон решила обратиться за новым займом. Новый займ нужен для увеличения ассортимента легких летних тканей.
texts.en:
Mukaramhon is an active client of Microinvest. Cash flows thanks to the loans and her own money, which is why Mukaramhon is pleased. She still travels to faraway wholesale markets to purchase goods. Although her business isn't easy, she manages well. She dreams of the times when she would be able to save enough money for buying a small store. Having paid off her recent loan, Mukamarhon decided to apply for another loan, this time for increasing the assortment of light summer fabric.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase light summer fabric

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is twenty–seven years old. She is single and lives independently. Mary lives in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Bekwai work in commercial activities.

She trades in fresh yam and garments of clothing to make an income to support herself. She procures the fresh yam all the way from Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo Region where the price is quite economical. Mary distributes the yam to retailers and food vendors in her community. She sells the rest from a table top stall in the market square. She has been in business for ten years. Mary wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure tubers of yam in bulk. She hopes to save more money before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To purchase tubers of yam and garments of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mara Karina

texts.es:
Mara inició el negocio  para poderle dar un mejor nivel de vida a su hija, por eso decidío abrir su negocio  y gracias a Dios le va muy bien.
Comenzó el negocio en Diciembre del 2006 con ayuda de su mamá que ya tenia experiencia en la venta de ropa y la cual en su momento le financio para emprender este proyecto  y pudo llevar a cabo la instalación de su tienda de ropa

Al principio fue un poco difícil porque el acreditarse tarda un poquito, empezo trayendo ropa de temporada y novedades y fue asi como las chicas se fueron acercando y logro hacerse de cleintes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN  $3,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar ropa de la temporada de verano y tener variedad para ofrecrle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mara began her business in order to provide a better life for her daughter, because of this decision to open her business, things have been going very well for her. Her business began in 2006 with the help of her mother who already had experience selling clothes. She was also able to get financing that allowed her to start her business.

At the beginning, it was a little difficult to get accounts with clothing distributors, but little by little, she was able to get clothing for the seasons and the latest styles. Girls started coming to her store and she was able to make them her customers.

She needs a loan for $200 that she will repay in 8 bi-monthly payments. She will use the money to buy summer clothing and to have a greater variety of clothing to offer to her customers.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana inicio su negocio al morir su padre ya que, quedo a cargo de este y quizo continuar con la enseñanza que le dejo,  la mejor herencia era el trabajo, así es que decidío estar al frente de la carnicería desde febrero de 1997

Gracias a su esfuerzo ha ido progresando y además de vender carne empezo a promocionar la venta de refrescos y luego en sus ratos libres la venta de arreglos florales, así es como ha crecido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 que pagra en 8 catorcenas que le ayudara a tener mas liquidez y abastecer de mas mercancía el negocio, ya que vienen tiempos en los que la gente por el calor decidirá irse a tomar un refresco a las orillas del río asando una buena carne y desea tener esta mercania para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana took over her father's business after he died. She was left in charge of the business and she wanted to continue using the skills that her father taught her. The greatest inheritance that she received from her father was the knowledge that he left her. So she took over his butcher shop in February 1997.

Thanks to her hard work, the business is doing well and in addition to selling meat, she also started selling soft drinks. In her free time, Juana makes floral arrangements.

Juana needs a loan of $200 which she will repay in 8 bi-monthly payments. The money from the loan will allow her to stock her business with more merchandise. Now that the weather is warming up, people come to her store to buy meat and soft drinks so that they can have BBQ's by the river.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio inició el negocio antes de tener su farmacia, ella trabajo en una, vio que era un buen negocio y decidío abrir una.
Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 1999 busco un lugar apropiado con amplio mercado, poca competencia y con recursos propios y de su esposa, juntos emprendieron su proyecto y ahora es una realidad.

La experiencia en farmacia al dar alguna asesoría y los descuentos con sus proveedores le permiten ofrecer a sus clientes algunos productos a precios accesibles además de la buena atención y horario disponible.


El necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para aumentar sus inventarios, mejorar la atención al cliente, ya que en ocasiones la demanda es mucha y el surtido de medicamentos es poco.
texts.en:
Mauricio started in the business before opening his own pharmacy. He used to work in one, saw that it was a good business, and decided to open his own. He started his business in April 1999. He looked for a good location with ample demand and little competition, and using their own resources, he and his wife embarked on their project, which is now a reality. His prior experience dispensing advice, and discounts from his suppliers allow him to offer his customers products at reasonable prices, as well as good customer service and accessible hours of operation. He needs a loan of MXN $3000, which he will pay off in 8 bi-weekly payments, to increase his inventory and improve his customer service, as sometimes the demand is too high and the supply of medicines is too low.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba inició el negocio para tenar un ingreso extra para poder solventar gastos familiares y al mismo tiempo estar al pendiente de su hija, por lo que empezó a vender ropa de segunda mano en su casa, poco a poco fue haciendo clientes y ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio, con tu apoyo esto será posible.
texts.en:
Rosalba started her business as a way to earn extra income to cover household expenses and take care of her daughter. She started selling second-hand clothing out of her house, getting new customers little by little, and has managed to increase her sales. Now she needs a loan of MXN $3000, which she will pay off in 8 bi-weekly payments, to purchase more merchandise and continue with her business. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia  inició el negocio porque ella anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa pero decidió dejar su trabajo y opto por poner un negocio. Comenzó el negocio en diciembre del 2008 vendiendo refrescos y papas fritas en su casa, poco a poco ha incrementado su inventario y ha logrado tener mas productos que le han solicitado sus clientes, por lo que ahora tiene una tienda en mejore condiciones.

Sin embargo requiere un crédito de MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas  para acondicionar su local y comprar mercancía, con tu apoyo Oralia hará crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Oralia started her business because she was previously working for a company but opted to open her own business. She started her business in December 2008, selling soft drinks and potato chips out of her home. Little by little she's increased her inventory and has managed to carry different products that have been requested by her customers, which is why she now has a store in better conditions. However, she is asking for a loan of MXN $3000, which she will pay off in 8 bi-weekly payments, to install air conditioning in her shop and to purchase more merchandise. With your support Oralia will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: install AC in her shop and purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is thirty–five years old. She is married and has a son who is currently in the basic school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Bekwai are involved in commercial activities. Abena’s husband is a mason by profession.

Abena trades to support her husband. She deals in secondhand textile materials such as towels and bed sheets. She buys bales of secondhand textiles from the wholesalers in Kumasi and retails her goods in her community. Abena has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to buy more bales of second hand textiles. It is her dream to support her husband financially to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure bales of second hand textiles

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda inició el negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con gastos familiares y estudios de sus hijos
Comenzó el negocio  en abril de 1996 inicio vendiendo sandwich y tacos en la hora de salida de los niños en escuelas. 
Su negocio ha ido progresando  desde que inicio a la fecha  ya que ahora  tiene un local instalado dentro de la escuela  en el cual ahora vende mas variedad de alimentos, y por lo tanto mas ganancias

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas para comprar materia prima y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Imelda started her business in order to help her husband with household expenses and tuition for their children. She started her business in April of 1996, selling sandwiches and tacos after school. Her business has progressed since it opened, since now now has a store inside a school in which she sells a variety of foods, which means more earnings. She needs a loan of MXN $4000, which she will pay off in 12 bi-weekly payments, to purchase more raw materials and to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ana Lili

texts.es:
Ana Lili inició el negocio para distraerse despues descubrío que por medio de ello podría ayudar a su familia, actualmente es lo que hace, así puede darle estudios de calidad a sus hijos.

Comenzó el negocio enero 2008 anteriormente tenia una miscelánea, pero el margen de utilidad era muy bajo, por lo que decidío ofrecer productos por catalogo, donde la utilidad fuera mayor y el tiempo de inversión fuese menor, después busco  artículos para ofertarlos en su casa como regalos y novedades, y a la fecha combina las dos cosas.

En sus ratos libres visita a sus amistades y les ofrece algún producto o los invito a que pasen a su domicilio para que vean las novedades que tiene, de ahí ha logrado crecer significativamente puesto que ellos mismos la recomiendan y asi cuando alguien va a ir a una fiesta vienen en busca de regalos.

Ella necesita un pretsmao por MXN $ 3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas  para aumentar sus inventarios y tener diversidad de productos  para que los clientes quienes hacen posible que su negocio fructifique y les pueda dar una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Lili began her business as a hobby, but discovered that it allowed her to help her family and provide her children with a good education. She started the business in January of 2008. Previously she owned a small store, but the profit margin was very low. She then decided to offer products from catalogs, which had a better profit margin and required less time. Later she began to sell gifts and novelty items from home, and now the two activities combined make up her business. In her free time Ana Lili visits friends and presents products from her catalogs, or invites her friends to pass by her house to see new arrivals. In this way her business has grown significantly; her friends recommend her to their friends, and that way when anyone needs a gift for a party they will go to Ana Lili. She needs a loan of 3,000 MXN that will be repaid in 8 payments, made every 14 days. The loan will be used to increase the size and variety of Ana Lili's inventory, so that the clients that make her business possible can find what they need, and so that Ana Lili can provide her family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca  inició el negocio porque es una actividad que le gusta, ya que en la juventud estudio belleza y posteriormente vio que tendría buenos ingresos y decidió dedicarse a ello.
Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1996 inició trabajando en sociedad con su hermana, en un salón de belleza, después decidío independizarse con el apoyo familiar y emprendío sola su propio negocio en otro lugar. 

A través de volantes dio a conocer sus servicios como cultora de belleza, empezo con sus vecinos y la calidad de su trabajo la fue recomendando, posteriormente hizo promociones para atraer mas gente, de donde obtuvo buenos ingresos lo que le permitió equipar el local.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para  tener mejor calidad de materia prima pues es mas alto el precio, así como diversidad de  productos, lo que será atractivo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca began her beauty salon business because she enjoys the work. She studied beauty when she was younger, and later realized that it could earn her a good income. She began working in March 1996, initially working together with her sister in a beauty salon. Later she decided to start her own business with the support of her family, and opened her own salon in another location.

She started with her neighbors and soon was recommended for the quality of her work. She also ran promotions to attract more clients, growing her income and enabling her to better maintain her salon. Blanca will use the loan, which she'll repay in 8 payments, to purchase better quality supplies and products which her clients will appreciate.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase higher quality products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. María Isabel vive en la zona de Villa Victoria, un barrio popular de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja con Emprender desde el 14 de Julio de 2007, en sus inicios trabajó solicitando créditos en bancos comunales donde su desempeño con respecto a su historial crediticio fue excelente. La cliente se dedica a la repostería haciendo pan y tortas, galletas y repostería en general en su propio domicilio, en el cual vive junto a su hermana y madre y su pequeño hijo ya que es madre soltera. Con esaactividad  sustenta su hogar ya que juntamente a su hermana, son quienes se hacen cargo de todos los gastos familiares. Tiene la aspiración de poder ahorrar y solicitar un nuevo crédito para instalar su panadería en un local más comercial en el cual pueda incrementar su venta.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel lives in Villa Victoria, a highly-populated neighborhood in La Paz. She has been working with Emprender since July 14th, 2007. She began seeking loans at community banks where she distinguished herself due to her excellent credit history. Maria Isabel runs a confectionary within her house, dedicating herself to making bread, cakes, cookies, as well as general bakery items. She's a single mom who lives with her child, as well as her mom and sister. Maria and her sister provide for the financial needs of the entire house and family. She hopes to use the money she has saved -- plus funds from an additional loan -- to open a bakery in a more commercial area, which will allow her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos  inició el negocio despues de  emigrar de Tampico, y de llegar al que es ahora su domicilio pues no había tiendas cercanas y su esposa y el decidieron abrir uns toenda y a la fecha les ha fructificado mucho.

Comenzó el negocio en Septiembre del 2006 vendiendo refrescos y un poco de abarrotes, pero conforme paso el tiempo los proveedores se acercaron a su tienda y fue asi como metieron a la venta papas fritas, galletas y demás, cosas que la gente buscaba y pues a la fecha han podido responderles.

les ha ido muy bien, en casi tres años del negocio las ventas cada vez son mejores, la gente los busca mas porque sabe que tienen lo que necesitan a muy buen precio, y eso los hace ser los favoritos en la colonia.


El neecsita un prestamo por $3000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas para comprar una vitrina y ahí poder tener artículos de papelería, ya que eso nos hace falta y los estudiantes buscan mucho, por lo que ahora quiere ampliar su negocio dando este servicio tambien.
texts.en:
Carlos started his business after emigrating from Tampico. He found that there weren't any nearby stores by his house so he and his wife decided to open a store and to this date it has been fruitful to them. He began the business in September 2006 selling refreshments and some groceries, but as time went on, suppliers approached the store and that is how they ended up selling potato chips, cookies and more things people wanted. To this date the store has been able to respond to those needs. So far they have done very well. In almost three years of business, sales have increased; people seek them more because they know they have what they need at an affordable price, and that makes them the favorites in the neighborhood. He needs a loan for $3000 that he will pay in 6 two-week installments so he can buy a display case to show office supplies, since that is what they need and students seek a lot. He wants to expand his business giving this service as well.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a display case

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga inició el negocio cuando una  comadre que es su vecina le dijo que porque no vendía alimentos en su casa,  al principio no quería porque decía que era mucho trabajo, pero se animo y  le fue gustando esta actividad.
Comenzo el negocio en enero del 2008 al principio solo vendía taquitos, sopes y tostadas, pero poco a poco fue haciendo  mas comidas que le solicitaban, como menudo, pozole, tamales, quesadillas y gracias a su buen servicio hay mas gente que va a comer a su local.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas para  afianzar bien el techo del negocio ya que es de lona, y quiere comprar un toldo firme. Con tu apoyo la Sra. Dominga saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Dominga began her business when the godmother of her children, who happens to be her neighbor, asked her why she didn't sell food at home. At first she didn't want to because she said it was a lot of work, but she became enthused and ended up liking the activity. She began the business in January 2008. In the beginning she sold tacos, sopes and tostadas, but little by little she began making food her customers requested like menudo, pozole, tamales, and quesadillas. Thanks to her good service there are more people who eat at her establishment. She needs a MXN $3000 loan that she will pay in 6 two-week installments to finance the roof over her business, since it's canvas, and she would like to buy a firm canopy. With your help, Mrs. Dominga will come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a canopy

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María Teresa, vive en la zona de Villa Victoria, conjuntamente a su hermana la Sra. María Isabel, quien tambien es cliente de Kiva y de Emprender, aunque ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades viven en el mismo domicilio junto a su señora madre ya que su padre falleció hace algunos años.
La Sra. Maria Teresa, se dedica a la mecánica dental, trabajo que realiza arduamente en un pequeño taller ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa lives in Villa Victoria with her sister Maria Isabel who is also a client of Emprender and Kiva. Although they dedicate themselves to different careers, they live in the same house with their mother (their father passed away a few years ago). Maria Teresa dedicates herself to providing dental care, a service that she runs out of a small shop within her house. She has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible worker.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуде 65 лет, но несмотря на свой возраст продолжает заниматься предпринимательством. Времена сейчас тяжелые и если пропустить несколько дней без торговли, то убыток составит многие сомони. Мавчуда продает мелкие товары – носки, нитки, иголки, детскую одежду и тп. Торгового прилавка нету и Мавчуда сидит прямо на земле посреди торговых рядов. И так и в холод и в жару. Недавно Мавчуда решила получить займ для развития своего бизнеса и для этого обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Mavchuda is 65 years old but in spite of her age, she is still involved in entrepreneurial activities. The times are hard, and several days of no sales bring a loss of many somonis. Mavchuda sells many things – socks, thread, needles, children’s clothing, etc. Because she does not have a counter, Mavchuda sits on the ground between market rows, no matter whether it is cold or hot outside. Recently Mavchuda decided to apply for a loan and turned to Microinvest for help.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Maritza Pascuala

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de Chinandega la señora Maritza Q. se dedica a su actividad de venta de alimentos el cual son comercializados por ella misma y a pesar que no posee un tramo propio se establece en las cercanías del mercado con su cocina ofertando los alimentos.

La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito ya que le urge la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y por esta razón confía plenamente en que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinandega, Ms. Maritza Q. sells food she makes, and despite that she doesn't have her own establishment, she's situated near the market offering her food. The reason why she sought Ceprodel for help is to obtain a loan since she needs to buy raw material to prepare food. She is confident that the loan will be given to her satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to make food

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rosa de Villa.
Emperatriz es casada tiene 53 años, cuatro hijos mayores que están casados. 
Ella tiene un local que lo alquilaba para restaurante por mucho tiempo, y el inquilino se fue, ella vio la oportunidad para poner un restaurante pero administrado por ella y con la ayuda de su familia pudo lograrlo.
Hace cuatro años funciona su restaurante se llama “Como en el muelle” ella es la que cocina y tiene dos personas mas que le ayudan. Por las tardes ella se dedica a coser ropa.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar ha logrado comprarse varias cosas para su negocio como refrigeradora, una máquina de coser.   
Emperatriz necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, para comprar cerveza, aceite arroz. 
El sueño de Beatriz es seguir avanzando en el negocio, también le gustaría viajar.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. She is married and 53 years old, with four older children who are married. She has a premses that was rented to her for a long time to use as a restaurant. The landlord left and she saw the opportunity to begin and manage her own restaurant and with the help of her family she was able to achieve that. Her restaurant, "Como en el muelle," has been in business for the past four years. She is the one who cooks and she has two more people who help her. In the afternoons she works sewing clothing. Since she has been a part of Finca, she learned to save and has bought herself many things for her business, like a refrigerator and a sewing machine. Emperatriz needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy beer, oil, and rice. Beatriz's dream is to continue advancing the business. She would also like to travel.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Emperatriz needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy beer, oil, and rice

loans.name: Khursheed Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Khursheed baji is the wife of N. A. and has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Her husband has been running a grocery shop in the community for the last 5 years. People come to his grocery shop to buy groceries. 

Khursheed baji is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son works in a factory on monthly wage. The others are getting an education from a school located near her house. She is involved in a clothes sewing business. She charges $2 per dress and her customers are mostly her neighbors. She saves her income in a committee and wants to renovate her house with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store. 

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Sajida parveen baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor repair workshop. Munawar sarwar baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Rosalía es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rosa de Villa. 
Rosalía es madre soltera, tiene 56 años, cinco hijos ellos son  mayores y están casados. 
Sus vecinos le dieron la idea de dar pensión,  por que ella cocina bien, fue así como empezó a dar pensión en su casa,  cuenta con personas que le ayudan. Su negocio de venta de comida tiene ocho años. También tiene un negocio de fabricación de calzados.
Desde que entro a Finca, recibió mucha ayuda, con los préstamos como  con charlas de orientación,
Rosalía  inicia su negocio con Finca, se puso a vender calzados, actualmente  esta fabricando calzado de colegio.   
Necesita  un préstamo  de 1400 soles, para la ampliación de su cocina, le va poner piso de losetas.
El sueño de Rosalía es construir su casa, y poner un restaurante grande.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. She is a single mother, 56 years old, and has five cihldren who are older and married. Her neighbors gave her the idea of providing lodging because she cooks well. This is how she began to provide lodging in her home, and she depends on people to help her. She has been in the business of selling food for eight years. She also has a business making shoes. Since she entered Finca, she has received a lot of help with the loans such as orientation discussions. Rosalía began her business with Finca. She began selling shoes and now is making shoes for school uniforms. She needs a loan of 1400 soles to expand her kitchen. She is going to put in a tile floor. Rosalía's dream is to build herself a house and put in a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1400 soles to expand her kitchen and install a tiled floor

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr. A., trabaja con Emprender desde el año pasado inició con los microcréditos por recomendación de una cliente de la institución. Se dedica al transporte urbano de pasajero, actividad con la cual lleva día a día el sustento al hogar, su esposa es tejedora de mantas que vende en los mercados y ferias de la ciudad allá tambien es cliente de Emprender y de la misma manera aporta a la economía familiar ambos viven en una humilde casita junto a sus dos pequeños hijos quienes estan en la escuela. Todos colaboran con la limpieza y el orden en el hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitó este crédito para reparar su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mr. A. has been working with Emprender since last year. He started with microcredit on the recommendation of another client of the institution. A. works transporting people within the city, which covers the day-to-day costs of keeping a home. His wife weaves blankets and sells them in local markets. She is also a client of Emprender and the two live in a humble house with their two small children, who attend school. They all work to keep the house clean and orderly. A. is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora María P. se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante teniendo su propia pulpería que ha logrado levantar a raíz de muchos sacrificios en su localidad.

Desde que inició el negocio vendía pocos productos pero al paso de los años ha desarrollado su negocio y esto se lo debe a los créditos brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta forma salir adelante para su desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, María P. has distinguished herself as an excellent entrepreneur, having succeeded in bringing her grocery store to fruition after many sacrifices. She began selling very few products, but after a few years she has developed her business, which is why she has earned credit with Ceprodel. She is now soliciting a loan to buy more products so she can move even further in her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Razia Begum Riaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Razia begum baji is a widow and a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband left her with no financial resources. Razia baji bears the hardships all alone. She started sewing clothes day and night to survive with her three children: two daughters and one son. She didn’t remarry because she focused only on her children and their future. She used her income to pay off their school fees. Now Razia baji’s eyesight doesn’t allow her to sew clothes. So she started selling fertilizer because in Vehari people mostly work in agriculture. So she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for selling.  

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shahadat baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy chickens for her chicken meat selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Felibretina

texts.es:
Felibretina es socia del Bancomunal  Santa Rosa de Villa.
Felibretina es conviviente, tiene 29 años  un hijo de ocho años que va a la escuela estatal.
Empezó a trabajar desde los 10 años en un mercado, de  joven salió embarazada y no pudo estudiar,  nuevamente se dedico a vender en un mercado; hace dos años puso una bodega en su casa.
Necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para agrandar su tienda falta construir un pedazo, y comprar mercadería, arroz leche, aceite.
El sueño de Felibretina es poner un mini marque, y alquilar un local.
texts.en:
Felibretina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. Felibretina lives with her partner, is 29 years old, and has an eight year old son who attends the state school. She began working at the age of 10 in a market, became pregnant at a young age, and was not able to study. She recently began working in the market, and two years ago installed a small grocery story in her home. She needs a loan of 1800 soles to enlarge her store, as there is still a portion to build, and to buy merchandise like rice, milk, and oil. Felibretina's dream is to put up a small awning and rent another premises.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1800 soles to enlarge her store and build another part, and to buy merchandise like rice, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Marlene Ines

texts.es:
La señora Marlene T. es una excelente comerciante que se ha destacado por vender golosinas en su propio tramo en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor hasta el atardecer.

Su negocio ha sobresalido por ser muy surtido y es de importancia destacar que ella no posee apoyo por lo que es madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener. Sin embargo Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por lo que le ha brindado créditos para la compra de las golosinas. Hoy en día una vez más espera ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta forma continuar con el mejoramiento de su negocio y así mantener a sus pequeños hijos que tanto requieren de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Marlene T. is an excellent merchant who has been exceptional in selling delicacies and sweets in her own section of the Central market in the city of Chinandega, where every day she begins her work in the early hours of the morning and continues until dusk.

Her business has stood out for having a wide assortment of stock. It is important to point out that she has no personal support, as she is a single mother with two children to maintain. However, Ceprodel has been a mainstay in her business because it has offered her loans for the purchase of delicacies and sweets. Now she is hoping once more to receive a loan and in this way to continue with the improvement of her business and thus take care of her little children, who so much need her support.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of delicacies and sweets

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rosa de Villa.
Maria es madre soltera tiene 52 años, cuatro hijos, mayores.
Maria empezó llevando menús a diferentes construcciones, hasta que se presento  para  consignación en una empresa grande en la cafetería, allí estuvo por años, por las tardes se dedicaba a la venta en su carrito  sanwichero 
Desde que esta en Finca Maria aprendió a ahorrar, a ser puntual en sus pagos, aprendió ha invertir a podido comprar un refrigeradora, las reuniones del Bancomunal son muy familiares.   
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para empezar un nuevo negocio de venta de caldo de gallina.
El sueño de Maria es tener un restaurante propio de venta de Caldo de Gallina.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. She is a single mother, 52 years old, and has four grown children. Maria began bringing home-cooked food to different buildings, until the opportunity arose to work in a big business in the cafeteria. She was there for many years, and in the afternoons she worked selling from her sandwich cart. Since joining Finca, Maria learned to save, to be punctual in her payments, and has learned she needs to invest to be able to buy a refrigerator. The Community Bank meetings are very familiar. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles to begin a new business selling chicken soup. Maria's dream is to have her own restaurant selling chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles to begin a new business selling chicken soup

loans.name: Bakhtawar  M. Ibrahim Group

texts.en:
Bakhtawar baji is a married woman and a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband is M. I. who has been running a CD shop in the market. People come to him to buy CDs. 

Bakhtawar baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a factory on monthly wages. Her daughters stay at home and do household work. Bakhtawar baji is involved in a knitting business. She knits bed sheets and sofa covers and sells them in a cloth market and earns a profit. She saves her income in a committee and plans to marry off her elder daughter with the committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy more CDs for her husband’s CD shop. 

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy CDs for a CD shop

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora María A. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee en el departamento de Chinandega donde a diario abre sus puertas para atender a sus clientes que requieren de los productos que ella vende.

A pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ella ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante y por esto es que ella ha acudido  a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la mercadería para continuar ofreciéndola en su negocio.
texts.en:
María A. runs a general store, which she owns in the department of Chinandega, where she opens her doors every day to attend to her clients who need the products she sells.

Despite the difficult economic situations that she has gone through, she has managed to do well, and it is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan for the purchase of merchandise in order to continue offering these goods for sale through her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
En Nicaragua, las mujeres se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras ya que velan por llevar el sustento a sus hogares y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Miriam Z. se dedica al negocio de venta de plátanos el cual posee y que ha venido mejorando poco a poco

La razón única por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un préstamo para la compra de los plátanos. Ella ha realizado la solicitud y espera en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma mejorará la situación de su negocio por medio de la compra de los platanos.
texts.en:
In Nicaragua, women are characterized as being very hardworking, as they watch over the management of their household livelihood and improve living conditions for their children. In the central market of Cinandega city, Miriam Z. has a business selling plantains, which she has been improving bit by bit.

The only reason for which she has turned to Ceprodel is because she needs a loan for the purchase of plantains. She has made the request and hopes that her loan will be granted, and in this way she will improve the standing of her business by means of purchasing the plantains.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plantains

loans.name: Luis Arnulfo

texts.es: El Señor Luis Arnulfo C. F. tiene 40 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Luis tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica a la que Don Luis se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de molino de maíz. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica pero es importante resaltar que su negocio surgió por la necesidad de apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Don Luis nos dice que con los financiamientos ha logrado sacar adelante a su negocio. Los propósitos de Don Luis son de ofertar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que es muy difícil debido a la interrupción de energía eléctrica. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento por lo que tendría que comprar  un motor de disel ya que así podría funcionar sin la necesidad de la energía eléctrica y ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Sus deseos son de comprar otra casa para establecer una pulpería y obtener ingresos de sus 2 negocios. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 12.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Luis Arnulfo C. F. is 40 years old and married. He has two children, both of whom study. His business is milling corn. He has been doing this for over four years, but it is important to note that his business came from the need to support his family. Luis has told us that the funding has enabled him to advance his business. Luis's goal is to offer better service to his customers, which is very difficult given the interruptions in electricity. For this reason, he is soliciting funding to buy a diesel engine so he can work without electricity and offer his customers better service. His dream is to buy another house to establish a grocery store and obtain an income from both of his businesses. The loan he seeks is for 12,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Albertina L. se dedica a su negocio de venta de mecates y por no tener un establecimiento propio, vende en las afueras expuesta en ocasiones al sol y al trabajo duro.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los mecates ya que requiere adquirirlos lo más pronto posible para su venta. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y sale adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Albertina L. has a business selling rope. Because she does not have her own shop, she sells in exposed places outdoors, at times in the sun and working very hard.

Now she has turned to Ceprodel with the aim of receiving a loan for the purchase of rope, as she needs to obtain it as quickly as possible for its sale. She will benefit tremendously with this loan, and make progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rope

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es: El grupo " Barrio Lindo" esta representado por la señora Julia y esta conformado por  16 mujeres  y 5 hombres. En general los socios (as) se dedican a actividades como el transporte publico D. pasajeros  y a la venta D. productos como ropa, perfumes, pan, caña, carne y a la elaboración D. pan y a la construcción D. viviendas. Ante cualquier adversidad saben como salir adelante  mediante el  esfuerzo y seriedad que les caracteriza es por eso que no tienen miedo a la competencia.  El crédito que les otorgó agrocapital  es para  compra D. insumos, mercadería, materiales  e instrumentos D. trabajo para poder mejorar en sus negocios e incrementar sus ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Una mayoría D. los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. así como en el manejo D. fondos otorgados y la responsabilidad que se necesita para poder cumplir  con sus obligaciones es por este motivo que la fundación agrocapital les brinda una ayuda para mejorar sus ingresos. existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Mirtha y Pedro, Tambien Diki y Wilmar los cuales son hermanos pero todos tienen independencia económica por lo que no existe riego dentro del grupo.
texts.en:
The Group "Barrio Lindo" is maD. up of 16 women and 5 men. The members work in various activities including public transportation, sales of products such as clothing, perfume, bread, sugar cane, meat, as well as construction of houses. This loan will be used to buy supplies, merchandise, materials, and work tools to grow their respective businesses and help improve the quality of life for their families. The majority of the members have experience in work groups and in managing grants. They are responsible and able to comply with their obligations, which is why the foundation, Agrocapital, is supporting them in their efforts to increase their income. There is a family relationship between Mirtha and Pedro, as well as with Diki and Wilmar who are brothers. However, each member has financial independence.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help fund the various businesses in this group, including public transportation, clothing sales and construction.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
La venta de verduras requiere en todo momento rápida rotación del producto por la razón de que es perecedero y si no se vende se descompone y no puede almacenarse. Es por esto que la señora María C. busca la manera de salir adelante en el negocio y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de las verduras ya que debe de brindar un buen producto a sus clientes antes de que se descompongan las verduras. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y logra seguir cubriendo la necesidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Selling vegetables always requires a quick product turnover, since it is a perishable product, and if it is not sold it goes bad and cannot be stored. This is why Ms. Maria C. is looking for the way to succeed in her business. She has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan; she will use this loan for the purchase of vegetables since she needs to offer good products for her customers before the vegetables go bad. She will greatly benefit from this loan and will be able to keep covering her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: La Exaltacion Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta representado por el señor Carlos y se encuentra cursando su primer ciclo y no presenta ningún parentesco dentro de mismo. Todos los socios del el banco comunal " la exaltación" se dedican a actividades comerciales vendiendo productos como ropa, cosméticos, comida, y algunos se dedican a actividades como la carpintería, soldadura de arco y oxigeno y a la confección de pantalones. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia en especial en la venta de productos es ahí donde prima la calidad del producto y la experiencia que tiene el socio para bajar los precios y hacer una mejor oferta al cliente. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería y  la compra de insumos para mejorar la calidad de sus productos incrementando así sus ingresos y de esa forma brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existe  gente que se encuentra trabajando por primera vez bajo la modalidad de grupos solidarios pero aquellos que tienen experiencia garantizan el cumplimiento del resto del grupo ya que confían en sus integrantes
texts.en:
This group is represented by Mr. Carlos L. and is in its first loan cycle. None of the group members are related to each other. All of the members of the “La Exaltación” Microfinance Institute partake in different business activities, such as selling clothing, cosmetics, or food. Others are in carpentry, metal arc welding, or make pants. As in all businesses, competition always exists, especially when selling goods. That is where the quality of the product is top priority, along with the entrepreneur’s experience in lowering prices and making deals with the customer. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise and supplies needed to improve the quality of their products, thus boosting profits and providing the group members’ families with a better quality of life. Within the group we can find people who are working in a solidarity group for the first time, but the other members who already have experience in this field promise that the loan obligation will be met because they trust the rest of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maribel Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maribel B. se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora el cual se dedica a su negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario abre las puertas de su casa para atender sus pulpería y así llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La razón por la que ella ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel es porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos y por este motivo es que muy confiadamente espera en Ceprodel para salir adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
Ms. Maribel B. has distinguished herself for being a hard working person who is dedicated to her small store in the city of Chinandega. She opens the doors of her house daily to service her small store and provide for her home. The reason she has requested the loan from Ceprodel is because she needs to purchase some products. She trusts that Ceprodel will help her be successful in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Troya Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal "Troya " esta representado por la señora Margott  y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la venta D. refrescos, productos D. limpieza, ropa, frutas dulces a la elaboración D. pan , al servicio D. mensajeria y al transporte público. Todos venden en mercados cercanos a sus barR. por lo que existe una gran competencia, pero los socios (as) se esfuerzan para sacar adelante su negocio y poder llevar la renta a su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. su material e insumos y al incremento D. capital para que su negocio genere mejores ingresos y así poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Los socios (as) ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidaR. por lo que conocen sus ventajas y beneficios en general tienen experiencia en el manejo D. los fondos otorgados y son gente honesta y responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Troya" is represented by Margott and formed by 12 members. They own various businesses such as the sale of drinks, cleaning products, clothes, fruits, candies and services like bread-making, message delivery, and public transportation. All of the members sell in markets near their neighborhoods, where there is much competition. Yet, the partners strive and continue moving forward with their businesses to bring in rent to their family.The loan will be used to increase the materials and supplies and raise capital for their businesses to generate income, so they can offer their families a better quality of life. The partners have already worked under the category of solidarity groups so they understand the advantages and benefits involved.
