In general, they have experience managing borrowed funds and they are honest and responsible with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business operations

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La venta de hoyas  metálicas, peroles y cucharas es el negocio de la señora Luz J. ubicado en la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario ofrece sus productos a la intemperie pero con grandes deseos de crecer y desarrollarse en su actividad.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy alegre y cuando sus clientes le visitan ella muy cortez les atiende y por ello se ha ganado el cariño y aprecio de muchos. Actualmente ella espera en que Ceprodel le brindará su apoyo ya que ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta manera seguir esforzándose en su negocio que requiere de mucha inversión.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Jarquin sells all types of large metallic pots, pans and spoons in her business located in the city of Chinandega where she offers her products daily on an outdoor store with the greatest desire to grow and develop her activity. She has distinguished herself for being a very happy person and when her customers visit her she provides very courteous service. This is why she has won over the support and care of many. Currently she hopes Ceprodel will provide the support she has requested with a loan that will be used for purchasing products; this way she will keep making an effort to maintain her business which requires a lot of investment.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Colquiri Group

texts.es: El grupo " Colquiri " esta representado por el señor Henry Ronaldo y conformado por 12 miembros dedicados principalmente al comercio D. productos como ropa, refrescos, abarrotes, cosméticos, material escolar y a actividades como el servicio técnico en informática pero en general al transporte publico D. pasajeros. La competencia es granD. en lo que se refiere al trasporte en especial con la apertura D. nuevas rutas y mayor cantidad D. vehículos, es por esta razón que se ven en la obligación D. trabajar en turnos nocturnos hasta altas horas D. la noche y parte D. la madrugada para llevar la renta a la familia. El destino del financiamiento es para la reparación D. sus vehículos y herramientas D. trabajo y al mejoramiento D. las mismas. Los miembros del grupo han demostrado ser personas responsables y cumplidas ya que se dedican a su trabajo para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida con su trabajo y esfuerzo, en su mayoría los socios conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios y conocen la responsabilidad D. sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The group "Colquiri" is represented by Henry Ronaldo and is by 12 members. Their businesses incluD. the sale of products like clothing, drinks, groceries, cosmetics, and school supplies and services like informational technology and public transportation of passengers. There is much competition, especially in public transportation with the amount of vehicles on the road and the creation of new routes. For this reason, they are responsible for working night shifts, from the middle of the night to dawn to bring rent to their families. The loan will be used for working tools, costs related to repairing vehicles, and costs related to improving their conditions in general. The members of the group are responsible and committed. They strive to bring the best quality of life to their families. The partners are familiar with operating under solidarity groups and they understand the responsibilities involved in these obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La Señora Paula T. M. tiene 60 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Paula tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Paula es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace mas de seis años que se dedica a este tipo de negocio sus inicios surgen por que su Mama le enseño este oficio y ella lo ha tomado como medio de supervivencia para su familia. Doña Paula tiene los propósitos de mantener a sus clientes ya que estos le solicitan variedad de productos y además tiene que cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado a la compra de materia prima como tela, hilo, agujas, encajes y tijeras. Los deseos son de mejorar cada día en la elaboración de sus sabanas, delantales y shorts. La cantidad necesaria es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula T. M. is 60 years old and single. Paula has three children, who all work. She works as a seamstress, and has done so for more than six years. She began when her mother taught her this skill, and she took it up as a means of supporting her family. Paula hopes to keep her clients, who seek a variety of products, and with whose orders she must comply. The funding is for working capital--she needs to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, needles, scissors and lace. Her wish is to improve every day in her production of sheets, aprons and shorts. She needs 9,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelson Ulises

texts.es:
El caballero Nelson C. es una persona muy dedicada al trabajo teniendo su pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es de importancia destacar que el señor Nelson ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel y hoy en día una vez más espera ser beneficiado con un nuevo crédito para la compra de los calzados ya que necesita invertir en su negocio para generar mayores utilidades y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson C. is a person who is very dedicated to working in his small shoe store in the central market of the city of Chinandega. It is important to point out that Mr. Nelson has been able to succeed thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel. Today he hopes to get the benefit of a new loan for the purchase of shoes since he needs to invest in his business to generate more profits and this way improve the quality of life of him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Tulipanes Group

texts.es: El grupo " Tulipanes " esta representado por la señora Eulogia y conformado por 12 miembros dedicados principalmente al comercio D. productos como abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, carpintería, leche y principalmente a al confección y comercialización D. prendas D. vestir. La competencia en el rubro D. la confección es bastante elevado ya que se tiene la ropa importada D. marca que tiene mas renombre, pero gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo han logrado abrirse paso en el mercado por su calidad y su bajo costo. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. material D. trabajo como tela e insumos D. costura para incrementar su producción y al mejoramiento D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar y ampliar su producción. Las socias del grupo saben trabajar con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones similares antes y conocen la responsabilidad y puntualidad que se requiere para cumplir con sus obligaciones y darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida gracias al apoyo D. la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group "Tulipanes" is represented by Eulogia and is formed by 12 members. Their operations incluD. the sale of products like cosmetics, milk and groceries in neighborhood stores, and services like carpentry, clothing-making and the marketing of garments. There is strong competition in the clothing-making business since imported brand-name clothing is more renowned. But, thanks to effort and hard work, they have achieved their place in the market for their quality and low prices. The loan will be used for increasing material to amplify production. The partners in the group are familiar with operating under solidarity groups since they have worked with similar institutions previously. They understand the responsibility and punctuality required to satisfy their obligations. They bring their families a better quality of life thanks to the help of Fundación Agrocapital (Agrocapital Foundation).

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Karla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Karla M. se ha destacado por preparar deliciosos platillos siendo su especialidad la elaboración de comida y dedicándose a esta actividad en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario atiende a sus clientes.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima y así mejorar las condiciones de vida propia y las de su familia que tanto requieren de apoyo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla M. has made a name for herself with her cooking. Her specialty is putting together tasty food dishes which she sells in Chinandega's Mercado Central, a place she goes daily to tend to her customers. It's important to note that she's applying for a loan from Ceprodel to buy basic supplies for her business and, in turn, improve not only her life but the lives of the members of her family, all of whom need help to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for food business.

loans.name: Claveles Blancos Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal "Claveles Blancos " esta representado por la señora Silvia y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como a la venta D. ropa, verduras, papa, abarrotes, comida, juegos electrónicos y a la elaboración D. pan. Pese a existir la competencia los socios (as) han sabido salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y a sus ganas D. salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para el incrementar sus ingresos y mejora la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Los socios (as) ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidarios por lo que conocen sus ventajas y beneficios en general tienen experiencia en el manejo D. los fondos otorgados y son gente honesta y responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The Claveles Blancos (White Carnations) community bank is represented by Silvia. Its 13 members operate a range of businesses selling products such as clothing, vegetables, potatoes, groceries, food, electronic games and making and selling bread. Despite competition, the group's members have forged ahead, relying on their experience and their drive to succeed. The loan will be used to buy goods and supplies that will, in turn, increase their incomes and improve the quality of life of their families. The members have worked within the strictures of community banks before so they know the advantages and benefits of them. Generally, they have experience managing borrowed funds and handle them honestly and responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Su Nombre es Nicasio Antonio R. tiene 65 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Nicasio tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Don Nicasio es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio por que debido a su edad no podía trabajar, por lo que decide establecer una pulpería en su vivienda y por un amigo acudió a los financiamientos y es así como poco a poco decide invertir en los productos. Los propósitos de Don Nicasio son de abastecerse lo suficiente de productos y así ofrecer lo necesario para sus clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que lo clientes buscan los productos mas  cotidianos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente y papel higiénico. Sus sueños son de sus sueños son proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que el año pasado no pudo hacerlo porque no obtuvo los ingresos suficientes. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Nicasio Antonio R. is 65 years old and married. He has 3 children, all working and independent. Don Nicasio operates a small grocery. He started the business 4 years ago because, at his age, he couldn't work. He decided to set the grocery up in his house and a friend advanced him some money so that, little by little, he's building his business. Don Nicasio's proposal is to stock a sufficient supply of products so that he can provide everyday items to his customers. The loan is for working capital that he will use to buy the products that his customers want for everyday use: rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, detergent and toilet paper. He greatest hope is to improve his house, something he wasn't able to do over the last year because his income wouldn't cover it. The amount that he needs is 6,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tiquipaya Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Tiquipaya" esta representado por el señor Mario Jose y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales tienen confianza en tre si, en general los socios se dedican a diferntes actividades entre ellas al comercio D. productos como venta D. comida, ropa, zapatos y a actividades como la elavoracion D. prendas D. vestir , construccion D. viviendas y a la atencion D. fortocopiadoras en la universidad. En todo rubro existe la competencia pese a ello todos los socios ponen su mayor esfuerzo para cumplir con sus familias y sus obligaciones a terceros. el destino del Financiamiento es para el incremnto del capital D. trabajo para la compra D. material D. trabajo e insumos para mejorar sus productos y la calidad D. los mismos. Los socios (as) cuentan con expereincia en grupos solidarios y cuentan con la capacidad para administrar sus fondos y cumplir con responsabilidad y honestidad con sus obligaciones. Dentro D. la Foto alguno D. los socios se encuentra acompañado D. sus esposas.
texts.en:
The "Tiquipaya" group is represented by Mr. Mario Jose and maD. up of 13 members who trust each other. The members do different commercial activities, such as selling food, clothes, shoes, making clothes, constructing homes, and attending to university photocopiers. In all of these fields there is competition, and they need to give their best effort, in order to proviD. for their families and other obligations. This financing is for increasing capital for purchasing goods and for improving of products. The members know from experience in solitary groups that they can administer their funds and fulfill their obligations responsibly and honestly. In the photo, some of the members are accompanied by their spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es: Juana Jeannette U. C. tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Juana tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Juana son dos una pulpería y además un cultivo de hortalizas por lo que aquí siembra tomates, cebollas y papas. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Todo inicio por que ella recorría las calles a vender sus hortalizas y con las pocas ganancias que obtuvo de logro establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, pero necesitaba más financiamiento por lo que acudió a Fundación León 2000 y fue así como logro salir adelante con su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de obtener más productos nuevos para su pulpería para que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. El motivo del financiamiento es para la inversión de productos en su pulpería. Por lo que sus sueños son que su pulpería pueda ser en un futuro una distribuidora y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Juana Jeannette U. C. tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Juana tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Juana son dos una pulpería y además un cultivo de hortalizas por lo que aquí siembra tomates, cebollas y papas. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Todo inicio por que ella recorría las calles a vender sus hortalizas y con las pocas ganancias que obtuvo de logro establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, pero necesitaba más financiamiento por lo que acudió a Fundación León 2000 y fue así como logro salir adelante con su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de obtener más productos nuevos para su pulpería para que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. El motivo del financiamiento es para la inversión de productos en su pulpería. Por lo que sus sueños son que su pulpería pueda ser en un futuro una distribuidora y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Tika Llajta Group

texts.es: El grupo " Tika Llajta " esta representado por la señora Margot y conformado por 13 miembros dedicados principalmente al comercio de productos como artesanías, atención en tiendas de barrio, comida, cosméticos, licores, comida y al transporte público. Pese a la competencia los socios (as) saben como salir adelante con su experiencia y con la voluntad de trabajar y esforzarse para sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materiales e insumos para incrementar sus negocios y mejorar su producto. Los socios (as) conocen del trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento de la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento que necesitan para cumplir con sus obligaciones y crecer en sus negocios mejorando la calida de vida de sus familias. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Silvia Janeth y el señor Jose luis ambos son hermanos pero con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no existe riesgo en el grupo.
texts.en:
The group "Tika Llajta" is represented by Ms. Margot and is made of 13 members. They are principally involved in selling handicrafts, especially related to neighborhoods, food, cosmetics, liquor and public transportation. It is up to the members to know how to move forward with experience and keep working and move their families forward. This financing is for buying materials, increasing business and improving products. The members know form working in supportive groups and working with groups similar to Foundation Agrocapital how to work with lots of responsibility, fulfill their obligations, grow their business and improve the quality of life for their families. There is a relationship between Ms. Silvia Janeth and Mr. Jose Luis and the group (two siblings), but they have independent loans and because of this have no risk in the group.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operacions

loans.name: Karla Marilet

texts.es: Karla Marilet F. H. tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Karla tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Karla es un taller de costura. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Karla inicio aplicando los conocimientos de confecciones obtenido en aquel entonces con una maquina de pedal, confeccionando trajes a sus amistades y fue así que se dio a conocer como una excelente costurera. Los propósitos de Doña Karla son de incrementar su negocio ya que así podría abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento es solicitado para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de uniformes y así poder convertirse en una futura empresaria. Sus sueños son de establecer una tienda que funcione como taller y la misma ves un lugar donde sus clientes aprecien sus productos. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 19.000 cordobas.
texts.en:
Karla Marilet F. H. is 33 years old and married. Karla has 4 children and all of them work independently. Karla works in sewing. She has been doing this for more than 20 years. Karla started applying her knowledge of dressmaking, using a pedal-run sewing machine and making dresses for her friends. This is how she learned that she is a great dressmaker. Karla wants to increase her business, and to do this she needs to meet the demand of her customers. The financing that she is asking for is for buying primary material to make uniforms-- and this way she can be a future businesswoman. Her dream is to establish a store that functions as a workshop and a place where her customers can look at her products. She is asking for C$19,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en: Potenciana P., 46 years old, married and a mother of 7 lives in Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. Currently, two of her children are married and four are in school. She is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store. She started the business with their savings from the salary of her husband. Currently, the store is stable but it generates low income due to low stock. That's why she wants to apply for a loan with HSPFI amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase additional grocery items, fertilizers and feeds. This will be her first loan with HSPFI and if it is granted, she can help to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, fertilizers and feeds for sale

loans.name: Timoteo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Timoteo Antonio C. Álvarez tiene 55 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general como: pantalones, camisas, shorts entre otras cosas. Hace mas de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio esta actividad la realiza todos los días de la semana y el control de los pagos de sus clientes es mediante el método de tarjetas ya que es aquí en donde apunta los abonos hechos por sus clientes, los ingresos que el obtiene son de su negocio y algunas veces los ingresos de su esposa que labora en la elaboración de tortillas. Los propósitos de Don Timoteo son de conseguir un lugar estable ya que actualmente tiene que recorrer las calles en busca de clientes. El financiamiento es solicitado para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podrá comprar mercadería como es ropa, perfumes y ropa interior. Sus sueños son de proporcionarle a su esposa un buen establecimiento para la venta de sus toritillas. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Timoteo Antonio C. Álvarez is 55 years old and married. He sells pants, shirts, and shorts, amongst other things. He has been doing this for 18 years, every day of the week. Control of payments is done by card, this way he keeps track of the payments made by customers. The loans that he receives are for his business, and, sometimes, for the business of his wife, a tortilla-maker. He wants to get a stable, permanent place-- now he walks around the streets looking for customers. This financing is for buying clothes, perfume and underwear. His dream is to provide his wife with a good establishement for selling tortillas. He is asking for C$9,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Juan Alberto T. tiene 40 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Juan tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la venta de medicina natural. Hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que el compra la mercadería en Managua y también compra productos embasados que dan la originalidad al producto, y en su casa el termina de proporcionarle otro ingrediente. Sus propósitos para el negocio son de  proveerlo lo suficiente de productos para que sus clientes regresen a su tienda ya que vende lo ellos necesitan. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar ungüentos, te de manzanilla y además tiene que viajar a los departamentos de León y Chinandega ya que gasta en  combustible porque viaja en una moto. Sus deseos son de tener su propia farmacia de productos medicinales y brindar el servicio a domicilio. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Alberto T. is 40 years old and single. Juan has 4 children. He sells natural medicine. He has done this for 7 years with merchandise from Managua. He also buys packaged materials that give the originality of the product, and in his house he finishes it with other ingredients. His propositions for the business are to provide his customers with enough products when they return to his store. This financing is to buy ointments of chamomile and to travel to a store in Leon and Chinandega, which costs because he travels by motorcycle. He wants to have his own pharmacy and provide services to the neighborhood. He is asking for C$9,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio V. quiere instalar protecciones en su vivienda para tener mas seguridad, la colonia donde viven son de interés social y apenas se esta poblando por lo que el piensa en el bienestar de su familia. El apenas tiene un hijo muy pequeño y aunque lo cuida su esposa, el teme que les vaya pasar algo mientras el trabaja. 
El señor Marco es una persona trabajadora el labora en una maquiladora de la ciudad y su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio V. wants to install security gates around his house to make it safer. The neighborhood where he lives is "de interes social" [government housing, perhaps?] and only recently settled so he's thinking about the well-being of his family. He has a young son and even though his wife takes care of the child, he's afraid that something might happen to them while he's at work. Marco is a hard-working man. He works at a factory in the city and his wife works as a cleaner.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy security gates for house.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Fernández T. se ve ala necesidad de ampliar su casa ya que donde vive es muy pequeño ya que son casas de interés social y todas son del mismo tamaño. Con el  préstamo empezaría  la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás para extender sala comedor. 
El es una persona trabajadora la cual ha permanecido en una maquiladora desde hace 9 años al igual que su esposa es de la manera que calificaron para obtener su casa pero ahora quieren hacerle mejoras para el bienestar de ellos como también el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel F. T. sees a need to expand the house where he lives, a government house that like other similar houses are the same small size. With the loan, he would begin building a room in the back of the house to extend the living-dining room outwards. He's a hard-working man who, for 9 years, has worked at the same factory where his wife works. That's how they qualified to get their house but now they want to improve it for the well-being of their children as well as themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Vandeth

texts.en:
Mr. Vandeth P. lives in Lvae Thmey village in Takeo Province. 

He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. He faces some problems because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to hire laborers to work in the field. Also, his field is far from irrigation systems, so he has decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, a water pump, and to hire laborers to work on the field. 

His wife, Mrs. Nget Sophal, is a housewife. Mr. Vandeth P. is a 58-year-old father of seven children. One child is a security guard, another is a grocer, three are farmers who help their father, and the remaining two are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, a water pump, and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús G. V. tiene un cuarto que aun no habita por que le faltan algunos detalles los cuales para el son primordiales para que se vea bien y presentable al momento de poner muebles. El quiere comprar vitropiso y pagar mano de obra. 
El ha sido buen cliente ya ha tenido crédito el cual pago muy bien el percibe ingresos de una tiende de abarrotes y trabaja como supervisor en una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Jesús G. V. has a room that he still has not moved it to it because it lacks some details that are essential to him. He needs the room to look good and presentable when he moves the furniture into it. He wants to buy vinyl flooring and also pay for labor to install the flooring. He has been a good customer and has already received loans which he repaid in a timely manner. He receives income from a mini market that he owns and he also works as a supervisor in a factory.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vinyl flooring and also pay for labor to install it

loans.name: Porch

texts.en: Mrs. Porch B. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo Province. She is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell and to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Yin Sovann, is a hard-working man. Mrs. Porch B. is 26 years old and the mother of a young child. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Mr. Tha B. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. He sells ice cream in the local district. His wife, Mrs. Khan Saran, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice to earn a living. 

She faces an obstacle because her field is infertile and is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mr. Tha B. has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer, fuel, and water to support the field. He will use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field. 

He is 42 years old and the father of four children. One child is employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fuel, and water, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila P. is 52 years old and a married mother of three children. She lives in Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells fish. Her husband is a fisherman and Mila sells the fish that he catches in the neighborhood and in nearby villages. Two of her children are in college and one is in high school. 

She started her business by applying a loan from loan sharks (5-6) who charged her a high interest payments. Currently, the store and fish vending operations are stable, but due to the increasing cost of school for her children, she needs to expand her business to generate more income. She needs a loan of of PHP 5,000 to purchase groceries to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Y. is 49 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. She is a mother of seven children. Four of her children are married and live independently, two others work in a garment factory, and the youngest one is a student. 

Y. is a widow. She has been serving porridge and rice for breakfast to her neighborhood from her house since 2005. She is a capable mother and a responsible neighbor. She gets up every early morning to prepare her food to sell. She is famous because she is good at making a tasty porridge with pork and grilled meat. 

She has earned a good profit from her business. She wants to build a small shop that provides meals for the whole day so that she can increase her income and prepare for the wedding of her next child. Y. is taking a loan of $1000 to build a small shop for her business. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a small shop for her business

loans.name: Srim

texts.en:
Mrs. Srim M. lives in Kbal Dam Rey village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows vegetables and rice. She faces a problem because her field is far from an irrigation system, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump machine to get water to support her field and make her crops more productive. 

Her husband, Mr. Ung Mao, is a fisherman and helps in his wife’s farm. Mrs. Srim M. is 35 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children is a construction worker, another is employed in a garment factory, and the youngest is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Mrs. Milagos, age 52, is married and has four children. For many years, she was relaxed and contented relying on her husband's income to support their family needs, but when her husband lost his job as a government employee for political reasons, she was compelled to engage in business. 

Fortunately, a neighbor introduced her to HSPFI to finance her business. She took a loan of PHP 5000 to start a business in which she buys and sells ready-to-wear items. With hard work and determination, she was able to expand her business. Now she needs PHP 8000 to purchased more stock to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more ready -to-wear items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma P., age 48, is blessed with two children who are now in college. Providing for the needs of her children prompted her to engage in business. Her husband is a construction worker and she can't rely on his income. With strong will, she borrowed PHP 5000 from HSPFI and she was able to open a food stall in the school canteen. Now she wants to buy raw materials in bulk, such as large sacks of flour and sugar, to produce more products on her own. Therefore, she needs PHP 7000 to purchase stock for her food stall and to support the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To buy raw material in bulk

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie T., 31 years old, is married and is blessed with four children. She lives in Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school and the eldest is in fourth grade. Their main source of income is the tricycle that they own. Her husband is the tricycle driver. (Tricycles are the mode of transportation in their province.) 

Currently, their tricycle is not working due to problems with the wheels and some spare parts that are not functioning. Her husband has started an art and sign printing business to earn an income while the tricycle is not working. She wants to repair the tricycle, so she needs PHP 5,000 for repair and maintenance. This will be her first loan from HSPFI and if it is granted, they can have a good and comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase wheels and spare parts for their tricycle

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita C. is a 49-year-old mother of one. Her husband is a plumber and her child is in elementary school.  Morita's primary source of income is weaving using pandan, which are the leaves of a palm-like plant, a skill that she learned from her neighbors. She also sells firewood out of her house and raises pigs.

Morita will use the money from this loan to buy rope made by other weavers in her community, which she will resell to fishermen and others via the local co-op. She also plans to buy a piglet and firewood for resale.

loans.use: To buy hand-woven rope from weavers for resale, a piglet, and firewood.

loans.name: 10- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
* Thôn 1 xã Quảng Hưng là một thôn nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Người dân ở đây sống chủ yếu bằng nghề nông và buôn bán nhỏ.Chị T. Thị Tráng là nhóm trưởng nhóm số 10,gồm 5 thành viên.Chị sinh được 3 người con, con trai đầu nghỉ học sớm để đi làm thợ xây phụ giúp gia đình, còn 2 con gái đang đi học.Chồng chị năm nay 49 tuổi,sức khỏe không được tốt cũng phải đi làm thợ xây để đỡ đần cho chị. Chị vay 2.442.600 đồng (~140 USD) để mua hoa quả bán rong. Đây là vốn thứ 3 của chị. Các vốn trước chị cũng đầu tư vào việc bán hoa quả và chị đã hoàn trả đầy đủ và đúng hạn .Hàng ngày chị lên thành phố mua trái cây như: cam, quýt, táo,xoài ,lê để đi bán,thời gian nào trái cây bán chậm chị lại chuyển sang bán rau, mong kiếm đồng lời để trang trải chi phí sinh hoạt trong gia đình và nuôi 2 con ăn học. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm cũng có cùng mức vay:
* Chị N. Thị Hà vay vốn để mua rau bán.
* Chị N. Thị Thơi vay vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng bán giải khát.
* Chị N. Thị Huệ vay vốn để mua rau bán.
* Chị
texts.en:
Village 1, Quang Hung Commune is one of the poor communes in Thanh Hoa province. The inhabitants make a living mainly by farming and petty trades. Mrs. Tran Thi Trang is the group leader of Group 10 consisting of 5 members. She has 3 children. The eldest son had to leave school early to work as a construction worker to support the family. The two daughters are going to school. Her husband is 49 years old. He is in a weak health condition but still works as construction worker to support the family. She wishes to borrow VND2,442,600 (about USD140) to buy fruits to resell. This is her third loan. The previous loans, invested in buying and reselling fruits, were fully paid on time. Everyday, she goes to the city to buy fruits such as oranges, mandarins, apples, mango, pears to resell. In the seasons not good for fruit sales, she switches to sell vegetables to earn some money to pay for living costs of the family and send her children to school. Other members of the group also request for the same amount of loan, as below:

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Ha borrows to buy vegetables to resell

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thoi borrows to invest in a beverage and soft drink shop

Mrs. Nguyen Thi Hue borrows to buy vegetables to resell

Mrs. Doi Thi Chien borrows to buy fishes and prawns to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fruits, vegetables, foods to resell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia P. is a 55-year-old married mother of one child. She asked for this loan to buy two piglets to raise. Besides raising pigs, Lucia also earns money by weaving items out of Nipa palm leaves and by running a sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: To buy two piglets

loans.name: 09 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
* Thôn 5 xã Quảng Hưng là một thôn nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Người dân sống chủ yếu bằng nghề nông và chăn nuôi. Nhóm số 09 gồm 6 thành viên. Chị H. Thị Nhâm làm nhóm trưởng, năm nay chị 32 tuổi.Chị sinh được 2 người con, các con của chị đều đang đi học. Con trai đầu của chị đang học lớp 5. Con gái thứ 2 đang học lớp 1. Chồng chị là N. Đình Lược, năm nay anh 35 tuổi. Gia đình chị kinh tế rất khó khăn, cả gia đình trông chờ vào 2 sào đất ruộng (1000 metter square), hàng ngày anh phải lên thành phố đi làm thợ xây để tạo thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị Nhâm ở nhà làm ruộng, ngoài ra chị còn tham gia sinh hoạt phụ nữ ở thôn. Nay chị vay mức vốn là 1.626.900VND (~93USD)để mua gà giống về nuôi.Các thành viên khác trong nhóm cũng có cùng mức vay gồm:
* Chị N. Thị Dung năm nay 24 tuổi, chị vay vốn để mua lợn giống.
* Chị N. Thị Mai năm nay 27 tuổi, chị vay vốn để mua cam, quýt, táo, lê đi bán.
* Chị L. Thị Hằng năm nay 46 tuổi, chị vay vốn để mua phân bón ruộng.
* Chị N. Thị Thắm vay vốn để mua gạo bán.
* Chị N. Thị Thiết năm nay 25 tuổi, vay vốn để mua phụ kiện cắt tóc.
* Trong ảnh chị Dung không có mặt vì bố chị bị ốm và đang nằm bệnh viện nên chị phải ở dưới  bệnh viện để chăm sóc ông.
texts.en:
Village 5 in Quang Hung commune is one of the poor villages inThanh Hoa province. The inhabitants make a living mainly by farming and raising livestock/poultry. Group 09 consists of 6 members. Mrs Hoang Thi Nham, group leader, is 32 years old. She has 2 children, both of them are going to school. Her elder son is at 5th Grade, and her younger daughter is at 1st Grade. Her husband is Mr. Nguyen Dinh Luoc, 35 years old. The economic situation of her family is very difficult as the family depends on the 1000 sq meters of farming land. Everyday he goes to the city to work as construction worker to support the family. Mrs. Nham stays at home to farm. She also participates in the Commune's Women Union. She wishes to borrow VND1,626,900 (about VND93) to buy baby chickens to raise. Other members of the Group request the same amount of loan, as below:

Ms. Nguyen Thi Dung, 24 years old, borrows to buy pigs to raise

Ms. Nguyen Thi Mai, 27 years old, borrows to buy fruits such as oranges, mandarins, apples, pears to resell

Ms. Lam Thi Hang, 46 years old, borrows to buy fertilizer for her farm

Ms. Nguyen Thi Tham borrows to buy rice to resell

Ms. Nguyen Thi Thiet, 25 years old, borrows to buy hair-dressing tools

Please note that Ms. Dung is not in the picture as she is at the hospital taking care of her father in law who is hospitalized.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy baby chickens to raise, fruits and rice to resell, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G., 50, is married, and still has a capacity to manage a variety store in her community. She started her small business with a small stock, then she joined HSPFI and received an initial loan of PHP 5000.

She never stops thinking about how to improve and sustain her business in the long run. She supports her two grandchildren and sends them to school, because they were left by their parents when they were very young. She applied for PHP 18000 for her seventh loan. With this loan, she will purchase additional stock for her variety store.  She can now by groceries in bulk to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Lene

texts.en: Lene M. is a 37-year-old married mother of two. One of her children is in high school and the other is attending college. Lene asked for this loan in order to purchase two piglets to raise and to buy wheels for the household "tricycle" -- a motorcycle with an attached sidecar. Tricycle taxis are a common form of transportation in the Philippines.

loans.use: To buy two piglets and wheels for a motorcycle sidecar.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida V. is a 45-year-old married mother of eight. Her youngest children are still in day care, and her oldest is a high-school graduate. She and her husband sell vegetables from a table in the street on market days in a number of different towns in the area.

Aida will use this loan to buy inventory for resale, such as onions, garlic, red pepper, tomatoes and salt. For extra income, Aida also cuts hair from time to time.

She hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall, instead of just a table from which to sell, and wants to be able to make enough money to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and salt for resale

loans.name: Soeng

texts.en:
Soeng P. is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are teenagers and attend school. She currently makes a daily income by growing various kinds of vegetables on her own farmland in the village. As another revenue source, she sells porridge in front of her house for the neighbors.

She is married to Sokhon, 35, who is a local building worker. He sometimes helps his wife selling porridge. Since Soeng P.'s business growing vegetables is the main source of income for the family, she would like to seek a loan in order to purchase a cow and more seeds for her business operation.

Soeng P. lives in the Pursat Province in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and more seeds

loans.name: Aom

texts.en:
Mrs. N., 32, lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she has been a local farmer since 2007. She raises pigs and grows rice crops in the village, earning an average of $3 each day.

She is married to Mr. Sokha, 41, and they have no children. N.'s husband currently is an English teacher for the village pupils.

N. is asking for a loan as capital to buy more piglets to raise and will be using the remainder of the loan to run a little grocery store out of her house.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Aqa Gull Group

texts.en:
Gull bas is the group leader of the Aqa Gull Group. There are three members in the group. They all see progress in their businesses and would each like to loan money to improve and expand the businesses.

Pashton would like to take a loan for her husband’s general store. Her husband would buy necessary materials for the store and make the store larger. Shapary wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Gull bas wants to take a loan for her husband’s fruit cart.

The group members want to say that these loans can help them and they thank Kiva for supporting poor people in Afghanistan .

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng S. is a 51 year-old widow with a 24 year-old daughter. They live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Loeng has been selling fruit and sugar cane juice since 2000. She buys many kinds of fruits, such as mangoes and sapodillas, from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village market. Loeng sells vegetable and grocery items as well. She is requesting a loan of $600 to expand her business by purchasing rice for resale and repairing her sugar cane juicing machine.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale and repair her sugar cane juicing machine.

loans.name: Sichat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sichat Kam is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her brother and an old father on Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sichat has been a silk weaver for twenty years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her brother raises cows. Sichat wants to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business in order to earn income to support her family. She doesn’t have enough capital, so she is requesting a loan of $150 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy S., 49, and her husband, Mr. Samoen Doeun, 49, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have three children: one son who is a security guard, one daughter who is married and lives outside the family house, and one daughter who is in Grade 12.

Thy has been selling vegetables and mangoes for 16 years. She buys these in her village for resale in the local market. Mr. Sameun Doeun is a construction worker who works in his village.

Thy is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase vegetables and mangoes in contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and mangoes in contract for resale.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita S., 48, runs a grocery business in Puntian, Valencia, Bukidnon. She says that previous HSPFI financial assistance has resulted in an improvement in her life and that of her family. With the small profits she earns, she can now provide for the basic needs of her children.

Her efforts have brought her many established customers who consistently buy her products. Farmers are her primary customers. Since the harvest season is approaching in their community, she needs further capital - amounting to PHP 10,000 - to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla H., 35, and her husband, Mr. Poeun Dong, 39, live in a small village off of National Road No. 2, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have one son and three daughters. Two of their children attend school and the other two are still young.

Phalla has been a garment factory worker for one year. Mr. Poeun Daung has been a mason for over twenty years, a skill he learned from his brother. He works in and around his village. Phalla is requesting her first loan of $1,000, which will purchase a motorcycle for her husband drive to work, allow them to dig a water well, and pay for the building of an additional roof at the back of their house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation, to fund the digging of a water well, and to allow for the building of a roof for the house.

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhen L. (took a picture with her daughter), 62, was married in 1966 and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them were married and live outside the family house, two daughters are silk weavers and one son works in a garment factory that produce jean. Besides her children Chhen also has two sons in-law and two grandchildren are living with her. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 
 
Chhen has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Chhen hopes to continue her weaving business, it’s a main business for her to earn income to support her family that why she is applying for her first loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Abbosjon

texts.en:
Abbosjon is a young married man who raises livestock to help his parents with their expenses and, in the future, to build his own house. This isn't an unpleasant occupation for him. Actually it is quite the contrary - he carries out his duties with enormous pleasure and with great affection towards the animals, taking care of them the best way possible.

Like every young person, he has dreams that he wants to see materialized. One of them is to add to his livestock herd, so that with time he will be able to sell them in the markets, especially on holidays. Abbosjon is requesting a loan for this reason. He wishes to purchase a calf to add to his herd of animals and to increase his income by the year's end.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; for the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, like Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a calf

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mr. Savun B., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-un Van, 42, were married in 1984 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of their children are silk weavers and the other two children attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savun and his wife are farmers. They grow tomatoes and cucumbers in their farmland near the village. Besides farming they sell mangoes as well. They buy them from the villagers for resale in the market in Phnom Penh.

Savun is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase mangoes on contract for resale and to buy silk materials for his children.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes for resale and buy silk materials for his children

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
B. Bakhtiyor is a young, married man who breeds calves in Spitamen, a small village of the Sugd region. Bakhtiyor is young but full of energy. He tries every single day to make the life of his family better. Bakhtiyor started his business five years ago. He continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Bakhtiyor has great experience in cattle breeding because he observed it from his childhood.

He would like to expand his business and purchase more calves. This will help him to increase income and improve life conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more calves

loans.name: Kundy

texts.en:
Mr. Kundy H., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sreytouch Vuth, 24, were married in 2007 and have one young child. Kundy and his wife live with his mother-in-law on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Kundy is a motorbike repairer and a blacksmith as well. He works at his own shop in front of his house. Sreytouch has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Kundy is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase motorbike spare parts for his business and to buy silk material for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts for his motorbike repairing business and to buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Halil

texts.ru: Халил мужчина 58 лет имеет пятерых детей,жена работает в детском саду прачкой.Её заработная плата хватает только на минимум проживания.Сам Халил работает бухгалтером в колхозе им."кушатов".С колхоза Халил оплату получает не в денежном ,а в товарном виде,т.е. получает продукты питания на проживание.Для дополнительного дохода на проживание семьи Халил занимается откормом и продажей скота.У него сейчас три коровы и пять баранов.Для увеличения оборотного капитала животноводства Халил хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Halil is a 58 years old and is married with five children. His wife does laundry in a kindergarten. Her income is only sufficient for a minimum living standard. Halil works as an accountant for a collective farm "Kushatov". From the collective farm Halil receives payment only in the form of food. In order to earn extra cash, he raises and sells cattle. Now he owns three cows and five sheep. In order to increase cash flow, Halil is applying for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin F. is 49 years old. He is married with two children. Amin has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 20 years together with his wife and elder son (pictured). He would like to expand his business by adding another cow to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. Amin is requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy another cow and feed. With the additional income, Amin will be better able to cater to his family's financial obligations, especially the education of his children.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow and feed

loans.name: Islom

texts.en:
Islom G. was born in 1962 and is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International last year, he was able to make much progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: the rearing of young cattle, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market.

Given this loan, Islom will purchase young cattle and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and feed

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
G. Mahkam is a 49-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children. He lives in the northern part of Tajikistan, in Kayrakkum town in the Sugd region. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to the local and capital traders. He has fifteen years of experience in raising cattle and selling dairy products. The milk products are in very high demand in his village. Mahkam’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for the traders, so he decided to apply for a $500 loan to purchase an additional cow and fodder. Mahkam is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living with this loan.
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: Purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икром 54 летний мужчина ,отец пятерых детей.Работает штукатурщиком на заказ.Его работа не достаточна для полного обеспечения семьи,хотя ему помогают его три сына, которые работают разнорабочими.Жена Икрома занимается воспитанием внуков.Кроме своей работы Икром занимается куплей и продажей мелкого скота.У него на сегодня 10 баранов и 12 коз.Невестки Икрома занимаются прядением козьей шерсти и её  продажей.Друзья Икрома посоветовали в кредит закупить ещё несколько голов скота,для чего и обратился Икром в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Ikrom is a 54 years old father of five. He is a wall plastering contractor. This job does not bring enough money to sustain Ikrom's family, even though three of Ikrom's sons help him. Ikrom's wife is busy raising grandchildren. To supplement his income, Ikrom maintains a cattle farm. Today, the farm contains 10 sheep and 12 goats. Ikrom's daughters-in-law weave and sell goat wool. Ikrom's friends recommended him to apply for Microinvest loan to purchase a few more animals.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle farming

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
I. Komil is a 49-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is hard-working and has fought to provide for his family and to educate his children, who today are working adults, thanks to his example. Komil runs a business of raising and selling cattle. He has 15 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Komil has become a very successful businessman in a short time. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Komil wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he applied for a loan of $800. Komil thanks all lenders for their support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat is an enterprising woman. She is always happy to do good work. Even when she was young, she had a desire for self-improvement. For about ten years she has been in the cattle and sheep breeding business. This activity allows her to support her three children who are the reason for her hard work. All of her children are studying at school. She wants to increase her investment capital so she can keep supporting them. With your support Jannat will be able to buy new animals and expand her business. Let's support this mother’s proposal.

loans.use: Purchase more cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Nizomjon

texts.en:
R. Nizomjon has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past 3 years, and has vast experience in the field, as it is the only business he is in. He is married and the father of two small children, who are his responsibility. This work is satisfying, and it enables Nizomjon to purchase goods for his home. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food.

Nizomjon wants to buy a calf and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 550 USD. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Azada Group

texts.en:
Rayza Gull is the group leader of Azada group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for her/his own business.

Rayza Gull wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. Azada wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. And Shafeqa wants to take a loan for her business.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves also for their families in the future.

loans.use: to expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is an extremely diligent and experienced woman, well-trained in her agricultural endeavor. It is for this reason that with much effort, she is able to produce fruit and vegetables which she then sells to wholesale merchants who take their products to all the markets in the region. This activity allowed her to improve her living and to support her children with school expenses. Currently Nigora needs a substantial increase in her investment capital and she appeals to your generous hearts to help her increase her production.

loans.use: Purchasing mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida L., 50, blessed with 7 children, is a resident of Valderama, Imbatog, Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She established her retail store two years ago. She is engaged in running a small retail store to be able to increase her income. She applied for PHP 11,000 as a loan from HSPFI. She finds difficulties in supporting her family because her husband is only a laborer. With her loan received, she can now purchase additional goods for her retail store to satisfy the needs of her family and customers as well.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her retail store

loans.name: Merman Rohaba Group

texts.en:
Merman Rohaba is the group leader of the Merman Rohaba group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive a loan for his/her own business.

Nelofar and Mahboba want to take a loan for their tailoring businesses to purchase more materials for their businesses. Merman Rohaba wants to take a loan for her son’s business driving a taxi. S. Ahmadsha wants to take a loan for his tailoring business; he will buy three new machines for his business. They all want to buy necessary materials for their businesses.

They want to say this loan is very useful because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger in their businesses and lives. This group wants to thank all involved in this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en: Mr. Johnny V. has been selling grocery products such as rice, canned goods, and other food items in his community for many years. He received a PHP5000 loan from HSPFI as initial capital for his business. Now he aspires to expand his retail store to sell other items. For example, this year he would like to purchase animal feed to sell to customers that raise hogs in the community. He hopes this venture will increase his income so he can better provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Reida

texts.en:
Reida G. is currently in the business of selling "simsim" (sesame) and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Reida is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni C. is currently in the business of selling books at a bookshop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Poni is 22 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 2 children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: expand her book-selling business

loans.name: Jene

texts.en:
Jene S. is a 34-year-old married mother of three. She and her husband buy and sell dried fish, an activity which is a primary source of income for their family. To earn additional income, her husband drives a 'tricycle' -- a motorcycle taxi with an attached sidecar -- and Jene makes and sells treats such as steamed rice cakes.

Jene plans to use the money from this loan to buy dried fish in bulk for resale, and as additional capital for the other household businesses. Jene's dream is to one day have her own stall in the town market, and to ensure that all of her children get a good education so that they may have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy dried fish for re-sale, and to provide additonal capital for other household businesses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to acommondate all her family members.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet M. is a 37-year-old married mother of five. One of her children is still pre-school age, two are in primary school, and two are in high school.  She and her husband fish using their own boat, and they also buy fish for resale from other fishermen. Juliet intends to use the money from this loan to pay for repairs to nets and to their fishing boat, and as additional capital to buy fish for resale. She would like to save enough money to have the extra capital to buy fish on her own, so that her business will be more sustainable. She hopes she will be able to continue to afford to send all her children to school.

loans.use: To pay for fishing boat and net repairs, and to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan to expand her business. She is thirty years old. Her husband is a security guard. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one child. She sells women's clothing and shoes at Ulana market in Pavlograd city. Twelve years ago she quit her job and decided to be self employed. She began her business with just one location selling the clothing. Svetlana was very determined to develop her business. Today she has four locations at the market. This is a family business now and is the only source of income for Svetlana's family.

Svetlana would like to borrow $900 to build another kiosk. She believes that the more locations she has the more chances that people will buy her inventory. Svetlana's goal is to fix her apartment and to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to build another kiosk

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen N. has been operating an eatery business for 5 years in Kipolot, Palacapao, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is employing as of now 2 waitresses and 1 cook to help run her eatery business smoothly. She can't forget how hard it was, when she started the business on her own. She thanks God that HSPFI served as instrument to sustain the project.

Moreover, she has been able to increase the daily food menu for customers' preference for dining in. And to repair and improve the building to accommodate travelers stopping over for meals. And due to increasing customer demand, she is in need of a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to increase the number of daily menu items to satisfy the needs of her family, customers. Maybe she can even employ more individuals in their community.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and other related items

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan S. is currently in the business of selling tea and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Juan is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.
