loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
A mother of five and a widow, Cecilia has a shop in the market in Mbengwi where she sells various products. With her fourth loan from GHAPE, Cecilia plans to purchase additional oil, plantains, egusi (a type of spinach), groundnut and salt.

Having joined GHAPE in 2004, Cecilia has used her past loans for pig farming, and for buying and selling oil. Since she sells products that are needed in her community and has experience as a business owner, Cecilia has many customers, and thus, her business in the market is doing quite well.

Because of her success with the shop, Cecilia has been able to pay her children's school fees and to provide medicine for her family. This new loan will continue to help Cecilia finance her children's education as well as to pay for health services and overall improvements in her family's standard of living.

As a widow, Cecilia has faced adversity, but with the help of GHAPE and Kiva, Cecilia has persevered in creating a successful business, which allows her to provide a better life for herself and her five children. She appreciates GHAPE because of the organization's easy repayment plan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase oil, fish, plantains, egusi (spinach)

loans.name: Nantume Kasfa Group

texts.en:
N. Kasfa, is 45 years of age she is married with seven children .she rants a one roomed house where she leaves with her children
She does take care of extended family her grand child.
Her greatest expenses in a month are feeding and rent for the house.
She sells ripe bananas in the market. She receives about 10 customers a day.
And she has done this business for over for years now
Her challenges are the price fluctuations for commodities which in turn force her to raise the prices of her bananas
She has been with MCDT for over 3 years and this is her 6th loan.
she wants to use this loan to buy more bananas for sell,
and she would like to expand her business given the capital.

loans.use: increase on stock

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife G. got married at 23. Her husband is a laborer on her neighbor's farm. Her early marriage prompted her to earn a living since her husband's income can't compensate their daily needs. So she ventured on retailing various foodstuffs as she joined and received PH80,000 for additional capital from HSPFI to purchase grocery items for her retail store. She is certain that HSPFI will be a life raft for them as victims of loan sharks now operating in their community. And she is hoping that this project will be prosperous for the welfare of the individual, family and community as well.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida A. is currently in the business of selling beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Farida is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married. He and his wife Sveltana have one daughter who is 9 years old, and they are expecting their second child soon. Vasil has been providing taxi services for 10 years in the city as well as to other cities.

Vasil is a former military officer. When he left the service he needed to provide for his family and decided to use his car as a taxi. Recently he sold his old car and bought a newer one.

Vasil would like a loan of 4,000 UAH to help with regular car maintenance, namely painting and tires. This business is the only source of income for Vasil's family.

loans.use: Repair taxi

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma G. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Wilma is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun M., 52, is a widow with three children: one son (shown in the picture with her), and two daughters. One of her daughters is a garment factory worker and her son has full-time employment. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savoeun has been selling fruits and ansorm (a kind of Cambodian cake that is made from banana, sticky rice, and coconut) for two years.  She buys ingredients from Prek Anhchnh market to cook and sells in her village. She hopes to expand her business so that it will be better support her family, and that why she is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fruits for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra B., 52, and her husband, Mr. Ry Sut, 58, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home; one daughter is a garment factory worker and the other two children attend school.

Ra has been selling porridge and fried banana for 15 years. She buys ingredients to cook from Koki market, which is about 17 kilometers from her village, and sells in front of the village school. Ra earns about $3.75 per day. Mr. Ry Sut has been a teacher for 30 years. Ra is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a water pumping machine for her daughter to use in growing vegetables and raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her daughter to grow vegetables and to use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun K., 40, and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Khen, 42, were married in 1990 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, three children attend school, and the last one is still young. Besides her children she has an old mother living with her. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Thoeun and her husband have been selling lotus for 10 years. They grow them on their farm and sell at market in Phnom Penh. Besides growing lotus, they also grow rice. The couple is in the process of building their new house, but they lack enough money to pay the fees for building. Thoeun is requesting her first loan of $600 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To pay fee for building her house.

loans.name: Evgeniy

texts.en:
Evgeniy is married with one son. He sells clothing at the market in Melitopol city. Evgeniy has been self employed for 7 years, working at different types of jobs - driving taxis and selling various products. Finally, Evgeniy decided to sell clothing because it generates the most income.

Evgeniy would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase his inventory. He would use the additional income to improve his family's living conditions. He and his wife dream of selling their one room apartment and buying a bigger home

.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Channra

texts.en:
Mr. Channra Y., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Sin, 37, live along the number one national road, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1986 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One of their sons works in a plywood factory, two daughters work in a garment factory, and the other three children attend school.

Channra has been driving a taxi for nineteen years, taking people to beautiful locations. Besides being a taxi driver, he is also a fisherman. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Channra’s car was damaged, which disrupted his business. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to make repairs to his taxi, purchase an outboard motor for his fishing business, and to build a new kitchen for his home.

loans.use: Repair his taxi, purchase an outboard motor, and build new kitchen

loans.name: 05-Đông Hải Group

texts.vi:
* Đông Hải là một xã nghèo thuộc tỉnh Thanh Hóa ,thu nhập chủ yếu của người dân là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi, ngoài ra họ còn có thêm nghề phụ là buôn bán nhỏ. Nhóm 05 thôn Ái Sơn 1 xã Đông Hải có chị N. Thị Lâm làm nhóm trưởng. Chị N. Thị Lâm sinh năm 1967. Chồng chị là Bùi Quang Đạt, sinh năm 1962. Gia đình chị có 4 người con, 2 con đầu đã lập gia đình, còn 2 con nhỏ đang học lớp 6 và lớp 4. Các kỳ trước gia đình chị ngoài làm ruộng anh chị còn chăn nuôi vịt,gà,lợn. Kỳ này anh chị vay thêm vốn  đi chợ mua thêm ổi, dứa, xoài, cam, quýt về bán để có thêm nguồn thu nhập. Hiện nay cả nhóm chị đều  vay ở chu kỳ 4 với mức vay là 3.079.800VNĐ(~ 177 USD).
* Chị Lê Thị Nhung sinh năm 1962 vay vốn về để  chăn nuôi vịt,gà,bò.

* Chị N. Thị Phượng sinh năm 1960,chị vay vốn về đẻ mua phân bón ruộng,mua gà, lợn về nuôi.

* Chị C. Thị Hoa vay vốn về để mua lúa giống,mua lá chuối đẻ bán,mua gà,lơn về nuôi.

* Chị N. thị Chúy sinh năm 1953 vay vốn để mua phân bón,mua gà,vịt về nuôi .
texts.en:
Dong Hai is a poor commune in Thanh Hoa province. The main sources of income of the inhabitants are from farming, livestock raising, and petty trades. Group 05, Ai Son 1 Village in Dong Hai commune nominated Mrs. Nguyen Thi Lam, born 1967, as group leader. Her husband is Mr. Bui Quang Dat, born 1962. Her family has four children, the first two are married, and the last two are still at school at Grade 6 and Grade 4. Previously, apart from farming, her family also raised ducks, chickens, and pigs. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow money to buy guavas, pineapples, mangoes, oranges, mandarins to resell to get extra income. All group members are borrowing their fourth loans with the same amount of VND3,079,800 (USD177), as below:

Ms. Le Thi Nhung, born 1962, borrows to raise ducks, chickens, cows.

Ms. Nguyen Thi Phuong, born 1960, borrows to buy fertilizer for her farm, and buy chickens, pigs to raise.

Ms. C. Thi Hoa borrows to buy rice to grow, buy banana leaves to sell, buy chickens, pigs to raise.

Ms. Nguyen Thi Chuy, born 1953, borrow to buy fertilizer, buy chickens and ducks to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits to resell, buy fertilizer, buy chickens, ducks,  pigs, cow to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell jewelry and pagnes

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam A. A. is 32 years old. He, his wife, and two children live in Gaza City in Palestine. He works hard in order to give his children everything they need.

Bassam has been selling women’s clothing in the central city market for about 6 years. Over that time, he has become very popular and has many customers. His business is the main source of income for his whole family.

Today, Bassam would like to ask for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase new clothing to sell to his customers. You can be an important part in helping Bassam grow his business.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị V. năm nay 50 tuổi Ms 020201050056, vay mức 4.704.000VNđ. Chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký tham gia vay vốn để đầu tư vào việc bán hàng tạp hoá, ngoài ra chị còn bán thêm hàng rau nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Vợ chồng chị sinh được 3 con, 1 con đang đi làm và 2 con đang đi học. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm xây dựng nên mức thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng bớt đi phần nào những khó khăn. Củngất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình và chị đã tuyên truyền, giúp đỡ những thành V. khác cùng tham gia vay vốn.
  Trong nhóm chị có chị Nguyễn Thị Chí năm nay 31 tuổi Ms 020201050057 chị cũng đã tham gia vay vốn qua 1 chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này chị vay mức 4.740.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc thu mua và tái sản xuất phế liệu. C.nh vì vậy mà thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định để có thể trả vốn tốt, ngoài ra còn đầu tư vào việc nuôi con cái học hành.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Vien, 50 years old (ID:020201050056), wishes to borrow VND4,704,000. She has received loans from the Fund and has good credit record. In this loan cycle, she will invest the money in the general/grocery store to earn extra income for the family. She has three children, one of them is working, and the other two are going to school. Her husband goes to work everyday as a construction worker, his income helps to make the living condition less difficult. She is interested in receiving loan from the Fund and she also advises and supports others to receive loans.

Her group includes Mrs Nguyen Thi Chi, 31 years old (ID 020201050057). Previously, she had one loan and has paid back in full. In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND4,740,000 to invest in buying and processing scrap materials. The income of her family is fairly stable, therefore she will be able to repay the loan and send her children to school.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in general/grocery store

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 50 tuổi Ms 020201050058, chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để thêm vốn đầu tư vào việc T. mua phế liệu, ngoài ra chị và chồng còn tái sản xuất lại đồ nhựa, phế liệu. Chính vì vậy mà T. nhập của gia đình chị ngày càng có thêm T. nhập, đồng thời có điều kiện để nuôi 2 con ăn học. Chị rất thích hình thức trả dần, vì nó giúp gia đình chị và người dân lao động có điều kiện để kinh doanh, tích luỹ cho gia đình, nên các thành V. rất thích. 
 Trong nhóm của chị có các thành V. sau:
 Đỗ Thị V. năm nay 36 tuổi Ms 020201050059 chị vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để đầu tư vào việc T. mua phế liệu.
 Đặng Thị L. năm nay 20 tuổi Ms 020201050060 chị đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VNđ để T. mua phế liệu, tái tạo lại đồ nhựa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 50 years old (020201050058). She wishes to borrow VND3,186,000 to invest further in buying scrap materials. She and her husband also reprocess scrap plastic. Therefore the family can earn extra income and has financial resources to send their two children to school. She is interested in the installment repayment method, as it creates opportunities for her family and other farmers to do business and save. Her group includes:

Ms. Do Thi Vien, 36 years old (ID: 020201050059). She borrows VND3,186,000 to invest in buying scrap materials

Ms. Dang Thi Lien, 20 years old (ID: 020201050060). She borrows VND3,186,000 to buy and reprocess scrap plastic.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy scrap material

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
A group of five people have requested this small loan and they all reside in Prek Pras Sdach Commune in Battambang Province. 

Mrs. C. has been selected as leader by the group members. She currently makes a daily living by selling Khmer cakes. She generally transports her wares on her hand cart for sale. Most of her clients are students. She is a widow with three children: one lives away from home and the others reside in the family home. 

To help provide for the family's expenses, Mrs. C.'s daughter runs a small beauty salon that serves the whole commune. C. has requested a loan to help increase her daughter's capital. 

About the other four borrowers:

Mrs. D. is requesting a loan to run a small soft drink store.
Mrs. S. sells used clothes and is asking for a loan to expand her business.
Mrs. S. is a fruit seller and she needs a loan to buy fruits for sale.
Mrs. S. washes clothes for a laundry shop, and she too requests a loan to purchase fruits to sell.

loans.use: To increase capital in a beauty salon business.

loans.name: Setimba Edith Group

texts.en:
Edith S. is 30 years old and is married with two children, ages 4 and 12. She rents a one-roomed house where she lives with her family. She prepares three meals a day, and her greatest expenses every month are her house rent and school fees for her children. She works seven days a week selling her charcoal at the market, serving about 30 customers a day. The main challenge Edith faces is that her customers often want to buy her charcoal on credit, which hurts her ability to conduct business.

She has been with MCDT for four years now. The reason she joined was because she needed a loan to improve her business.

Edith will use this loan to increase her business. She hopes to save enough money from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To increase charcoal stock.

loans.name: C1184 Jyambere Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Byumba, Rwanda! Byumba is in the northern part of the country, near the Ugandan border. Here, the Jyambere group is seeking its first loan from Vision Finance Company. The group is composed of five members: Souzane Mukabalinda, R. Mukagahimanyi, M. M., Xavera Mukakamari, and group president Laurence M.. They each sell sorghum and vegetables.

Laurence is 45 years old, married, and has five children, aged 18, 15, 11, 9, and 7. She also cares for two orphans. She has been selling sorghum for fifteen years and employs nine people to assist her in planting, harvesting, and selling it. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and earns a profit of approximately 223,000 Rwandan francs each month (about $440).

She is requesting a loan worth 40,000 Rwandan francs so that she may purchase more sorghum, beans, and vegetables to sell to her clients. With the profits, she intends to pay school fees and buy more food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, beans, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nalongo Hadijah Group

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is 34 years of age. She is married with three children aged 5 to 23 years.

She rents a two-room house with her family. She does have access to electricity but she has to fetch her water from the well. She always has two meals a day.

N. Hadijah has a salon and that is how she earns a living. She rents the shop that houses her salon and she receives about 15 customers a day. She has done this business for 19 years now and prior to this she had a retail shop.

This is the ninth loan she has received from Kiva's partner MCDT and she has been with MCDT for four years now. She has also worked with her group for four years.

She will use this loan buy oils for hair and braids for plaiting. She hopes to build a house from her savings.

loans.use: Buy oils for hair and braids

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo M., 50, is a retailer and has also produced corn since his marriage. His wife migrated to Riyadh for employment and they mortgaged all of their real estate to support his wife's application to work abroad. He stopped farming and focused on trading to provide for his family needs. Now he is in need of additional capital to purchase grocery items in volume to meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items in volume for trade

loans.name: Mwanje Florence Group

texts.en:
M. Florence is 46 years of age. She is married with seven children between the ages of 11 and 25. She rents a six-room house, where she stays with her family. She has access to piped water and electricity. She also looks after her late brother's two children. She normally has two meals a day and her greatest expenses are feeding her family and transport to her place of work.

She sells dry beans and she does this in a shop she rents. She works six days a week. She sells her beans on a wholesale basis and she receives about five customers a day. She has done this business for eight years now and besides this she also makes liquid soap and sells it.

Her main challenges in this business are rainy seasons, which disrupt her business because the roads become impassable so she can't get transport for her beans easily, and price fluctuations that affect the prices of commodities.

She has been with MCDT for five years now and she has also been with her group for five years. She will use this loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan to three people, all of whom are residents of Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., aged 43, currently earns a living selling sweet cake in the village, and earning an average of $2.50 per day. To earn additional income, S. is asking for a loan to begin raising pigs. 

Another family's income source is the job of the husband, Channom, who works as a motorcycle taxi driver and earns approximately $4 each day. The couple has been married for years and has given birth to three children who are students in the primary school. 

The other borrowers are S. and P.. S., is a widow who raises poultry from home to earn a living. She needs a loan to buy more poultry to raise. P. is a widowed mother who sells breakfast foods. She is applying for a loan to purchase the necessary ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To begin raising pigs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie N., who is 23 years old and single, is a meat processor who makes longaniza in her community. Longaniza is a Filipino food delicacy made of ground pork meat mixed with ingredients and rolled with dried and emptied pig intestine. She learned this skill from her fiancee's father. They agreed to start this business as an income-generating project. She is hoping to display these foods by constructing a food stall for the walk-in customers at their place. HSPFI assisted her with a loan of PHP 5,000 and she hopes this will continue for future expansion of the project.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for meat processing (longaniza)

loans.name: Bawji Mweni Group

texts.en:
Mweni B. is 44 years of age. She is divorced and has two children. She doesn’t get any assistance from her ex-husband. She has her house where she stays with her children. She has three meals a day and her greatest expenses each month are school fees, feeding the family, and paying the electricity bills.

Mweni B. sells new clothes and shoes. She works six days a week and she serves about three customer each day. Her customers are mainly women. She sells her clothes on a retail basis. She has been in this business for ten years.

The main challenge to her business is that most of her customers want clothes on credit and their repayment is very slow. This bogs down her business.

She has been with MCDT for six years and she has received 20 loans from MCDT. She says she chooses to work with MCDT because of its polices that favour the poor women. She wants to use this loan to invest in her business. She also wants to expand her business and open a proper boutique.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak A. is a 36-year-old nurse at the central hospital in the town of Isfara. Together with her husband, who is currently working in Russia, Muborak has raised three children. In addition, she has run a drug store for eight years, selling certified medicines. The drug store is located in the town center, so it attracts many customers. Muborak is requesting $600 USD to expand her business. With the consequent increase in income, she is planning to educate all of her children through higher education. Being very precise by nature, Muborak would like to assure lenders that she is able and ready to repay the loan in nine months. This loan will help her accomplish her goals in a short time. Your generosity can change lives. More about Tajikistan Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. More about IMON International Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase medicines in order to expand the business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
F. Gulnora is 54 years old. She is married with three children. Gulnora is an economist with the higher education. Together with the help of her son she is providing the computer services: typing and printing of the texts, scanning and editing of the files and other computer services. Today Zaynura requests $ 1000 US Dollars with the purpose to purchase new computer for improving the quality of her business. Also the part of the loan she is planning to spend for purchasing a new printer. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Gulnora’s business. 

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new computer and printer

loans.name: Mubina

texts.en:
Mubina F. is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. Mubina is a teacher, but as her salary is small, she has also run her own grocery business for the last six years. Mubina wishes to increase her business and offer an increased range of foodstuffs to her customers. Her aim is to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children, who are the reason for her daily efforts and the apple of her eye. With this opportunity and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and requesting a loan of $1000 USD. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months. By supporting Mubina you can be an important link in the growth of this business. More about Tajikistan Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase an increased range of foodstuffs

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in Mrah Al Habbas, in southern Lebanon. Three years ago he opened a farm in his village with only two cows. Today he has 30 cows on his farm and he wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a computer to better control his business.

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a cattle business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 39-year-old married man with four children who lives in Al Sarafand in southern Lebanon. He opened his carpentry shop in 1997, and since then his client base has increased. Ali wishes to borrow $800 in order to increase his wood inventory and his profits.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Namusisi Christine Group

texts.en:
Christine N. is 40 years of age. She is married and has seven children. She stays in a two-room house with her family. She has access to piped water and electricity. She has one meal a day and her greatest expenses are food and tuition for her children.

Christine N. sells bananas from home. She serves about seven customers each day and she has been in this business for four years. Her main challenge is that there are several people in the area who sell the same products that she sells, thus bringing about competition because they have to share the same customers. She also finds it difficult to transport her bananas from the village, especially during rainy seasons.
 
She has worked with MCDT for two years. She chose to work with MCDT because she wanted to increase her stock. She has also worked with her group for two years and she wants to use this loan to pay school fees for her children and to increase her stock. Christine N. wants to build a big kiosk for her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Majed

texts.en: Majed is a 47-year-old married man with three children who lives in Tarik A. Jadidah in Beirut. When he was 27, he started working in a detergent manufactoring plant. In 2001 he opened his own shop, where he manufactures detergents and sells them to the nearby supermarkets. Majed wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy more raw materials for his business, so that he can increase his production and sales.

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Subhon

texts.en:
M. Subhon is 38 years old. He dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business, one of which he drives personally. He rents the microbus. He has a wife and three children. Subhon has about six years of experience in the public transportation field. The competition is rather high in this business because there are so many people who need it. 

His current request will help him to maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. He is counting on your help and requesting a loan of $1200 USD for 12 months. With the loan, he’ll purchase spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Subhon will continue to progress. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his microbus

loans.name: Lucylyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucylyn B., a widow, is blessed with 3 children. She has been a grocery retailer for two years and runs a small eatery. With her hard work, both of these business were managed well. She needs to double her effort to provide for the needs of her children because she takes care of them alone. Her business site is in the right location, along the highway where there are lots of passersby. 

She cannot forget how she was helped by HSPFI after the death of her husband. Today this project is progressing. In fact, she is planning to improve the in front section of the eatery to accommodate more customers. For now, she needs PHP 15,000 to purchase ingredients for additional menu items. Someday she would like to have her own house and space for her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for additional menu items

loans.name: Uwimana Aisha Group

texts.en:
Aisha U. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has five children. She rents a two-room house where she stays with her family. She also looks after her brother’s three children. They normally have two meals a day and her greatest expenses are house rent, school fees, and transportation to her work place.

She deals in art and crafts. She sells them in a shop that she rents. She works six days a week and she serves about ten customers a day. She has been in this business for nine years. Prior to this, she sold second-hand clothes.

Her main business challenge is that the city council keeps relocating their business premises, making her lose some of her customers. This has made her get a permanent shop to sell her products.

She has worked with MCDT for four years because they were lending to low-income earners. She will use this loan to increase her stock. She looks forward to expanding her business and being able to construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en:
M. Nasibakhon is 39 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of three children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. 

Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows and sheep. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. 

She is asking for a loan of $1000 USD for 9 months to buy more young cattle to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, Mrs. Nasibakhon will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva D., age 43, produces fresh milk. Her husband, Luisito, purchased a dairy cow on an installment basis from the local government unit (LGU) in their community. This served as an income-generating project for many years.

They produce and provide fresh milk and processed products such as chocolate milk, ice cream and chocolate bars in the neighborhood. Due to lack of capital, their ability to provide containers for their products was limited until HSPFI assisted. They received PHP 5,000 as additional capital to purchase disposable containers for fresh milk.  

To date, they still pasteurize milk the traditional way by using a "pogon type," which is a mechanica/manual way of boiling fresh milk to the pasteurizing point. They hope to improve their products by using modern dairy equipment and the right packaging.

loans.use: To purchase disposable containers for fresh milk.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en:
Abdujalil is 60 years old. He lives with his wife and a son. For more than 6 years, he has been involved in agricultural activities. He hires workers to work the land and gets help from his family with handling the money produced from the sales. 

Lately, Abdujalil has expanded into raising livestock, which he also sells. He buys young cattle and cows, and when they are grown and heavy, he sells them. This is the first time that Abdujalil has requested a loan from IMON International. He has good references from his neighbors who consider him a responsible person. He requests this amount to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow wheat and onions on his land.

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
N. Firuza is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children. Firuza is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Five years ago she got an idea to start raising sheep to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. Her elder daughter (pictured) helps her with the business. Slowly the number of sheep increased and with them, her clients started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests she has finally decided to increase the number of her animals she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $ 600 USD for the term of 9 months. Be an important part of the growth of Firuza’s business. loans.use: Purchase sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.en: Anvar is a hardworking entrepreneur from Isfara, Tajikistan. He has operated his own car repair business for the past 10 years. Anvar has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. Car ownership is increasing rapidly in Tajikistan which means more business for repair technicians like Anvar. Anvar works hard to earn a good income and support his family. He and his wife have two children. Anvar has requested a short-term loan of $500 USD to buy some tools that he needs for his business. The income from this loan will help him pay for the schooling expenses for his children. loans.use: Purchasing tools and spare parts used to repair cars

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice D., 35, is a bona fide resident of Adtuyon in the Pangantucan municipality. She has been a Zamboanga dried-fish retailer for one year. Alice and her husband were farming before but due to insufficient finances with the increasing price of inputs (chemicals and fertilizers), they shifted to retailing of dried fish.

They started to purchase 4 to 5 kilograms of this foodstuff until it increased. They display their dried fish ("tabo-tabo") in the market and in various municipalities utilizing a cousin's four-wheel drive vehicle.

An additional capital of PHP9000 is now her concern to purchase dried fish. She is hoping that somehow she could own a multi-cab to maximize their time in peddling activities and, most of all, she could directly buy the dried fish in Zamboanga - the famous producer of quality, cheap dried fish in Western Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase 8 kg of  dried fish for sale

loans.name: Umri

texts.en:
S. Umri is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. Umri has been running a grocery store for the past eight years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and other products in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Umri is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again.

Umri is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $900 for the term of 12 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Umri reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika T. is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. Malika has a successful flour-selling business at the local market in the town of Isfara, where she sells an assortment of different sorts of high-quality flour. She has been engaged in this type of business for two years and within that short period has become a very successful entrepreneur. While her business is doing very well, she sees the opportunity to increase her sales by maintaining a larger inventory of goods. Therefore, Malika is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more goods for resale.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. loans.use: Buying flour to increase her stock for resale.

loans.name: Valieva

texts.en:
Valieva F. is 50 years old. She is a widow and has an adult son. Valieva has a successful flour-selling business at the local market in the town of Isfara, where she sells an assortment of high-quality sorts of flour. Because she buys the flour wholesale, her prices are cheaper than those of her competitors. For this reason, she has many customers who buy her flour straight from her house. Today, there is a great demand for her goods, which is why she wants to take an individual loan. She has requested a loan of $800 to add to her working capital and allow her to purchase more goods. She promises to repay the loan within nine months. Valieva is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve her goals and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe her perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in her small business.

loans.use: To increase the stock of flour for selling.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela T., 40, married, is an active fish trader in Puntian, Quezon, Bukidnon. Every morning she must wake up early to market her goods to the public. Sadly, due to lack of finances, she had to make the sacrifice to stop trading for family reasons. Now she has requested assistance to help to restore her livelihood. She needs PHP 12000 to buy fish in volume to take to market. She also hopes that somehow she will be able to buy a multi-cab (a Filipino all-purpose vehicle) for faster service to her established customers.

loans.use: To buy fish in volume to take to market.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is the 54-year-old mother of two children. She is married but separated. She is engaged in the variety store business and and is presently constructing a new store. In addition to selling wares, her business allows people to purchase auto-loads for their cell phones. She will use her current loan to purchase stocks of canned goods, beer, soft drinks, and cigarettes for her store.

Maria Luisa dreams of turning her business into a grocery store in the public market of Sibalom. She plans to save money for her family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase wares to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Prossie Nakanwangi Group

texts.en:
Prossie N. is 40 years of age. She a single mother of four. She rents a two-room house where she stays with her four children. She doesn’t have piped water or electricity in her house. She has three meals a day and her greatest expenses are food and rent for her house.

She sells her beer from a shop she is renting. She works seven days a week. She receives about five customers a day and she sells her beer on retail basis. The challenge she gets while doing this business is that most people want to drink her beer on debt and then forget to pay, thus making loses.

She has worked with MCDT for two years now and she has received four loans from MCDT. She chose to work with MCDT because it was convenient for her, near her place of work. She will use this loan to increase her stock and she also looks forward to expanding her business with subsequent loans.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Viviencia

texts.en:
Vivencia C., even at the age of 66, still struggles to earn a living to provide for the needs of her family. For 30 years she has sold assorted grocery items in their barangay (a Filipino term for a village, district or ward) of Valderama, Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. Her husband is in farming with no fixed income. Her variety store is their primary source of income for the family.

She is grateful to HSPFI for the financial assistance extended to her in the amount PHP10000 to sustain her project. The business responded well and she was able to provide their family's basic needs. She hopes that she would be able to increase the stock of her variety store so that her income would also increase.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
H. Mastona is 31 years old. She is married with three adorable children. Mastona sells perfumery and cosmetics in the store which she rents. She has been in this business for 2 years. Mastona is dreaming of expanding her business, opening her own store and establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Mastona and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their children so that they become highly-demanded experts in the future. Today, Mastona requests $ 800 US Dollars in order to purchase new perfumery and cosmetics such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick and etc. with the purpose of increasing her selection of goods. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan in in a timely manner, in nine months. loans.use: Purchase goods to increase her selection of products

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.en:
The most important inheritance Suraiyo and her husband can give to their four dear children is an education. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband and elder son, she buys and sells sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of sheep. Suraiyo and her family are waiting for your quick response.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Miss W. Christine is an owner of a school in Kacence, Mbarara. She has been operating the school for four years now. Christine obtained the loan funds to purchase more items like uniforms, library books and other school requirements. With the growth of the school, she hopes to construct a secondary school.

Christine is married with four children.

loans.use: To purchase more uniforms and library books

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
A. Sabohat is 41 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children.

The difficult living conditions and the low wages forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn money. Sabohat breeds cattle. She buys the small cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son also attends to this business. Sabohat works hard in order to make the business successful and generate stable income for the family. Today Sabohat is planning to purchase the cattle for her household for raising and further selling. For this purpose, she requests $300 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Sabohat would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Yudaya Nankya Group

texts.en:
Yudaya N. is 49 years of age; she is a widow and mother of six. She rents a four-roomed house where she lives with her children. She does have access to piped water and electricity in her house. She also looks after four grandchildren who lost their father. She also looks after her elderly mother and auntie. She has two meals a day and her greatest expense is that of food for the family and rent for her house.

Yudaya N. owns a retail business in a shop she is renting and she works seven days a week. She receives about thirty customers a day and she sells on a retail basis. Yudaya N. also works as a cleaner in a nearby health centre. The challenge she has while doing this business is during rainy seasons, because that disrupts her business.

She has worked with MCDT for six years. She chose to work with MCDT because it was convenient for her. It is near her place of work and she also wanted capital to expand her business. She will use this loan to expand her stock and she also looks forward to expanding her business with subsequent loans.

Yudaya N. also looks forward to being able to pay school fees for her grandchildren till they complete their education.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Razihol

texts.ru: Клиент Чуманазаров Рузихол проживаещая в городе Турсунзаде в посёлок Джаврат. Клиентки 44 года она замужем и имеет 4 -ех детей. Образования клиентки среднее,клиентка занимается сельскохозяйством уже более 20 лет у клиентки имеется 15 сот земли, на этой земле она вырасщивает зерно и кортошку.Клиентка просит 2000 сомони на 8 месяцев для преобретения удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Razihol C. lives in the town of Tursun-Zoda in Djavrat city. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has high school education. Her main occupation is agriculture. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. She owns a piece of land, which she uses to grow grains and potatoes. Razihol asks for 2,000 Somoni for 8 months to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys O. is forty-five years old. She is married and has four kids who are all still in the basic school. Gladys lives with her husband and family in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number is also involved in trading and other business activities. Gladys is in the business of palm oil production. She has been in business for ten good years and is full of rich experience. 

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Gladys desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Ahmadiyya Primary School,magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at the Ahmadiyya Primary School, Magburaka. It was built by the Ahmadiyya Mission to propagate the faith and provide education to the people of Magburaka. It has a total of sixteen staff members and 400 pupils.

Ahmadiyya Primary School makes good grades every academic year at the National Primary School Examination (BECE). The school has been able to send many pupils to secondary schools every year.

Since teachers usually receive very meager salaries, many teachers find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in businesses or agriculture, and others organize extra classes for the pupils (though that is a practice the government is trying to abolish). Teachers therefore seek a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects and then out of their salaries, they gradually repay the loan.

Abdul K. K. (middle – first row) is the Head Teacher of this school. He was born in Magburaka and is married with four children. Abdul will invest this loan in business.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is married with 2 grown-up children. She sells various home products at the local market in Shidnitsa city. Her gross income is 15,000 UAH per month; net profit is 4,000 UAH per month.

Eugenia has been in this business for 14 years. She tries to renew her assortment often and keep low prices for her products. Her previous experience in sales helps her in her own business as well. Eugenia is a happy, honest and hard-working person.

Eugenia would like to receive a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the inventory. She would spend additional income to help her children and grandchildren to cope with temporary economic difficulties.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Nabojon

texts.ru: Клиент Бегалиев Набиджон проживает в городе Турсунзаде в посёлки Джаврат.Клиенту 38 лет он женат и имеет 4-ех детей, образования среднее.Клиент занимается сельскохозяйством уже 12 лет у него имеется 20 сот земли клиент вырасщивает кортошку марковь и лук.Клиент просит 2000 сомони на 8 месяцев для покупки удобрений и топлива для трактора.
texts.en:
Nabojon B. lives in the town of Tursun-Zoda in Djavrat city. He is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has high school education. He has been in the business of agriculture for 12 years. He has a piece of land that he uses to grow potatoes, carrots, and onions. He is asking for 2,000 somoni for 8 months to purchase fertilizers and fuel for his tractor.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is 50 years old. She is a widow and had ten kids but lost four through ailments. Out of the remaining six, the last-born is still in school. Faustina lives with her children in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number is also involved in trading and other business activities. Faustina is in the business of palm oil production. She has been in business for four years.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community and processes them in her house to produce the oil, then sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Faustina desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. is 60 years old. She is a widow and has given birth to nine children. Currently, four of them attend school. She lives together with some of her children in the family house in a town called Nkwaateng, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Hawa lost her husband after a short ailment.

She works zealously as a single parent to support her family and provide for the children’s schooling. She is a fishmonger and also sells used clothes. She sells her wares out of a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from larger fishmongers who sell at wholesale prices in the towns of Yeji and Mankessim. Hawa has been in business for ten years. According to Hawa, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually to help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Serugendo

texts.en: Greetings from Byumba, Rwanda!  E. Serugendo is currently seeking his first loan from Vision Finance Company.  He has been selling spare parts in the north of Rwanda for five years and he works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm.  He is hoping that with his first loan, he will be able to buy more merchandise for his shop.  Specifically, he would like to buy brake fluid, fuel, and motor oil.  He expects that this will help him increase his profit from its current monthly level of 100,000 Rwandan Francs (approximately 200 USD).  With the increased profit, he will pay school fees for his children and reinvest into his business.  E. is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  In addition, he cares for four orphans.  His wife produces an income of approximately 15,000 Rwanda Francs each month (30 USD) through her agricultural activities.  E. is requesting a loan of 150,000 Rwanda Francs to be paid back over four months.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh A. is 46 years old, and lives with his wife and eight children. He continues working hard to give his family a better tomorrow. Sadly, Saleh has a daughter who suffers from heart disease, a sickness that requires continuous treatment in the hospital, along with all the related high costs.

Saleh's works repairing and selling spare parts for appliances.  He made up his mind to turn to Ryada for a loan of $1000,  With this loan he will be able to purchase more parts and accessories needed for completing the his many jobs. He hopes this investment will increase his profits, which in turn, will allow him to better provide for his family, including his sick daughter's medical services. Let us help Saleh‘s daughter who has been hit by some of the unfortunate things in life.

loans.use: To purchase more parts and accessories for appliance repair

loans.name: Iurie

texts.en:
Iurie T. is a 31-year-old married man raising three children, one boy and two girls. He has traveled widely and worked abroad for several years, where he earned a good income. But his desire to be with his family led him to return to Moldova, where he now hopes to be able to make ends meet by working hard on his farm.

Iurie knows agriculture very well, having grown up in a family of farmers. On his land today, he grows wheat, corn, rye, and peas, all of which he sells at a local market. He also has a small vineyard in which he grows Moldova grapes, which are very popular in this part of the world.

Iurie has come to us for a loan to cover the cost of planting the fall crop and ground cover for the winter. Poor weather and other problems made 2008 a difficult year, but Iurie hopes that with careful planning he will do better in 2009.

loans.use: Covering the cost of planting the fall crop.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Greetings from Byumba, Rwanda! Marie Louise N. grows and sells potatoes in the northern part of Rwanda, near the Ugandan border. She works daily from 7 a.m. to noon, which allows her to earn a profit of 15,000 Rwandan francs each month (approximately $30). She has been in business for five years, and currently employs five people to assist her with planting, harvesting, and selling her crops.

Marie Louise is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in the amount of 150,000 Rwandan francs. She would like to use the loan to buy more seeds for planting so that she can increase her crop yield. With the additional profits, she will pay school fees for her children and buy more food for her family. Marie Louise is 37 years old, married, and has five children, ages 10, nine, seven, six, and three.

loans.use: Buying more seeds for planting in order to increase her crop yield.

loans.name: Gherghe

texts.en:
Andrei has a vegetable-growing business, both in greenhouses and in open fields. He has been working in agriculture for four years, selling his harvest at the surrounding regional markets, and he now wants to expand by starting the production of cucumber in addition to his other crops, which include radishes and watermelon.

He currently is working with greenhouse and also with substantial outdoor space, some of which he would like to dedicate to the new, more profitable cucumbers. Andrei needs a loan to buy more vegetable seeds and construction materials for his greenhouses, including new plastic for covering, in order to get started with his expansion plan.

loans.use: To expand an agricultural business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương  năm nay  27 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nuôi và trồng rừng .Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn gà tại nhà còn anh Thắng chồng chị hiện đang làm công nhân công.  Với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Phương đang ngày càng ổn định hơn .
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để mua thêm gà và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi P. is 27 years old. She is living with her husband and two small children in Phuc Yen town, Vinh Phuc province. In 1996, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed money to invest in raising livestock and growing forest. Currently, she is raising pigs and chickens at home, and Mr Thang - her husband - is a casual worker. With an income of VND6,000,000 per month, the living condition of Mrs P.'s family is increasingly improved.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to buy more chickens and foods for poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to raise and foods for poultry

loans.name: Teopista Namusisi Group

texts.en:
Teopista N. is 47 years of age. She is married with six children. She has a two-room house where she stays with her children. She does not have access to water or electricity. She has two meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition fees for her children.

Teopista N. has a vegetable kiosk and buys her products from a nearby market. She works seven days a week and receives about 20 customers a day. She has done this business for 10 years now and she has not tried any other business. The main challenge she gets while doing her business is that there are many people selling the same products as her, thus creating competition.

She has worked with Kiva's partner MCDT for four years now and has received 10 loans from MCDT so far. She chose to work with MCDT to access loans to increase her stock. She has worked with her group for four years and she will use this loan to increase her stock and also pay tuition for her children.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Wcsl Mabanta/makama Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the WCSL Mabanta/Makama Primary Schools. These schools, WCSL Mabanta and WCSL Makama, were established by the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone. Since both schools from the villages of Mabanta and Makama operate on the same payroll, they have merged to seek a loan from Kiva through SMT.

This will be the second loan WCSL Mabanta will be receiving from Kiva through SMT. The previous loan that WCSL Mabanta received from Kiva through SMT created a tremendous impact in the lives of these teachers. Because of the successes of the first loan to the teachers of WCSL Mabanta, WCSL Makama from the next village has decided to join their colleagues in seeking a loan from SMT.

WCSL Mabanta was established in 1970 to give formal training to the children of Mabanta village and its environs. Over the years, this school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and many other professionals in different walks of life. Presently, the school has 368 pupils with a staff of 10 teachers.

With this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home-building projects.

Fifty-three year old Solomon S. K. (right) is the headmaster at the school. He was born in a village called Rogbin. He is married with three children – two of whom are in Junior Secondary Schools I (JSS I) and the eldest is in a Teachers Training College pursuing a Higher Teachers’ Certificate. Solomon will use his loan to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron zinc, boards, stick and nails. Solomon’s greatest desire is to see the completion of the house he is constructing. Being able to complete building his house will relieve him of the many problems tenants suffer at the hands of landlords, he told me.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like corrugated iron zinc, boards, stick and nails

loans.name: Mukeshimana

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! D. Mukeshimana is seeking her tenth loan from Vision Finance Company, Kiva's partner. For 10 years, D. has been selling different spare parts in the capital city of Kigali. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and employs two people to help her with her shop.

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to help her buy more stock. With the increased profits that result from her loan, D. hopes to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business. She is married, has two children and cares for three orphans. Their ages are 9, 10, 12, 13, and 15.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Watu Hodari Group

texts.en:
Fatuma S., age 30, is married with two children, ages 2 and 6. She sells clothing wholesale. She started this business two years ago and works daily from 6:30am until 11pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $150. 

This will be Shakila’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock and improve her shop and has repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to open a pharmacy. 

Shakila will share this loan with her loan group, Watu Hodari (Swahili for "strong people"), which totals 13 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma S. is in the back far right in a black dress.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng năm nay  50 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Hồng là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ buôn hoa quả,chăn nuôi và sự hỗ trợ của các con đã đi làm với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hoa quả.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hồng is 50 years old. She has 3 children, all of which are grown. Ms. Hồng has been a participant of TYM Fund since 1997. Currently the family's main sources of income, in the amount of 6,000,000 VND per month, come from selling fruit, raising animals, and support from her children. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to raise 10,000,000 VND to invest into their animal rearing work and fruit-selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock, Fruit-Selling Business

loans.name: Antoci

texts.en: A. lives in Floresti district, Puteni village. His business is vegetable growing for the wholesale market when he cultivates a very good harvest. A. thought to have a rich harvest throughout the year but for this he needs to build a greenhouse at his home so he took a loan from Microinvest, a Kiva partner, to do this. What he wants most of all is to increase his business and to start to raise pigs because customers who come from outside the town are asking for pork.

loans.use: Increase his business and to start to raise pigs

loans.name: Jessica Musoke Group

texts.en:
Jessica is 46 years of age. She is a single mother of four children between 21 and 27 years of age. She has a three-roomed house where she stays with her children, and she also looks after additional family members in her house. She eats three meals a day, and her greatest expense in a month is paying school fees for her children and feeding them.

Jessica sells second-hand clothes in the market. She works four days each week. She receives about 10 customers a day, and she does her business on retail basis. She pays rent for the place where she works. The challenges she normally faces in her business are the rainy seasons which disrupt her business and occasional thieves.

She has worked with MCDT for eight years, and she has received 16 loans from MCDT. She chose to work with MCDT because she wanted to get a loan to increase her business. She wants to continue increasing her stock so that she can improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es artesana y confecciona chompas y mantas de lana, las cuales  comercializa por docena en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto, el esposo trabaja de obrero en la Cooperativa de Mina de Sorata. Estas dos actividades constituyen sus principales fuentes de de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona Fatravi de la  Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una maquina de tejer y de esa forma podrá incrementar su producción y satisfacer la cantidad de demanda  que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Julia is a craftswoman and makes sweaters and wool blankets which she markets by the dozen at the popular fairs in the city of El Alto. Her husband works as a miner in the Mina de Sorata Cooperative. These two activities constitute their primary means of income with which they care for their four children. Julia has her own house located in the Fatravi zone of El Alto.

The loan will be used for the purchase of a knitting machine; through this she will be able to increase her production and satisfy the demand for her products at the market.

This is her second loan with Impro, due to her good payment history she is approved for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a knitting machine to better the volume of production of sweaters and blankets.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hoà năm nay  50 tuổi, gia đình chị có 7 con đều đã trưởng thành trong đó có ba con đang sống cùng bố mẹ. Các con của chị đều đã đi làm . Chị Hoà tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi, buôn bán rau và sự hỗ trợ của các con hàng tháng với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho chăn nuôi và kinh doanh buôn bán rau
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hoà is 50 years old. Her family has seven children, all of which are grown. Three of the seven children are living in her household. All of her children work. Ms. Hoà has participated in TYM Fund since 1998. At the moment, the work that provides the family's income are the businesses of rearing animals, buying/selling vegetables, and the additional monthly support from the children - they have an income of 6,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in their businesses of rearing livestock and retailing vegetables.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying/Selling Vegetables and Raising Livestock

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thức năm nay  49  tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 trong đó có 1 con đang đi học. Chị Thức là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôilàm ruộng. Ngoài ra tranh thủ thời gian rảnh rỗi chị Thức còn đi làm thợ xây để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống gia đình chị Thức đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm gà vịt và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Thức is 49 years old. Her family has four children, one of which is going to school. Ms. Thức has been a participant of TYM Fund since 1998. The family's main sources of income are rearing livestock and growing rice. Furthermore, in her free time, Ms. Thức works as a construction worker to bring home additional income for her family. With an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, her family's life continues to improve and get better each day. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND as capital to buy more chicken/ducks and animal feed for their livestock rearing business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more livestock and animal feed for raising livestock

loans.name: Diaconu

texts.en: Diaconu N. owns 2.57 ha of land, where he wants to plant watermelons and tomatoes. Until this year, watermelons and tomatoes he spread in the open field, but this year he planned to plant the seed in glass and to increase them in greenhouse, which built near the house.
