N. will sell fruit at the wholesale market in Chisinau city, as in previous years. Also, he is raising pigs, that he maintains for his own use and for achievement. N. is helped by his children, he has a tractor that transports fruits from the field. In the future he is going to build a greenhouse and all seedlings to grow in greenhouse.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh  năm nay  58  tuổi chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đã trưởng thành tại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.Chị Hạnh  tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999. Hiện tại chị Hạnh và chồng đang chăn nuôi và bán thuốc tây tại nhà còn các con đi làm công nhân.Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thuốc về bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hạnh is 58 years old. She is living with her husband and two grown children in the town of Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Ms. Hạnh joined TYM Fund in 1999. Currently, Ms. Hạnh and her husband are rearing livestock and selling western medicine from home while her children are employed. These are also the family's main sources of income in the amount of 6,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to purchase more western medicine to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to resell

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia CIPRIANA; es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 66 años y alterna sus actividades domésticas con la agricultura, ella es madre soltera, tiene 6 hijos, ella aún esta a cargo de el menor de sus hijos de 9 años de edad, al que lo matriculó a la única escuela de la comunidad; Ella cultiva diferentes variedades de papa, y habas, llevando todo su cultivo a vender al pueblo de Ocongate que queda a 1 hora a pie desde su comunidad, también deshidrata la papa quedando un nuevo producto para el consumo humano llamado chuño.

La socia Cipriana está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a trabajar para tener su productividad en el menor plazo y así cumplir con el pago de su préstamo; ella es conciente de que está banca es la única que llegó hasta su comunidad y les permite un capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Cipriana is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. Cipriana is 66 years old and balances her household activities with farming. She is a single mother of 6 children—her youngest, who is 9, still lives with her and attends the only school in their community. She grows different kinds of potatoes and peas, which she sells in the town of Ocongate, an hour away on foot. She also dehydrates the potatoes to create a new food product called chuño. Cipriana is very grateful for the loan and is committed to working and being productive in a short amount of time in order to repay her loan. She is conscious of the fact that this bank is the only one that has come to her community to offer some kind of working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer, cattle, working capital

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es:
Froilan vive en la calle “ Jujuy ”  de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a sus hijos, ya que se encuentra separado de su esposa desde hace seis años,en la casa de uno de sus parientes como cuidador.
 
Trabaja como artesano en la elaboración de billeteras y monederos de cuero cuya materia prima extrae de prendas del mismo material que se encuentran en desuso y  adquiere a menor precio; los productos terminados los vende en un mercado de la ciudad de la Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de materia prima y una maquina de costura. 
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro y el segundo que va vía KIVA, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Froilan lives on “Jujuy” Street in the San Jose area of Yunguyo in the city of El Alto. He lives with his children (he has been separated from his wife for six years), in the house of a relative who baby-sits the children.

He works as a craftsman in the production of leather wallets and change purses. He extracts his raw material from disused items and that he acquires at a cheaper price. The finished products are sold at a market in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy raw material and a sewing machine. This is his third loan with Impro and the second via Kiva. The assessment of Froilan qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of leather and a sewing machine for the production of his leather wallets and change purses.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy vive en la calle “ Huancavelica ”  de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  su hijo de 10 meses de edad, en una habitación que les sirve de dormitorio y cocina, en la casa de sus suegros.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de un minibús de transporte publico, entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de repuestos para la reparación del motor de su vehiculo. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Eloy lives on “Huancavelica” Street in the San Jose area of Yunguyo in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and his 10-month-old son in a room that serves as a bedroom and kitchen in his in law’s house.

Eloy works as a driver of a public transportation minibus between the cities of La Paz and El Alto.

The loan will be used to repay the repair shop for repairing the motor of his vehicle. This is his first loan with Impro, the assessment qualifies him to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repay the repair shop for repairs on his minibus.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor vive en la calle “ Loayza ”  de la zona San Felipe de Seke en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposa  y  sus hijos en su casita propia ubicada en una zona periférica de la ciudad.
 
Trabaja como costurero junto a su esposa, en la confección de buzos deportivos, los cuales los distribuye al por mayor y los vende en la frontera Perú Boliviana
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de telas al por mayor y así abaratar sus costos. 
 
Es el primer   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Nestor lives on “Loayza” Street in the San Felipe area of Seke in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and children in their own small home located in the outlying area of the city.

He works with his wife, sewing sports apparel, which he distributes wholesale and sells on the Perú Boliviana border.

The loan will be used to buy materials at wholesale, lowering his costs. This is his first loan with Impro, the evaluation of Nestor qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of material for making sports apparel.

loans.name: Hermenigildo

texts.es:
El socio HERMENIGILDO; es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

El Sr: Hermenegildo, realiza trabajos en carpintería, hace puertas, marcos de ventanas, mesas, sillas, carpetas, entre otros, el tiene un pequeño volquete que le permite viajar a la selva de Perú en busca de madera para efectuar sus trabajos de carpintería, es el único carpintero en toda la población de Ccolcca,  el invertirá el préstamo en la compra de madera, para hacer la elaboración de puertas y marcos de ventanas de sus vecinos.

El socio agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago en las fechas establecidas, el valora este préstamo, que le permite culminar con sus trabajos y de ese modo tendrá sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. Hermenegildo works in carpentry, making doors, window frames, tables, and chairs, among other things. He has a small dump truck which allows him to travel to the Peruvian jungle for wood to use in his carpentry projects. He is the only carpenter in the whole town of Ccolcca, and he will use this loan to buy wood, to make doors and window frames for his neighbors. He is grateful for the financial support and is committed to repaying the loan by the date specified. He values this loan, which will allow him to complete these projects and earn some money.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
Benigna trabaja como cocinera para diferentes eventos sociales y el esposo es grafico, es decir que hace trabajos de imprenta. Estas dos actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que están estudiando en el colegio y en la universidad publica; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona 1ro de Mayo de la  Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción, como ser arena, cemento, piedra, etc., para la refacción de su vivienda.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Benigna S. works as a cook, preparing food for social events. Her husband works in the printing and graphic arts business. These activities are the principal source of income for the family, which includes three children who all are in high school and university. They own a house located in the Iro de Mayo region of El Alto, Bolivia. The loan will be used for the purchase of construction materials – cement, stone, etc. for improving their home. This is the second loan that Impro will be offering them, since they repaid the first one on time.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as cement, stone, etc.

loans.name: Paz

texts.es:
Paz trabaja como albañil y por las noches trabaja como transportista pues tiene su minibús que trabaja de trasporte publico inter-ciudad La Paz – es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos y esposa. Vive en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la zona Los Andes de la  Ciudad de El Alto.

El minibús con lo que cuenta está en mal estado mismo que lo esta vendiendo; Paz planea comprar otro minibús, el costo total será de $us 3,500; Paz tiene $us 2,500 y solicita un crédito por $us 1,000 para completar el total del dinero. De esa forma podrá continuar trabajando como transportista.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Mr. Paz A. works as a mason during the days, and in the evenings he drives a mini-bus carrying passengers between El Alto and La Paz. The bus is his main source of income, helping him provide for his wife and two children. He lives in a house owned by his in-laws, which is located in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto. The mini-bus which he drives now is in very poor condition, and he is trying to sell it. He plans to buy a newer one, in better condition, which will cost him $3,500. He has saved up $2,500 towards the purchase, and is requesting a loan of $1,000 to complete the purchase amount. This will enable him to continue his transport business. This is the second loan he has requested from Impro. The first one was repaid on time, and for that reason they are offering him a second one.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mini-bus

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Ana es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Ana junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y arena.
Los sueños de Ana son tener casa propia, comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Ayacucho y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma is a member of the Brick Makers’ Community Bank in the town of Compania, where she lives. Compania is located about 40 KM from the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Ana, who is 23 years old, and her husband have one son. She and her husband have a small business making bricks, with an oven for baking the bricks. She has several assistants in this work. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 Peruvian Soles in order to buy the raw material – sand and clay – for making more bricks. Her dream is to grow her business in order to have her own house and to buy a piece of land in Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials - clay and sand

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juana es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Juana junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para quemar el ladrillo alquila hornos, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Juana sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Juana T. S. is a member of the Brick Makers’ Community Bank in the town of Compania. This town is located some 40 KM from the city of Ayacucho, Peru. Juana is 51 years old. She and her husband have 7 children, and they earn a living by making bricks. This requires them to rent time with brick ovens. They sell their bricks in their neighborhood. Juana is requesting a loan of 900 Peruvian Soles to be used for the purchase of firewood for the ovens. The money she earns will be used to help her finish construction of the second floor of their home.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para quemar el ladrillo alquila hornos, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Rosa sueña con comprar una casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member from the Communal Bank Los Ladrilleros. Rosa lives in Compañía, a community that is located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Rosa is 35 years old and has 3 children, Rosa works with her husband making handmade bricks. To bake the bricks, Rosa rents ovens. Rosa needs a loan of $300 (900 Soles) which she will invest in fire wood. Rosa dreams with buying a house and of giving her children a good education.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros D. Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad D. Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Celestina es casada, tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, Celestina junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos D. manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo D. peones, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad y también lleva a domicilio.
Celestina necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña y pago D. peones.
Los sueños D. celestina son comprar un terreno en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de leña y pago de peones.

loans.name: Yanette

texts.es:
La socia,  Sra: Yanette, es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia ella alterna sus actividades domésticas con la agricultura (cultivo de papa, chuño, habas) y la ganadería y la crianza de animales menores (criar oveja, vacas), animales de corral (cuyes, gallinas, pollos).

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado, en su comunidad campesina y se compromete a generar ingresos con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y a cumplir con el pago total del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yanette is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. She balances her household activities with farming (she grows potatoes, chuño—dried potatoes—and peas). She also raises animals like sheep and cows, as well as caged animals like guinea pigs, chickens and hens. She is grateful for and values this loan, provided in her rural community, and she is committed to generate income with her hard work and to repay the entire loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small animals and seeds

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson es socio del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Nelson es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Nelson se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para quemar el ladrillo alquila hornos, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Nelson se dedica a la crianza de los cuyes. 
Nelson necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Nelson sueña con tener un carro para repartir sus productos y progresar mas.
texts.en:
Nelson is a member of the communal bank "Los Ladrilleros", located in the community of Compañía which is 40 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho. Nelson lives with his wife. He is 29 years old and has one child. Nelson makes a living by making handmade bricks. To bake the bricks, Nelson rents ovens. He sells his bricks in the community that he lives in. Furthermore, Nelson makes money by raising guinea pigs to sell. Neslon needs a loan of $400 (1,250 Soles) that he will use to buy firewood for the ovens. Nelson dreams of owning a car to sell his product outside of his community and to make a better life for himself and his family.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo es socio del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teofilo es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Teofilo se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad y también lleva a domicilio.
Teofilo necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña y para el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Teofilo son comprar un carro para transportar un producto, construir una buena casa y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Teofilo is a member of the Community Bank “Los Ladrilleros de Compañía” (the brick-makers of Compañía). He lives in the town of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Teofilo is 30 years old, lives with his common-law wife, and has 2 children. He earns a living by making artisan bricks, which he makes with an artisan oven and with the help of day laborers. He sells his bricks in his community and he also makes home deliveries. Teofilo needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of firewood and to pay his workers. His dreams are to buy a car to transport his product, build a nice house and to see his children become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Firewood and payment of workers

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl es socio del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Raúl es soltero y tiene 21 años, Raúl junto a su hermano se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Raúl necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra y pago de peones.
Los sueños de Raúl son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y formar una linda familia.
texts.en:
Raul is a member of the Community Bank “Los Ladrilleros de Compañía” (the brick-makers of Compañía). He lives in the town of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Raul is 21 years old and single. Together with his brother, he earns a living by making artisan bricks, which he makes with the help of day laborers. He sells the bricks in his community. Raul needs a loan of 2500 soles that he will use to purchase land and to pay his workers. His dreams are to buy a car to transport his product and to have a beautiful family.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land and pay workers

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Claudia es casada, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Claudia junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones. Además Claudia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda.
Claudia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña, arroz y fideo.
Los sueños de Claudia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, aumentar con mas productos su negocio y tener otro horno.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Community Bank “Los Ladrilleros de Compañía” (the brick-makers of Compañía). She lives in the town of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Claudia is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she earns a living by making artisan bricks, which she makes with an artisan oven and the help of day laborers. She also has a small grocery store in her home. Claudia needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will use to purchase firewood, rice and noodles. Her dreams are to give her children a good education, increase the merchandise in her store, and to have another oven [to make bricks].

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Firewood, rice, noodles

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, Ana vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se ubica a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lourdes es soltera, tiene 20 años y vive con sus padres, estudia computación, Lourdes junto a sus padres se dedican a la Claudia junto a sus padres se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para la cual cuenta con un horno artesanal, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de peones.
Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Lourdes sueña con culminar sus estudios y tener una ferretería.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the community bank, Los Ladrilleros de Compañía ('The Brick-makers of Compañía'). She lives in the community of Compañía, 40 minutes from Ayacucho city. Lourdes is 20-years old, single, and lives with her parents. She studies computer applications. Lourdes and her parents make bricks by hand, using an artisan oven and hiring workers to help. Lourdes needs a loan of 900 PEN to invest in the purchase of soil or clay for making bricks. She dreams of finishing her studies and of owning a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soil for brick-making

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La sra. Lorenza, es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

Lorenza tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 18, 14 años, la socia se dedica a la agricultura (cultivo de papa, habas, verduras) y a la ganaderías (compra de vacas lecheras y engorde de las mismas), Ella también vende verduras y sus productos en el mercado local; ella camina 1 hora desde su comunidad hasta un puente que conecta su comunidad con otro poblado, dónde ella puede tomar un trasporte local y así dirigirse a la pueblo de Ocongate.

Esta socia agradece el préstamo otorgado, ella sabe muy bien que su comunidad no tiene libre acceso a una banca financiera, por lo que se compromete a hacer buen uso de ese préstamo y cumplir con los pagos establecidos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. She is 41 years old, married, with 3 children who are 19, 18 and 14 years old. She earns a living by farming (she grows potatoes, peas and other vegetables) and raising animals (she buys cows for milking and fattens them up). She sells her vegetables and products at the local market. She walks for one hour from her village to a bridge that connects the area with another village, where she can use public transportation to get to the town of Ocongate. She is grateful for the loan—she knows very well that her community does not have easy access to a financial institution—and she is committed to using the loan in a good way and making the established payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Magali es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Magali es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Magali tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de 3 personas, también vende bebidas variadas.
Magali necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Magali sueña con tener un local propio e implementar un recreo en su casa.
texts.en:
Magali is a member of the community bank “Sonrisa” (Smile). She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. Magali has a restaurant in a rented space, where she works every day and counts on the help of 3 employees. She also sells several types of drinks. Magali needs a loan for 1600 soles that she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of having her own building for her restaurant and of taking a break in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar

loans.name: Kira Kukuli

texts.es:
Kira  es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Kira es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Kira vende cosméticos por catálogos, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares. Su esposo compra y vende maní, ajonjolí, cacao, Kira le ayuda en la venta de estos productos.
Kira necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes y joyas.
Kira sueña con tener una tienda de agroquímicos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Kira is a member of the community bank “Sonrisa” (Smile). She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 3 children. Kira sells cosmetics through a catalog and offers her products to friends and relatives. Her husband buys and sells peanuts, sesame seeds and cacao. Kira helps him sell these products. She needs a loan for 1000 soles that she will invest in perfume and jewelry. She dreams of having her own agrochemical store and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: perfume and jewelry

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelida es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Nelida tiene una tienda en el mercado Santa Clara en donde vende CD, DVD, útiles escolares y otros productos dependiendo de la demanda. Además Nelida junto a su esposo tienen un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, temperas y DVD.
Los sueños de Nelida son comprar una maquina para la producción de discos musicales, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the community bank “Sonrisa” (Smile). She is 41 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 2 children. Nelida has a store in the Santa Clara market where she sells CDs, DVDs, school supplies and other products, depending on the demand. Nelida and her husband also have a booth in the 12 de april market where they sell clothing. Nelida needs a loan for 3000 soles that she will invest in notebooks, paints and DVDs. Nelida dreams of buying a machine to produce music CDs and also that her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: school supplies and DVDs

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia es la sra. Mónica,  es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

Ella tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 2 años y 6 meses y de 1 año y  7 meses, ella y su pareja están solicitando el préstamo para comprar una vaca y hacerla  engordar y finalmente venderla, esto les permitirá comprar otra vaca más; la socia también cocina diferentes platos de comida y  lleva a vender al pueblo y a los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, ellos trabajan como peones de obra, en la construcción de la carretera interoceánica, que unirá Perú y Brasil.

La socia agradece el préstamo y lo valora por que en su comunidad no cuentan con bancas financieras debido a la distancia de su comunidad con los pueblos y es conciente de que esto le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y se compromete a pagar el total del préstamo en el tiempo programado
texts.en:
Monica is a native member of the rural community Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi – Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. She is 4 hours by bus from Cusco. She is 24 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children, one that is 2 years and 6 months old, and another that is 1 year and 7 months old. She and her partner are asking for this loan so that they may buy a cow, fatten it, and to ultimately sell it. This will allow them to buy yet another cow. Monica also cooks different dishes and brings them to the village to sell and to her husband’s coworkers. They are construction workers for the interoceanic highway, that will unite Peru and Brazil. Monica appreciates and values this loan. Especially because in her community they do not have financial banks as a result of their distance from the villages. She is aware that this loan will allow her to better her income and is committed to paying the loan in total in the allotted time period.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows and fatten them.

loans.name: Grimalda

texts.es:
Grimalda es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Grimalda es viuda, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Grimalda tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además los días lunes vende en la feria de las Nazarenas.
Grimalda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas.
Grimalda sueña con tener una tienda propia, capital propio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Grimalda is a member of the communal bank, Sonrisa. Grimalda is a widow. She is 52 years old and she has 2 children. Grimalda has a stand at a market, where she sells a variety of clothes and products that she acquires in the city of Lima. As a matter of fact, on Mondays she goes out and sells stuff at the carnival of Nazarenas. Grimalda needs a loan of $325 (1000 Soles) which she will invest buying sweaters. Grimalda dreams about having her own store someday and making a house for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sweaters to sell

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Lila es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Lila vende filetes que ofrece a diferentes tiendas, puestos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ica. Además Lila es agente vendedora de una empresa.
Lila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de filetes y conservas.
Lila sueña con ampliar su empresa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lila is a member of the communal bank, Brisas. Lila is single and she is 28 years old. She has a daughter. Lila sells steaks, which she offers to different stores, stands, and markets. She acquires her products from the city of Ica. Lila is also sales associate for a company. Lila needs a loan of $325 (1,000 Soles) in which she will invest to buy steaks and canned foods. Lila dreams about expanding her company and of providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy steaks and canned foods

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Cipriana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Cipriana y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara de manera ambulatoria. Además Ciprina tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Ciprina necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, levadura, azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Cipriana son que su ultima hija sea profesional y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Cipriana is a member of Brisas Communal Bank. Cipriana is married, 50 years old, and has seven children. Cipriana and her husband produce bread. They bake it in a rented oven and sell it from a cart in the Santa Clara market. Cipriana also has a small grocery store in her house. Cipriana needs a loan for 1,400 soles to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, sugar and rice. Her dream is that her youngest daughter will become a professional and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, sugar and rice

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Juana es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Juana vende ropas a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Además Juana viaja a las ferias en donde compra quesos, cereales y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos, cereales.
Juana sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se superen, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank, Brisas. Juana is married. She is 40 years old. She has 4 children. Juana sells clothing. She offers the clothing to friends and family. Her sales are on credit and her clients make weekly payments. Juana travels to local carnivals where she buys cheeses and cereals and she then sells them at local markets in the city of Ayacucho. Juana needs a loan of 400 Soles, which will later on be invested by purchasing cheeses and cereals. Juana dreams about providing an education to her children so that they can have a good life. She also dreams of improving her business.

(Translated by Edith of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses and cereals to sell

loans.name: Fibiana

texts.es:
Fibiana es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Fibiana es viuda, tiene 36 años y 5 hijos, Fibiana tiene una Heladería llamada El Aguajal, elabora helados, chupetes, cremoladas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijas, sus ventas los realiza en la puerta D. los colegios y ferias, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. personal para ventas. Además Fibiana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Fibiana necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, barquillos, vasos.
Los sueños Fibiana con construir su casa D. material noble, ampliar su heladería y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fibiana is a member of the communal bank, Brisas. Fibiana is a widow. She is 36 years old and she has 5 kids. Fibiana has an ice cream parlor named “El Aguajal”. She makes ice cream, milk shakes and popsicles with the help of her daughters. She usually sells ice cream outsiD. of carnivals and schools. Fibiana also has a little grocery store in her house. Fibiana needs a loan of $475 (1,500 Soles) to invest in sugar, sugar cones and cups. Fibiana’s dream is to construct a house, to expand her ice cream parlor and to have her children finish school

(Translated by Edith of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, ice cream cones and cups

loans.name: Asociación Belen - Compone Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es denominado “ASOCIACIÓN BELEN - COMPONE”; Se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Anta a 1 hora 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco; Este banquito lo conforman 15 socios 12 mujeres y 3 varones, ellos pertenecen a está asociación de vecinos, amigos y parientes y viene trabajando en función a los bancos comunales cerca de 2 años.

En su mayoría los socios, se dedican ala crianza de animales vacunos,  compran y venden vacas y toros, crían animales de corral, y se dedican también a los cultivos en las diferentes épocas, ahora terminaron de producir maíz y están preparando sus tierras para la siembra de papa, verduras, cebada.

Los socios invertirán sus capitales de trabajo de las siguiente forma; comprar vacas y vender sus derivados en la ciudad el Cusco los días domingos, los 02 socios varones son chóferes de transporte y lo invertirán en la compra de repuestos par5a sus carros, llantas nuevas, otras socias para alquilar el tractor y comprar semillas, otra socia en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos, otra socia comprar vidrios para su casa, otra socia comprará fermento para elaborara chicha de  maíz y vender en su casa.

En la foto falta un socio varón es el señor Catalino C., el tiene el permiso de sus banco, por encontrarse hospitalizado.

Los socios del banco agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado para su capital de trabajo y se comprometen en pagar el total del préstamo en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ASOCIACIÓN BELEN - COMPONE”. It is located in the district of Anta an hour and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. This little bank consists of 15 partners--12 women and 3 men. They have belonged to this group of neighbors, friends and parents and have worked in communal banks for about two years. The majority of the members work raising cattle. They buy and sell cows and bulls, raise barnyard animals, and also tend crops in various seasons. Now they have finished producing corn and are preparing to sow their fields with potatoes, vegetables, and barley. The partners will invest their capital in the following manner: some will purchase cows and sell their derivatives in Cusco on Sundays; two of the male partners, who are drivers, will purchase replacement parts and new tires for their cars; other members will rent a tractor and buy seeds; another member will buy school supplies for her children; another member will buy windows for her house; and another member will buy fermenting supplies to make maize chicha and sell it from her home. The photo is missing one of the partners, Catalino C., who has a pass from the bank as he is in the hospital. The bank partners appreciate and value this loan for their working capital, and promise to pay the loan total by the established dates.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows and seeds, rent a tractor, etc.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Cette femme  a pour lieu de résidence le quartier  de bé kpota, qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé,  elle fait comme activité le commerce de produits congelés, elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 et a ouvert une boutique qu’elle appelle  « établissement la LUMIERE ». Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est plus élevée que ce qu’elle peut offrir, elle demande donc à wages un crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 13 cartons de croupions dinde, 14 cartons d’aile de poulets, 08 cartons de poulets. Elle est une femme mariée qui a un enfant, avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
This woman resides in the Bé Kpota quarter, a suburban neighborhood in the city of Lomé. Since 2004, she's been running a business consisting in selling frozen products in her store, called "Etablissement La Lumière". At this time, customer demand exceeds her capacity. She's thus seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to replenish her stock by purchasing 13 boxes of turkey rump steaks, 14 boxes of chicken wings, and 8 boxes of chicken. She's married, has one child, and uses her profits to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell frozen meat

loans.name: Sr De Ccoyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios D. este banco denominado “SR. D. CCOYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”, son 14 miembros, ellos se encuentran ubicados en la provincia D. Anta en el sector D. Cachimayo, están a 1 hora y 20 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, como a la crianza D. animales vacunos y sus derivados y a la crianza D. animales menores como las ovejas y cuyes, y aves D. corral; también cultivan verduras. Otros socios invertirán el capital en el abastecimiento D. sus pequeños negocios; en la compra D. locería (platos, tazas, vasos), compra D. celulares al por mayor, otro socio comprará repuestos para su carro.

Estos socios agradecen el préstamo proporcionado, par su capital D. trabajo y se comprometen a realizar el pago total del préstamo en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The bank called “SR. D. CCOYLLORITY CACHIMAYO” has 14 members. They are located in the province of Anta in the Cachimayo sector, an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. The members work in different activities, such as raising cattle and selling their livestock products; raising small animals like sheep, guinea pigs and fowl; and cultivating vegetables. Other members will invest the capital in supplies for their small businesses--crockery (plates, cups, glasses), wholesale cell phones, and car parts. These partners appreciate this loan for their capital and promise to repay it all according to the established plan.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell cows and fowl; small business

loans.name: Owognasson

texts.fr: Cette dame  qui habite le quartier d’adidoadin  a appris le métier de la couture, mais comme la couture ne marchait pas bien pour elle, elle a associé à la couture le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Actuellement elle veut rehausser son stock c’est pour cette raison qu’elle demande à wages son premier prêt en vue de s’acheter 03 sacs de riz, 02 bidons d’huile, 04 cartons de poissons congelés. Elle est mariée mais elle n’a pas encore d’enfant et donc elle gère bien ses économies.
texts.en:
This woman, who lives in the Adidoadin neighborhood, is a trained seamstress. Since sewing did not work out well for her, she also sells food staples. She would like to bolster her stock, so she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy 3 sacks of rice, 2 cans of oil, and 4 boxes of frozen fish. She's married but does not have a child yet, and is good at managing her savings.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell food staples

loans.name: Abla  Sepegna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’ agoè nyevé, un quartier nord de la ville de lomé, elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale  qu’elle fait depuis 2001, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. actuellement son stock de marchandises est pratiquement épuisé, elle demande à wages un prêt pour acheter 08 paquets de tomates en boîte, 06 cartons de patte alimentaire, 02 sacs de riz, 04 cartons de couscous, 08 cartons de vin. Elle est celibataire et aide certains membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a women who lives in Agoè Nyevé, a northern district of the city of Lomé. Her income-generating work involves commerce in grocery items and is something she has been doing since 2001. She supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. Right now, her stock of merchandise is practically exhausted. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy eight lots of canned tomatoes, six boxes of pasta, two sacks of rice, four boxes of couscous, eight boxes of wine. She is unmarried and assists certain members of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general grocery items

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto tiene 52 años de edad, reside en villa libertad, su esposa es ama de casa, sus hijos están independiente, don Alberto se desempeña de conductor desde hace cinco años, sus planes es poder poner una pulpería. Con este crédito va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado, y poder hacer el porche para vivir cómodo con su familia. Da las gracias Afodenic por poder hacer las mejoras a su casa como a su vida personal.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto is 52 years old, lives in Villa Libertad, his wife is a housewife and his children are independent. Mr. Alberto has been working as a driver for 5 years. His plans are to set up a general store. With this loan he will invest in construction materials to change the roof of his house which is in bad condition, and to build a porch to live comfortably with his family. He thanks Afodenic for allowing him to improve his house as well as his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to repair his home's roof

loans.name: Koffi Edem

texts.fr: Monsieur koffi edem habite  le quartier d’agbalépédo, il est un jeune  célibataire et dynamique qui lutte pour gagner sa vie. Etant à sa propre charge il a crée depuis 2007 un cafétéria   dans le quartier de tokoin à lomé. Ce commerce est rentable à Lomé. Actuellement les produits de première nécessité qu’il utilise pour la cuisson sont épuisés, il demande à wages un prêt pour pouvoir acheter 05 bidons d’huile, 05 cartons de tomates et 10 cartons de spaghetti.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi Edem lives in the Agbalépédo district. He is a young, dynamic, unmarried man who is struggling to earn his living. Being on his own, he established a cafeteria in 2007 in the Tokoin district of Lomé. This field of commerce is worthwhile in Lomé. Right now, the supply of essential ingredients he uses for cooking is exhausted. He is asking WAGES for a loan to buy five drums of oil, five boxes of tomatoes, and ten boxes of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the ingredients necessary for cooking

loans.name: Sirina

texts.fr: Cette dame habite l’un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Lomé, elle est propriétaire d’un atelier de couture appelé  « couture MISERICORDIEUX », elle exerce la couture depuis 2006, actuellement elle a une commande élevée mais le nombre de machine dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de livrer à temps les marchandises. Cliente de wages, elle demande son premier prêt afin de s’acheter une machine et accessoires et des tissus. Elle est célibataire  mais avec un enfant à charge.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in one of the outlying districts of the city of Lomé. She is the owner of a dressmaking shop called "Couture MISERICORDIEUX". She has been in the dressmaking business since 2006. Currently, she has a big order, but the number of machines she has available prevents her from delivering the products on time. A client of WAGES, she is asking for her first loan in order to buy a machine, accessories, and some cloth. She is unmarried but has a child to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine and fabrics

loans.name: Kodjovi Jocellin

texts.fr: Marié et père de 02 enfants, monsieur A. habite avec sa famille le quartier d’agoè qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de Lomé, pour pouvoir subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille, il a ouvert une boutique qu’il a appelé « ETS JOS LATINOS » dans la quelle il vend des appareils portables et accessoires. Il fait ce commerce depuis 2007, ce commerce marche bien pour lui et il s’approvisionne au marché de dekon à lomé. il souhaite rehausser son stock de portables et accessoires et il demande donc à wages un crédit pour acheter 20 portables et accessoires.
texts.en:
Mr. A. is married and the father of two children. He lives with his family in the Agoè quarter, a neighborhood located in the north of the city of Lomé. In order to provide for his family, he opened a store called "Ets Jos Lationos" where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He's been running this business since 2007, and it works well for him. He gets his supplies at the Dekon market in Lomé. To bolster his stock of mobile phones and accessories, he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to buy 20 phones and accessories.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tu buy 20 mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Cette femme  habite le quartier d’agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle est une femme très dynamique, n’étant pas mariée elle  travaille  dur pour subvenir aux charges de ses deux enfants. Elle vend de la boisson locale appelée « toucoutou », cette boisson est très appréciée au nord Togo et est faite à base de farine de mils. Actuellement son stock de mil est épuisé, elle demande son premier prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de mils.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Agoè neighborhood, in the north of the city of Lomé. She's a very energetic woman, who works hard to support her two children since she's unmarried. She sells a local beverage called "toucoutou", made out of millet flour and very much appreciated in North Togo. She's currently out of stock of millet, and she's seeking her first loan to buy 10 sacks of millet.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of millet

loans.name: Juan De Trinidad

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es un hombre con mucha dedicación  se ha esforzado y salido adelante con sus estudios, trabaja y estudia Contabilidad publica y esta por graduarse, tiene 30,años de edad, reside en el barrio Omar Torrijos  de Enitel 2 c al Norte, su esposa tiene dos hijos de 6 y 12 años de edad, que cursan la primaria, su esposa vende ropa para cubrir las necesidades del hogar y ayudar a su esposo, don Juan se desempeña como docente de primaria y secundaria pues da los dos turnos para ayudarse económicamente, y por que tiene el tiempo para dar las dos plazas. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijas en la educación. Con esta solicitud de préstamo va a invertir en el trámite del diploma universitario pues es uno de sus sueños que estará por alcanzar pronto, da las gracias a Afodenic por el apoyo al otorgarle el préstamo. Su meta a futuro es poder sacar una maestría en contador público.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan is a very dedicated man who has worked hard and gotten ahead with his studies. He works and studies Public Accounting and he is about to graduate. He is 30 years old, lives in the Omar Torrijos neighborhood in Enitel 2 c North. His wife has two children, 6 and 12 years of age, who are in elementary school. His wife sells clothes to cover the household expenses and help her husband. Mr. Juan works as a teacher in elementary and middle school, working two shifts to help himself financially, and because he has time to work the two shifts. His plans are to be able to help his children with education. With this loan request he will invest in the process of obtaining the university diploma, which is one of his dreams he will be able to reach soon. He thanks Afodenic for their support in giving him this loan. His longer term goal is to be able to get a masters degree in Accounting.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for the process of obtaining his university diploma

loans.name: Abdoulaye Abasse

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié à une dame qui est revendeuse, il n’a pas d’enfant, avec son épouse, il habite le quartier  d’agoè atsanvé. Il a ouvert  une  cafeteria qu’il a appelé « LA JOIE », c’est avec le revenu issu de cette activité qu’il arrive à prendre à charge sa femme.le stock de produits de premières nécessités rentrant dans la cuisson est pratiquement épuisé. Il est client de wages, il sollicite donc un crédit pour l’achat  de 20 plateaux d’œufs, 10 bidons d’huile, des tomates et des pâtes.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a woman who is a reseller, he doesn't have children and lives in the Agoè Atsanvé neighborhood with her spouse. He opened a cafeteria called "La Joie" (The Joy), whose profits enable him to provide for her wife. He's running out of stock of the essential ingredients he needs to cook. Being a client of Kiva's partner WAGES, he's seeking a loan to buy 20 boxes of eggs, 10 cans of oil, tomatoes and pasta.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs, oil, tomatoes and pasta

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Maruja es feriante viaja a los pueblos de la costa en donde vende cereales, de casa en casa, sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Maruja tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda.
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, cebada, trigo.
Los sueños de Maruja son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y surtir con otros productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Brisas community bank. Maruja is in a common-law marriage; she is 40 years old and has five children. Maruja travels with the markets from the villages on the coast where she sells cereals from house to house. She acquires her goods at the wholesale food market of Ayacucho. Maruja also has a grocery store in her home. Maruja needs an 800 soles loan to buy corn, barley and wheat. Maruja's dreams are to give her children a good education and stock her businesses with other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Clementina es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Clementina tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Clementina necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite.
Los sueños de Clementina son que su hija obtenga su titulo, tener un local mas amplio.
texts.en:
Clementina belongs to the "Brisas" community bank. Clementina is married; she is 47 years old and has three children. Clementina has a stall in the Grau market where she sells food daily with her husband's help. Clementina needs a loan of 1,800 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil. Clementina's dreams are that her daughter obtain her degree and to have a larger locale.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo F. S. se dedica a vender ropa usada desde hace cuatro años en su misma casa, la mercancía la pone en el portal para que tenga mejor vista ya que su casa esta en muy buena ubicación.
El señor Bernardo  necesita surtir su mercancía para tener más variedad en tallas, colores de ropa y así tener más fuentes de ingresos.
Su esposa le gusta el oficio de vendedora lo cual en todo momento es un apoyo para en el negocio.
texts.en:
Bernardo F. S. has been selling second-hand clothing from his home for four years. He displays his merchandise at his doorway so that it is more visible as his home is in a very good location. Bernardo needs to stock his business so that he has a greater variety of sizes and colours of clothing and so have greater profits. His wife enjoys selling and is always very helpful in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: FabioL. tiene 27 años, es madre soltera D. una niña llamada Brencis D. 4 años D. edad, con L. cual vive en L. casa D. unos familiares. Se dedica a brindar el servicio D. llamadas telefónicas ambulante (por celular) desD. hace dos años, realiza esta labor por diferentes distritos limeños, lugares que quedan a 1 y 2 horas y media D. su hogar, lo cual hace que se le haga muy cansado ir y regresar del trabajo. A pesar D. estos inconvenientes FabioL. ha sabido salir adelante con gran empeño en L. labor que realiza, y gracias a ello pudo adquirir 2 celulares adicionales a los 2 que ya tenía y dio trabajo a otra joven, L. cual ahora L. ayuda con su trabajo. Se levanta a las 5 D. L. mañana, tiene que exponerse al imponente sol en esta época D. verano, en L. larga jornada diaria que le espera, L. cual termina aproximadamente a las 10 D. L. noche, horas en que llega a su casa y pueD. ver a su pequeña hija, estos inconvenientes no impiden que le guste mucho su trabajo, ya que como elL. misma dice, “es mucho más independiente y elL. es su propia jefa”. Gracias a sus ganas y firmeza en sus conviciones FabioL. espera seguir progresando y obtener mayor cantidad D. celulares y así expandir su negocio. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y confía en pagar todas las cuotas a tiempo con gran responsabilidad. FabioL. invertirá que solicita en comprar 2 equipos móviles para ponerlos a trabajar con una prima que viene desD. provincia a L. ciudad D. Lima y así generarle un puesto D. trabajo, haciendo que su negocio crezca y sus ganancias se incrementen ya que trabajaría con 6 teléfonos.
texts.en:
FabioL. is 27 years old. She is a single mother; her daughter Brencis is four years old. They live in a relative's house. She offers the use of cellular phones in the street. She has been in this business for two years in different areas of Lima, areas which are one to two hours away from her home, which makes her very tired going to and from work. Despite these inconveniences, FabioL. has forged ahead with great determination thanks to which she has managed to acquire two more cell phones, in addition to the two she already had, and now employs another young woman who is now helping her in her work. She gets up at 5 A.M. and is exposed to the strong sun during the summertime knowing that she will have a long day every day as she works until 10 P.M. at which time she goes home to see her young daughter. Despite these inconveniences, she enjoys her work very much, as she herself says: "it is very independent and she is her own boss". Thanks to her drive and strong belief in herself FabioL. hopes to continue progressing and get more cell phones and so expand her business. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is confident she will repay her loan on schedule and with great responsibility. FabioL. will invest in two more cell phones for her cousin to work with: her cousin is coming from the country to the city of Lima and this will create work for her. In this way, FabioL. will grow her business and her profits will increase as she will be working with six telephones.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones for her business

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhony tiene 28 años, vive con su esposa Doris y sus hijos Alexander de 13 y Válerie de 12, en su propia casa. Desde muy niño sintió gusto e inclinación por los carros, es así que siendo muy jóven aprendió a conducir en autos de amigos y familiares, logró sacar su licencia de conducir y desde entonces se viene dedicando al servicio de taxi en el auto de su cuñado. Ya han pasado 10 años en los cuales ha trabajado incanzablemente en esta labor, sientiéndose muy felíz, ya que gracias a él puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su familia, pero como en todo trabajo siempre se tienen algunos inconvenientes, en su caso, el auto con el que trabaja suele tener algunas fallas ocasionales, perjudicando su labor y los ingresos diarios; felizmente Jhony ha sabido lidiar con todo este tipo de problemas hechándole ganas a su trabajo, el cual es muy rentable gracias al esfuerzo que le pone, ya que sale desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche. En el futuro quiere tener su propio auto, y así lograr mejores ingresos, pero también sabe que todo se logra poco a poco y con la ayuda de toda su familia, es por eso que apoya también el trabajo de su esposa la cual se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Jhony se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y promete pagar con puntualidad las cuotas de su crédito. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en el negocio de su esposa, para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, para proveer mayores ganancias a su hogar, y en un futuro tener los ahorros necesarios para la compra de su propio carro.
texts.en:
Jhony is 28 years old, lives with his wife Doris and their children Alexander who is 13 years old, and Valerie who is 12 years old, in their own house. Ever since he was a child, he felt an affinity for cars, so since he was very young he learned to drive in cars of his friends and family and was able to get his drivers license and since then he has tirelessly worked in this job, feeling very happy because he is able to obtain the income necessary to pay for his family's expenses. However, as in any job, his has some downsides. In his case, the car with which he usually works has some sporadic problems, which hurt his job and daily income. Fortunately, Jhony has been able to deal with all kinds of problems, working very hard at his job which is very profitable thanks to his efforts, since he goes out to work at 6 in the morning and returns at 11 at night. In the future he would like to have his own car, to be able to obtain larger profits. However, he also knows that everything can be accomplished little by little and with the help of family. This is why he also supports his wife's job, which is selling beauty products. This is Jhony's first loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his loan on time. With the requested money he will invest in his wife's business, to buy a larger quantity of beauty products to obtain greater profits for their household, and in the future have enough savings to buy his own car.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his wife's business.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
La esposa de Juan David S. la señora Martha Alicia Espino sale en la foto ya que el señor se encontraba trabajando.
Ellos ya han empezado la construcción con sus propios ahorros pero para terminar le falta capital, ellos quieren ampliar su casa para vivir cómodamente. Su proyecto es hacer dos cuartos ya que tienen 4 hijos los cuales requieren su privacidad y su propio espacio.
Su esposo trabaja en una constructora y ella en una maquiladora desde hace 14 años lo cual con estos ingresos pagaran el préstamo dado.
texts.en:
Juan David S.'s wife Martha Alicia Espino is photographed because her husband was at work. They began construction with their own savings but lack the capital to finish the build. They want to expand their home in order to live comfortably. The plan is to build two rooms as they have four children who need their privacy and their own space. Her husband works for a construction company and she has worked in an assembly plant for the past 14 years. This income is what they will use to pay for their loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Allin Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Allin Warmikuna que significa Buenas Mujeres en quechua, recién inicia su primer ciclo con 22 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, cereales, ropa, joyas, animales menores, medicina natura, comida, verduras, pescado, loceria, cristalería y elaboración D. artesanías.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 10,350 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra medicina natura, arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, trigo, maíz, joyas, pescado, verduras.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener casa propia, tener un local estable para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The community bank Allin Warmikuna, meaning Good Women in Quechua, just recently started its first cycle with 22 members. The members have a variety of businesses such as general grocery sales, cereals, clothing, jewelry, small animals, natural medecines, food, vegetables, fish, pottery, glasswares and handicrafts. The members need to borrow varying amounts such as 300 soles, 450 soles and 600 soles, for a total loan of 10,350 soles to the community bank. They will invest their loans in the purchase of natural medecines, rice, sugar, oil, meat, wheat, corn, jewelry, fish, vegetables. The members dream of expanding their business, owning homes of their own, having stable locations for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural medecines, rice, sugar, oil, meat, wheat, corn, jewelry, fish, vegetables

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana cuenta con sus 26 años, estuvo separada de su pareja por 3 años, pero hace uno año que han retomado su relación, tienen tres hijos que están viviendo en su casa. Tras la decisión de retomar su vida de pareja y por el bienestar de sus hijos, ella su esposo se han proyectado en sembrar diversas chacras, alquiladas en su mayoría, adicional a una chacra de platanales que tienen. En las otras tierras siembra piña, donde el trato con los dueños es que las ganancias se repartes en partes iguales, lo que le permite solventar los gastos básicos de la familia. Juntos trabajan desde las 8 de la mañana y durante todo el día en las chacras, tienen la esperanza que siguiendo el mismo ritmo y ahora que tienen conocimiento de los micro-créditos, podrán sembrar con su propio dinero y obtendrán mejores ganancias. Ana ha sido invitada hace poco tiempo a conformar un banco comunal, y el ser parte de ello la hace muy feliz. Se compromete a pagar todas su cuotas en las fecha fijadas. El dinero que solicita es para comprar 100 plantitas de plátanos, cada bolsa le cuesta 2.50 soles, con el resto adquirirá fertilizantes para el abonado de su chacra de plátanos.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and was separated from her partner for three years but a year ago they got back together. They have three children who live with them in their home. After they decided to get back together and for the wellbeing of their children, she and her spouse decided to sow a number of fields, leased for the most part, in addition to a banana plantation they own. On the other lands, they sowed pineapple where the agreement with the landholders is that the profits will be equally shared, which allows them to pay for the family's basic needs. They work together from 8:00 A.M. and during the entire day in the fields. They hope that by following this pattern, and now that they are aware of microloans, they will be able to sow with their own money and draw greater profits. Ana has recently been asked to join a community bank and she is very happy to be a part of it. She is committed to repaying her loan on time. The loan will be used to buy 100 banana seedlings, each bag of which costs 2.50 soles; the rest of the loan will be use to buy fertilizers to improve their banana farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana seedlings

loans.name: Pacaycasa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Pacaycasa inicia el 18 ciclo con 19 socias, las socias son del distrito de Pacaycasa que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de verduras, cochinilla, tara, animales menores, abarrotes en general, comida, golosinas, frutas y fabricación de ladrillos artesanales.

Como es el caso de Victoria que es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 3 hijos, Victoria vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio del distrito, actividad que realiza hace 4 años, además Victoria se dedica a la cosecha de tara de terrenos que alquila.

Por otro lado Aquilina es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Aquilina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además Aquilina se dedica a la crianza de cuy y cerdos. 

Mientras que Basilia es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Basilia vende golosinas y frutas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del colegio. Además se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y cochinilla.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 11,100 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, tara, cochinilla, verduras, golosinas y para el pago del arriendo de los terrenos.

Los sueños de las socias son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener casa propia, construir su casa de material noble y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The Pacaycasa bank is starting their 18th cycle with 19 members. The members come from the district of Pacaycasa, 30 minutes outside of the city of Ayacucho. The members have a variety of businesses such as the sale of vegetables, piglets, tara, small animals, general groceries, food, candies, fruit, and hand-made bricks. Victoria is in a common-law marriage; she is 34 years old and has three children. Victoria has been selling candies at the entrance of the local high school for four years. Victoria also harvests tara on land she leases. Aquilina is in a common-law marriage; she is 33 years old and has two children. Aquilina has a grocery store in her home and also raises pigs and guinea pigs. Basilia is married, 38 years old and has four children. Basilia sells candies and fruit in the street in front of the high school as well as buying and selling tara and piglets. The members need to borrow different amounts such as 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles for a total loan of 11,100 soles to the community bank. The loans will be used to buy rice, oil, noodles, tara, piglets, vegetables, candies and to pay for the rental of land. The members dream of giving their children a good education, of having homes of their own, of building their homes out of durable materials and of improving their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles, tara, piglets, vegetables, candies,  and to pay to lease land.

loans.name: Berenise

texts.es: Berenise cuenta con 19 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, por el momento está  viviendo en la casa de su madre. Muy enamorada, se hizo ilusiones de darle un hogar a su hijo en camino, pero no fue así, una  vez que nació su bebe su pareja optó por marcharse, desde entonces Berenise se sentía muy triste, pero gracias al apoyo de su madre y a la sonrisa de su hijo se ha repuesto de su tristeza y ahora trata de salir adelante. Con miras de emprender nuevos proyectos y aprovechar la oportunidad que le brindan sus padres para que pueda sembrar en sus tierras Berenise se está dedicando a los cultivos cafetaleros de su padre, por el momento invertirá para el abonado y la limpieza del los terrenos donde pueda transplantar nuevas plantitas de café, y esas producciones ya serán suyas. A Berenise le gustan mucho los trabajos agrícolas, ya que ella creció en ese ambiente, y mientras que sus siembras se van desarrollando seguirá apoyando a su padre en los trabajos de la chacra, y del mismo modo trabajara de peón para la subsistencia de ella y de su hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas y cree que le va a ser muy útiles los préstamos que le faciliten y le den la oportunidad de trabajar. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para el abonado de la chacra de sus padres, y de ese modo se sienta cómoda trabajando y apoyando a su padre por todo el apoyo que le brindan.
texts.en:
Berenise is 19 and a single mother. She has a son and is currently living in her mother's home. Very much in love, she had illusions of giving her unborn child a home, but it was not to be: once the baby was born, her partner chose to leave. Berenise was very sad, but thanks to her mother's help and her son's smile she has recovered from her sadness and is now trying to forge ahead. In order to begin new projects and take advantage of the opportunity her parents are offering her to sow their lands, Berenise has been working on her father's coffee-growing farm and will invest in the improvement and clearing of land to transplant new coffee seedlings which will soon become hers. Berenise enjoys farming very much as this is how she grew up and while her crops continue to grow she will continue helping her father with the farmwork and work as a labourer for her and her son's subsistence. This is the first time she is working with MFP; she has many prospects and believes that the loans will be very useful in helping her and giving her an opportunity to work. She will use the loan to buy chemical fertilizers to improve her parents' farm and thus feel at ease working and helping her parents because of all the help they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Floriza

texts.es: Floriza tiene 63 años, hace 14 años vive separada de su esposo, pero eventualmente realizan algunos trabajos de mutuo acuerdo, actualmente vive en su casa con una de sus hijas. Con sus padres aprendió a realizan los trabajos agrícolas, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa, la lampa y el machete fueron las herramientas heredadas de sus padres, así como las botas que utiliza para desplazarse con mayor facilidad en la chacra para evitar las picaduras de algunos animales que muchas veces pueden resultar en infecciones de primer grado. Durante toda su vida, la agricultura fue el sustento económico que le permitió brindar la educación a sus hijos, por ello dice estar muy agradecida a Dios por darle una tierra fértil, porque sus plantas son muy productivas, y por ende son muy rentables, ya sean las frutas o el café.  Lo malo del café es que solo produce en ciertas temporadas, mientras que con el plátano cosecha cada 15 días, y si lo abona y mantiene en buen estado su producción es semanal, por ello Floriza le es muy fiel a las plantas de plátano, de diversas variedades. Se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los alimentos y a eso de las 8.00 am está realizando sus cultivos, o recolectando su cosecha cerca de la carretera para que los compradores vean su producto y le compren. Floriza estuvo desde un inicio, muy entusiasmada para organizar y formar un banco comunal, y ahora, con la oportunidad de préstamo, hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de 5 bolsas de fertilizantes para el abonado de sus plantas frutales, para que sus cosechas sean muy productivas, en cantidades que recompensen su inversión.
texts.en:
Floriza is 63 years old. She separated from her husband 14 years go, but eventually they agreed to work together. Today she lives in her house with one of her daughters. She learned to farm from her parents, and she is proud to be a farmer, the spade and the machete were the tools she inherited from her parents, along with the boots that she uses to move around easily on the farm in order to avoid the bites of some animals that many times can result in infections. All her life agriculture was the source of her income that enabled her to provide an education to her children, and for that she is very grateful to God for providing her fertile soil, because her plants are very products and therefore profitable, whether yielding fruit or coffee. The bad part about coffee is that is can only be grown in certain seasons, while the banana is harvested every 15 days if it is fertilized and cared for it will produce weekly, so Floriza is very faithful to her diverse variety of banana plants. She gets up at 4:00 AM to prepare meals and at 8:00 AM she is working her crops or gathering her harvest near the road so that the buyers see her product and buy it. Floriza has been very enthusiastic from the start in organizing and forming a communal bank, and now, with the opportunity to acquire a loan, she makes promises to punctually pay her payments. The money she seeks is to buy 5 bags of fertilizer to nourish her fruit plants so that her harvests will be very productive, yielding quantities that will reward her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her plants

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
MADELEINE A. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Eden” con domicilio en el Jr. Calleria N° 751 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 41 años, 02 hijos, y su cónyuge traja en el puerto como armador pesquero.

Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos, de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro un poco de frutas, verduras y un poquito de abarrotes. Pero poco a poco fue incrementando su capital.
Como ve que el negocio de abarrotes le da lo necesario para vivir, y tiene un stock regular pero le hace falta otros artículos, con este préstamo de S/.1,500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra al por mayor de arroz, azúcar, detergente, bebidas gaseosas, leche, aceite y todo lo necesario para surtir su negocio.

Comenta que Manuela Ramos apoya bastante para emprender y fortalecer un negocio propio, y sobre todo a las mujeres que no tienen una profesión.
texts.en:
Madelein A. P. belongs to the Communal Bank “Nuevo Eden” (New Eden), and lives at Jr. Calleria N° 751, Yarinacocha district. She is 41 years old, has 2 children, and her husband works in the port as an fishing boat owner. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought some fruit, vegetables and a few groceries. But little by little she was increasing her capital. She sees that the grocery business provides her what she needs to live, and she has a regular inventory but she is missing some items.
