With this loan for S/.1,500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying at wholesale rice, sugar, detergent, soda pop, milk, oil, and everything necessary to stock her business. She comments that Manuela Ramos supports her a lot in launching and strengthening her own business, and above all supporting all the women that don’t have formal job training.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of items such as rice, sugar, detergent, soda pop, milk, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.es: Leopoldina es madre soltera, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa, en donde vende productos basicos para el consumo familiar, pero su ingreso principal lo obtiene de sus ventas de ropa ambulante, con esto cubre gastos del hogar y les paga los gastos escolares asus 2 hijos que son de 13 y 16 años, pues no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, estos cuando salen del colegio le apoyan en su pequeño negocio, la hija atiende la pulperia y el hijo la acompaña en la venta de ropa. El mayor sueño de doña Leopoldina es poder fortalecer mas su negocio para obtener ganancias que le permitan brindarle mejores comodidades y estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leopoldina is a single mother, and she has a small convenience store in her home where she sells basic products for daily use, but her primary source of income is from her sales of used clothing as a street vendor. With this income she covers her household expenses and pays for the education expenses for her 2 children ages 13 and 16, as she doesn’t have any support from the father of her children. When the children leave school at the end of the day they support her in the small business – the daughter takes care of the store and the son accompanies her to sell clothing. Leopoldina’s biggest dream is to be able to strengthen her business in order to obtain earnings that will permit her to provide greater comforts and education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store and more

loans.name: Elita

texts.es:
ELITA G. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez N° 375 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 45 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge labora como secretario en una institución de la zona.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró una máquina de coser y se puso a reparar ropa de sus vecinos y amigos, también confecciona ropa a pedido del cliente.

Ella encontró en la costura un buen ingreso, sin descuidar su casa.  Con este crédito de S/. 1,200. Nuevos Soles, comprará telas al por mayor, hilos, botones, cierres y otros para esta campaña escolar. Además por su carácter emprendedor también está invirtiendo en crianza de pollos.
Comenta: “Manuela Ramos nos da una linda ayuda, no necesitamos garantía material, solo necesitamos ser puntuales en los pagos y el crédito sale rápido. Los créditos me ayudan bastante para incrementar mi capital”.
texts.en:
Elita G. P. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank. She is 45 years old and has 3 children. Her partner works as a secretary at a local institute. With her first loan of S/.300 new soles, she bought a sewing maching and set to work mending clothes for her neighbors and friends. She also makes clothes to order. She found that the business provides her with a good income and still allows her time to care for her family. With this S/.1,200 new-soles loan, she will buy wholesale stocks of cloth, threads, buttons, zippers and other supplies for the school year. She's also investing in a poultry business, yet more evidence of her entrepeneurial character. She says: "Manuela Ramos helps us enormously. We don't need solid collateral, we just have to be punctual about repaying and the loans flow quickly. The loans help me to increase my capital."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for sewing business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
ELSA P. O., Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. 7 de junio esquina con el Jr. Ruperto Pérez, del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 57 años, 09 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo como conductor de motocarro.

Obtuvo su primer préstamo rápidamente de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con lo cual compró una parrilla, pollo, arroz e inicio un pequeño negocio en el rubro de comidas típicas, en las tardes y noches. Con el tiempo fue creciendo, actualmente tiene ya muchos clientes en su local ambientado en su casa, y ha visto por conveniente ampliar su negocio. Para ello ha programado hacer sus compras al por mayor, ya que se ahorra al comprar en cantidad y tiene su materia prima en stock.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará al por mayor: arroz, azúcar, maíz, carbón, e insumos usados en la elaboración de sus platos.

Dice de la ONG. Manuela Ramos: “el apoyo es bastante efectivo, la ha ayudado a sustentar los gastos de su familia y gracias a los créditos ha podido salir adelante con su negocio”.
texts.en:
Elsa P. O. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 57 years old and has 9 children. Her partner works as a mototaxi driver. She received her first loan of S/.300 new soles which she used to buy a grill, chicken and rice, supplies that she used to start a small business selling traditional food dishes, afternoons and evenings. Over time, it grew and now she has many customers in her shop which is located in her house and which she's had to expand. She arranges to buy wholesale supplies of products because you can save by buying in bulk and having stock on hand. With this S/.1,000 new-soles loan, she will buy wholesale supplies of rice, sugar, maize, fuel and other supplies used to prepare her food dishes. About the NGO, Manuela Ramos, she says "the support is highly effective, having helped to pay family expenses. Thanks to the loans, I've been able to push the business ahead."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies for food business.

loans.name: Floria

texts.es:
FLORIA P. B., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez N° 445 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 59 años, 09 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo eventual.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inició un trabajo en la preparación y venta de comida,  actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado de Yarinacocha en la sección de comida, con muy buena clientela.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,300. Nuevos Soles, se ha propuesto implementar bien su establecimiento. Comprará vajilla nueva e insumos en mayor cantidad, así como la carne que utiliza en su preparación.

Ella comenta que le gusta la forma como trabaja Manuela Ramos y como iniciadora del Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén se siente feliz de contribuir con sus amigas y vecinas, y se siente comprometida con ellas.
texts.en:
Floria P. B. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 59 years old and has 9 children. Her partner is a day laborer. Her first loan, for S/.300 new soles, was used to start a business making and selling food. She now has a stall in the food section of the Yarinacocha market with many good customers. With this S/.1,300 new-soles loan, she plans to set up a new business. She will buy wholesales supplies of tableware and supplies such as meat that she uses to make the food dishes she sells. She says that she likes the way that Manuela Ramos works and, as someone who started the Nuevo Eden community bank, she's happy to have helped her friends and neighbors and feels a commitment to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
KARINA R. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. El Bosque s/n.  del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 23 años, 01 hijos, y su cónyuge trabaja como agricultor.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inició un negocio en venta de comida al paso (en las tardes y noches).

Con este préstamo de S/.1500. Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, y otros insumos, para sus comidas. 

Comenta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo muy importante para no depender de su esposo, sino mas bien incrementar los ingresos familiares y le permita crecer, tanto como persona y en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karina R. T. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 23 years old and has one child. Her partner is a farm worker. With a first loan of S/.300 new soles, she started a business selling food dishes (afternoons and evenings). With this S/.1500 new-soles loan, she will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and other supplies for the business. She says that Manuela Ramos provides important help so that she doesn't have to depend on her husband and can contribute to the family income. Furthermore, it's allowed her to grow, both personally and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
KATY KARINA CHÁVEZ P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Calleria N° 670 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 29 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo como armador de botes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, inició el negocio de venta de pescado fresco, de manera informal con unas canastas, encontrando un negocio rentable, y de desarrollo, por lo cual buscó y compró un puesto formal, y actualmente está administrando dos puestos más, generando 2 puestos de trabajo, adicionalmente al de ella.
 
Este crédito de S/.1,500.00, lo invertirá íntegramente en implementar los 3 puestos en total, con cuchillos, tablas de picar y artículos de limpieza y los diversas especies de pescados y contribuir económicamente con la familia. 

Ella se encuentra muy comenta con Manuela Ramos, que hizo que pudiera tener un negocio propio y lo que es más importante, salir adelante sin trabas económicas.
texts.en:
Katy Karina C. P. belongs to the New Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 29 years old and has 3 children. Her partner owns a boat. With her first S/.300 new-soles loan, she started a business selling fresh fish with nothing more than a few baskets. She found that it was a profitable business and set out to develop it, finding and buying a food stall. She now manages two other food stalls, creating employment for 2 people, in addition to the stall that she operates herself. This S/.1,500 loan will be invested in supplying the 3 food stalls with knives, snack bars, cleaning products and various kinds of fish, all of which will ultimately contribute earnings to support her family. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos which has done so much to enable her to own her own business and, more importantly, to overcome her circumstances and get ahead in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for fish business.

loans.name: Mireyda Del Socorro

texts.es: Mireyda es soltera, de 46 años de edad, maestra de primaria, esta solicitando su 7mo credito  el que utilizara para compra de zinc para cambiar el techo de su casa pues quiere estar preparada para el invierno, trabaja en una escuela multigrado de la zona de Comalapa, sale de su casa a las 6:00 a.m. y regresa a las 4:00 p.m., en dias determinados regresa mas tarde porque atiende el programa de Educacion de Adultos, tiene 20 años de trabajar como docente en la zona rural, tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son independientes, trabajan y le ayudan de vez en cuando, dos habitan con ella al igual que una niña pequeña que estudia primaria, se siente muy contenta  al ser clienta de AFODENIC, ya que siempre ha pagado sus cuotas en tiempo y forma y lamenta que algunos educadores esten organizados en el grupo llamado Movimiento del No Pago, pues estan manchando su record crediticio y estan llenando de vergüenza a los docentes honestos.
texts.en:
Mireyda is a single, 46 years old, elementary school teacher. She is requesting her 7th loan which she will use to buy zinc to change the roof of her house because she wants to be prepared for the winter. She works in a multi-grade school in the zone of Comalapa. She leaves her home at 6:00 a.m. and returns at 4:00 p.m. On some days, she returns later because she goes to a program of Education for Adults. She has been working as a teacher in a rural zone for 20 years, and has 5 children, 4 of whom are independent, have jobs and help her now and then. Two of them live with her, as well as her youngest daughter who is in elementary school. She feels very happy as a customer of AFODENIC, because she has always made her payments on time and she is sorry that some teachers are organized in the group called "Movement of No Payment", because they are affecting her credit rating and bringing shame to honest teachers.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying zinc to change her roof

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
LAURA P. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Callería N° 670 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 59 años, 04 hijos, y su esposo está dedicado a la agricultura.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes en la chacra, llevando mercadería a sus vecinos, encontrando luego una actividad más, traer pescado fresco y venderlo, por ello implemento junto con su esposo lo necesario para pescar y comercializar pescado fresco.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la compra de un motor de peque peque, financiar un bote de pesca y dar mantenimiento a su motocar, para poder alquilarlo y obtener más ganancias.

Dice “Manuela Ramos es una ONG que me ha dado la mano cuando lo necesitaba, por ello no fallo en mis cuotas desde el  día que empecé”.
texts.en:
LAURA P. TAMINI belongs to the Communal Bank "New Eden" and lives in Jr. Calleria #670 in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 59 years old, has 4 children, and her husband works in agriculture. The first time she obtained a loan for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she worked selling first necessity products in their small farm, bringing merchandise to their neighbors and finding another activity bringing fresh fish and selling it. This is why, together with her husband, she set up what was necessary to fish and sell fresh fish. With this loan of S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in a motor, financing a fishing boat, and giving maintenance to their motocar, to be able to rent it and obtain greater profits. She says, "Manuela Ramos is an NGO that has given me a hand when I needed it. That is why I have not missed my payments since the day I started."

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a motor for a fishing boat. Financing a boat and giving maintenance to their motorcar

loans.name: Fausto Ramiro

texts.es: El Señor Fausto Ramiro R. L. tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Don Fausto tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Don Fausto es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y cuenta con el poyo de su esposa, esta actividad se desarrolla por la necesidad de proveer ingresos para la familia. Por lo que los propósitos de Don Fausto son de mantener a sus clientes es por eso que tiene que invertir en una variedad de productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos y otros artículos. Los sueños de Don Fausto son de establecer una  pequeña tienda para ofertar sus productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 14.500 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Fausto Ramiro R. L. is 31 years old, married, and has 1 child. Fausto earns a living buying and selling clothing. Over 5 years ago he began working in this business, and he counts with the support of his wife. They carry out this work due to their necessity to provide an income for their family. Fausto intends to maintain his client base and because of this he has to invest in a variety of products. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other articles. Fausto dreams of establishing a small shop where he can offer his products. The amount that he is requesting is 14,500 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase clothing, cosmetics, and other articles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa del Carmen S. Chavarría tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Josefa tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es una pulpería además posee otro negocio como la elaboración y venta de tortillas Doña Josefa tiene cuatro años de realizar este negocio y además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos pero debido a su salud tuvo que dejar esta actividad y con los ingresos de la venta y elaboración de tortillas es que decidió establecer una pulpería. Los propósitos de Doña Josefa son de mantener su negocio activo ya que le gusta este negocio y es una buena fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo  ya que con esto pude comprar productos como frutas, golosinas, y productos de consumo diario. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Josefa del Carmen S. Cavaría is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Josefa makes her living from a small grocery store and also owns another business where she prepares and sells tortillas. Josefa started this business 4 years ago, and in addition also dedicated herself to raising pigs, however, due to her health she had to abandon this activity. With the income earned from preparing and selling tortillas, Josefa decided to establish a small grocery store. Josefa intends to maintain her business active given that she likes this business and it is a good source of income. The loan will be used towards work capital given that with this loan she will be able to purchase products such as fruits, sweets, and other products consumed daily. The quantity that she is requesting is 5,000 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital to purchase fruits, sweets, and other products consumed daily.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
LUPE G. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Francisco Pizarro N° 147 del distrito de Calería, tiene 58 años, 03 hijos, y es viuda.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual instaló, junto con su hijo, un pequeño taller de mecánica de motos y moto sierras, comprando las herramientas mínimas y necesarias para tal fin. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el taller, comprará un equipo de soldadura, terminará el techado de calamina del local y comprará otras herramientas que les hace falta.  

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por que permite crear una fuente de trabajo para su familia.
texts.en:
Lupe G. R. belongs to the Communal Bank “las Almendras”. Lupe lives in the district of Calería, is 58 years old, has three children, and is a widow. The first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos was of 300 PEN. With this loan she and her son set up a small mechanic’s garage to work on motorcycles and chainsaws, purchasing the minimal amount of necessary tools for their purpose. With this loan of 1700 PEN, Lupe will invest in their garage; she will buy welding equipment, finish the corrugated roofing on their locale, and purchase the tools that they are missing. Lupe thanks Manuela Ramos who allowed her to create a source of work for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment. Maintenance of the locale. To purchase tools.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Señora María Isabel Martínez M. tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña María tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de electrodoméstico. Hace mas de siete años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio vendiendo granos básicos pero con este negocio no logro mucho ingresos por lo que decide establecerse con la venta de electrodomésticos además enfrenta su mayor desafío como lo es la competencia  ya que necesita invertir una gran cantidad con el objetivo de obtener la mejor calidad en productos. Los propósitos de Doña María son de obtener otro establecimiento por que así conseguiría más ingresos. Sus deseos son que su negocio logre prevalecer a pesar de la difícil situación económica. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 14.900 cordobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel M. M. is 52 years old and is married. Mrs. Maria has two children who study. Her economic activity is selling household appliances. For more than seven years she has worked on this business, having started selling basic grains, but because that business didn't leave her much profit, she decided to establish herself selling household appliances. In addition, she faces her greatest challenge which is competition, and she needs to invest a great quantity with the goal of obtaining a better quality of product. Mrs. Maria's goals are to obtain a new locale because that would increase her profits. Her wish is that her business is able to prevail in spite of the difficult economic situation. The quantity she requests is C$ 14.900 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
ROSARIO C. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez N°   del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 35 años, 06 hijos, y su cónyuge se dedica al comercio de plátano.

Como todas las socias obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que incremento un poco de capital en su negocio de venta de plátanos, el cual ha ido creciendo con el tiempo, hasta convertirse en un negocio regular, que realiza sus ventas al por mayor y menor, por lo tanto necesita incrementar su capital constantemente.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en una gran cantidad de plátano, y granos, para poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario C. P. belongs to the "Nuevo Edén" Communal Bank in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 35 years old, has six children, and works with her husband selling plantains. Like all members, she received her first loan for 300 soles, which she used to increase the capital for her plantain business. It has grown over time, and has become a regular business. She conducts both wholesale and retail sales, and thus needs to increase her capital constantly. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will invest in a large quantity of plantains and grains to be able to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale plantains and grains

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Juana Mercedes M. tiene 59 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Juana tiene 2 hijos trabajan y estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Juana es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica en su pulpería ofrece los productos como granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa, verduras y pan y otros productos de consumo diario, el negocio tiene varios años de existir y durante este tiempo ha incrementado su negocio gradualmente satisfaciendo la demanda de su cliente. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de aumentar su inventario para mantener su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita comprar artículos y productos de consumo diario. Sus deseos son que sus hijos puedan administrar el negocio y puedan defenderse para el día de mañana. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Juana Mercedes M. is 59 years old and married. Juana has two children who work and study. She has run a general store for more than five years. She offers products like basic grains, cosmetics, clothes, vegetables, bread, and other everyday consumer goods. The business has been open for several years and has gradually expanded during this time, satisfying its customers' demands. Juana plans to increase her inventory to keep up her business and thus meet the demands of her customers. The funding will go to working capital, as she needs to buy consumer goods. Her dream is that her children will be able to run the business and take care of themselves in the future. The loan she seeks is for 10,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Jiron Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Jirón esta conformado por Luz Marina V. López y Concepción Rodríguez C. ambas poseen diferentes actividades económicas y son las siguientes Doña Luz Marina tiene 65 años y tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, su actividad económica es una pulpería y el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de cinco años. La Señora Concepción tiene 58 años y tiene 7 hijos y trabajan y estudian de manera independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Concepción es la elaboración y venta de nacatamales hace más de siete años que se dedica a este negocio y ambas tratan de salir adelante con sus negocios que por ser diferentes necesitan de los financiamientos ya que son la única ayuda para ambas. La cantidad solicitada por Doña Luz Marina V. López es de C$ 5.000 córdobas y a su amiga Doña Concepción Rodríguez es de C$ 4.000 córdobas. Los sueños de mejorar la calidad de vida y mantener siempre activos sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Jirón Solidarity Group consists of Luz Marina V. López y Concepción Rodríguez C., each of whom has a different economic activity. Luz Marina is 65 years old and has two children who work independently. She owns a general store, which she has run for five years. Concepción is 58 years old and has seven children who work and study independently. She has been making and selling nacatamales (meat- and vegetable-filled steamed corncakes) for more than seven years. Both are trying to move forward with their businesses, and this funding is the only help for both of them. Luz Marina V. López seeks 5,000 córdobas in loans, and 4,000 for her friend Concepción Rodríguez. Their dreams are to improve their quality of life and maintain active businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
MARTHA LUZ C. D. MELÉNDEZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Eden” con domicilio en el Jr. Aguaytia N° 441 del distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 50 años y 02 hijos.  Su cónyuge se dedica al servicio D. fotografía y fotocopiado.

El primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una impresora y papeles para impresiones. Martha apoya a su esposo en su trabajo D. fotografía.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra D. 2 impresoras, una con escáner y la otra exclusiva para papel fotografía, también se está estoqueando con materiales como hojas, tinta, papel fotografía y todo lo necesario pata su negocio.

Está muy contenta con Manuela Ramos ya que les permite acceder a un crédito rápido y práctico, el cual ayuda en momentos que no se pueD. tener acceso a otro tipo D. financieras.
texts.en:
Martha Luz C. D. M. belongs to the "Nuevo Eden" Communal Bank. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha, is 50 years old, and has two children. Her husband works in the photography and photocopying service. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought a printer and printing paper. Martha helps her husband in his photography business. She will invest this loan of 1,2000 soles in the purchase of two printers, one with a scanner and the other strictly for photo paper. She is also stocking materials like paper, ink, photo paper and all the necessary items for their business. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos, as it lets her access credit quickly and easily, which supports her when no other type of funding will.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase printers, paper, ink, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María González tiene 60 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Rosa tiene tres hijos y todos trabajan por cuenta propia. La actividad económica de Rosa es la venta de gaseosa, hielo y ropa en general. Hace más de 31 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que inicio desde de hace mucho tiempo y con la venta de ropa que es dirigida por ella todos los días en esta actividad tiene el apoyo de su hijo mayor ya que necesitaba conseguir una fuente de ingreso. Los propósitos de Doña Rosa son de obtener otra refrigeradora incrementar su producción de hielo. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos para su pequeña venta y ropa en general. Sus deseos son proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 18.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Rosa María González is 60 years old and single. She has three children, all of whom work independently. She sells soft drinks, ice and clothing. She has been running this business for more than 31 years, beginning with the sale of clothing. Everyday she manages the business, and she has the help of her oldest son, who needed a source of income. Rosa plans to buy another refrigerator to increase her ice production. The funding is for small retail and clothing products. Her dream is to make improvements to her home. The amount she needs it 18,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jose Baciliso

texts.es: Don Jose es soltero, de 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos menores (2 varones y 2 mujeres), todos estudiando, esta solicitando su 2do credito para utilizarlo en la division de la casa para 2 cuartos y las puertas, tambien hará ampliacion para una cocina, ya que la que usa es de pedazos de tabla y zinc, su casa es de un proyecto de la Alcaldia donde con el credito anterior reunio los $.300.00 dólares que debia pagar mas el trabajo que el realizo, la casa es de 6 vrs cuadradas.  Trabaja como guarda de seguridad en la Alcaldia Municipal, no tiene ningun dia libre, solamente las horas libres despues de sus 8 hrs de turno, su compañera no trabaja en estos momentos, debido a que ella hacia pan, pero el horno se le destruyó, si el credito ajusta se construira éste porque es una forma de ayudarse en los gastos de alimentacion.
texts.en:
Jose is single, 42 years old, and has four small children (two boys and two girls), all of whom study. He is soliciting his second loan to be used for two rooms and doors in his house. He will also make an extension for a kitchen, as their current one is made of board pieces. His house is a municipal project, where he combined previous credit with $300, which he had to pay on top of the work he performed. He works as a security guard at Municipal Hall. He doesn't have any days off, only the hours after his eight-hour shift. His girlfriend does not currently work, since the oven she used to make bread was destroyed. If his credit line is increased, he will fix this as it helps them pay for food.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room division and doors

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
D. ÁGUILA D. RAMÍREZ NORA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Espinar N° 293 D. distrito D. Calería, tiene 57 años, 07 hijos, y su cónyuge es actualmente trabajador jubilado.

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que incrementó su capital para algunas compras, para el negocio que tiene.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en el mercado La Hoyada. 

El negocio le ha ido muy bien.
Con este crédito D. S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles, ella hará compras D. insumos, materia prima y otros que requiera, por ello comprará al por mayor maíz, arroz, por sacos, chancho para tener carne fresca, hojas D. plantas y otros insumos para la elaboración D. sus alimentos.

Dice: con Manuela Ramos he podido salir adelante, porque antes mi vida era una tristeza, agradezco a esta ONG y a mi amiga por haberme invitado a pertenecer a este Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Nora D. Águila D. Ramírez belongs to the communal bank, "Las Almendras." She is 57 and has 7 children. Her husband is currently retired. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase her capital for the business that she has. She sells food in La Hoyada market. Her business has gone very well for her. With this credit of 1,200 nuevos soles, she will purchase supplies and other items she needs. She will make wholesale purchases like corn, rice, pork to have fresh meat, plant leaves, and other items to make her dishes. She says, "With Manuela Ramos, I have been able to get ahead. Before my life was sad. I am thankful to this NGO and to my friend for inviting me to belong to this communal bank."

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies like corn, rice, pork, etc.

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hà Thị Hiển   năm nay  44 tuổi , chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đến trường  tại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc.Chị Hiển tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị Hiển đều đang kinh doanh cửa hàng ăn phục vụ cho công nhân tại nhà. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm thực phẩm cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Hà Thị Hiển is 44 years old. She is living with her husband and two school-aged children in the town of Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Ms. Hiển joined TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, she and her husband are operating a restaurant out of their home. This is also is the family's main source of income, providing 6,000,000 VND per month. For the upcoming loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND to purchase more food products for the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase for food products to sell.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Côi  năm nay  57  tuổi , chồng chị không may mất sớm chị đang sống cùng 1 con đã trưởng thành. Chị Hiển tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hàng nước. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc làm thợ hàn của con trai với tổng thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việchkinh doanh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Côi is 57 years old and lives with one of her grown children. Unfortunately, her husband passed away at an early age. Mrs. Côi has participated in the TYM Fund since 2007. Currently, her main sources of income come from raising animals and running a tea shop. In addition, she receives some support from her son who works as a welder. The total monthly income of her family is about 5,000,000 VND (292 USD). In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in her family’s tea shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tea shop

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia’s current family situation is happy despite their struggle to uplift their poor living situation. She wants to avail a loan amounting of PHP5,000 for her hog-raising business to assist her husband in earning for their livelihood so they will able to send her youngest son to college and support their financial household needs. Leticia is hoping that someday despite their poor living condition they will become successful with their sacrifices in sending their child to college. 

Leticia is already 50 years old, her husband is Willie and they are presently residing at Nabbotuan, Solana Cagayan. Blessed with three children, the eldest is Leila, 28 years old, college graduate, the second is Laarni, 26 years old, undergraduate in college and the third is  Wyndel, 15 years old, a junior high school student. She hopes to improve her hog raising into a bigger type of piggery someday so that aside from sustaining her child’s allowances to school, Leticia will also be able to support their farming needs and other necessities.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn ventures into hog raising business and it is situated in their house at Barangay Minante 2, Cauayan City.  Revelyn is already 28 years old. She is married to George S. a tricycle operator. They have three children namely; Angeline, 8 years old, and Emmalyn, 6 years old, both elementary students in their village and the youngest is Althea Mae S., 2 years old.  

Her primary business is hog raising but she also hopes to restart her defunct poultry business.  Due to lack of financial capital she was forced to stop her poultry operations then.  She then decided to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 to maintain her hog raising business since this is also her way of assisting her husband earn extra income for their family.  She is so brave in pursuing the business despite the price increase of commodities and some inputs nowadays believing that “hardship is not destroyed by a single failure or won by a single care, it’s a lifetime venture in which you are always learning.”

loans.use: Business maintenance

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana M., 25, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in a handicrafts business. She sells to the general public, tourists and overseas markets 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to upgrade the level of her business in order to become more successful. She will buy an electric chainsaw, sand paper and painting materials used in carving.

loans.use: To purchase an electric chainsaw, sand paper and painting materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria F., 32, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in a vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and the general public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy farming equipment, iron roofing for home improvement, and school uniforms for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a spray gun, rake, water hose, chemicals, vegetable seeds, wheelbarrow, iron roofing and children's school uniforms.

loans.name: Mariarosa

texts.en:
Mariarosa A., 55, is married with 2 children. She has 2 years of experience in a vegetables business. She sells to the village people and the general public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Mariarosa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used buy chemicals, pesticides and a wheel barrow, and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, pesticides, a wheel barrow, machetes and her children's school fees.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 23- year old young mother of three who is happily married to Dennis L.. They are currently residing at Barangay Nabbotuan in Solana, Cagayan. The couple is blessed with three children, the eldest is Raymark,  5 years old now in kindergarten;  Raymond, 3 years old; and Rayner, 1 year old. The village where they live is an agricultural community where main source of income of most of the residents comes from rice and corn farming.

She is hoping that she will able to avail a loan amounting to PHP5,000 for her fish ball and vegetable vending business. She works hand in hand with her husband to maintain their chosen small enterprise. She hopes to increase her business capital and income especially that she expects peak sales this coming month because it is harvest season. She also hopes to purchase an additional piglet for their small piggery so they will have additional source of income aside from vending. Corazon was glad that through their income out, they had able to provide her children’s needs. Corazon intends to do her best to prosper her business and to save some income for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for  sale and to buy one piglet for fattening.

loans.name: Faiese

texts.en:
Faiese L., 24, is married with 1 child. She has 2 years of experience in a handicrafts business. She sells to the general public, tourists and overseas markets 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faiese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase carving equipment like sand paper, a chainsaw and painting materials.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw, sand paper, and painting materials

loans.name: Faatulouna

texts.en: Faatulouna P., 26, is married with two children. She has been in the business of making ice cakes, pancakes and banana chips since the past two years. She sells to the village people for five days a week. She has no previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Faatulouna’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to fund things like paper cups, cordials, sugar, banana, and oil needed to upgrade her business, which will be her main focus.

loans.use: Purchase paper cups, cordials, sugar, banana and oil

loans.name: Mrs. Chat Net Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people living in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chat N. is a 47-year-old village bank president. She is operating a poultry business. Since her ducks are getting bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to purchase duck food for her poultry business. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Say Kea, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.

One member in this group has an an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase duck food for her poultry business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokea Suon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sokea S. is a 43-year-old village bank president. She is a rice middle woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. C. Lot, is a hard working man. Mrs. Sokea S. has five children, one of whom is a dessert seller, three are attending the local school, and the remaining is too young to work or study.

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchasing more rice to resell

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Mrs. Yorng P. was born in 1980 and she now lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. On her plantation, she has an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel in order to water to support the field. In order to deal with these problems, she decided to request a loan for these purposes. Her husband, Mr. Khem Nay, is a laborer and he is also a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Yorng P. has a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and fuel

loans.name: Chhiem's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three joint borrowers. Mrs. H., 29, is the leader of the group and is a mother of two young children who attend school. She supports her family's daily expense by raising pigs at home. She can sell her pigs to a slaughterer once in every six months. To further support the family’s need for food, her husband, Davy, works as a truck driver. Recently, H. sold all her pigs to a slaughterer and hopes to have other pigs for raising. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy piglets to raise. 

The other two borrowers are K. and K. K.. K. is a widowed mother who sells groceries in the village. She requests a loan to increase the stock of her grocery inventory. K. K. sells sweets to pupils in the local school, and seeks a loan to buy ducklings to raise. The borrowers of this group live in Toul Ta Ek Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng C. is a villager in Kbal Damrey village in Takeo province. She is a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Ung Peat, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. However, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to produce rice during the dry season. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Neng C. is asking for a loan to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field. She hopes this will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She is 43 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers and three are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the rice plantation.

loans.name: Mrs. Sinath Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province are asking for a village bank loan, and they will use it for various purposes. Mrs. Sinath K. is 28 years old and the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She faces a problem because she lacks the money to buy rice seed to grow on the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Long Mey, helps his wife. Mrs. Sinath K. has a child who is too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group have end-of-term loans, which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva. The rest of the group have monthly payment loans.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to grow on the field.

loans.name: Mrs. Roeng Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people living in Prasat village in Kandal province are asking for a village bank loan to use for various purposes. Mrs. Roeng C. is 40 years old and the village bank president. She owns a grocery store in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Yong Pak, is a taxi driver. Mrs. Roeng C. has two children who are attending the local school. 

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans, which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva. The rest of the group have monthly payment loans.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phùng Thị Thọ   năm nay 55  tuổi , chị và chồng đã ly hôn hiện chị đang sống cùng hai con tại Phường Hùng Vương thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2008. Hiên tại con trai chị đã đi làm công nhân còn chị kinh doanh hàng Internet  tại nhà. Công việc kinh doanh đang ngày càng phát triển và cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn để nâng cấp và mua thêm máy tính mới phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phùng Thị Thọ is 55 years old and lives with her two children in Hùng Vương ward, in the town Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. She is divorced from her husband. Mrs. Thọ has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Currently, her son has gone to work as a laborer, while she runs an internet cafe in part of her home. Her business is doing very well and provides her with an income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to upgrade her existing computers and also to buy new ones for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Internet cafe

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is a pig grower. She is 56 years old and has 6 children. She started her pig business last 2004 using her small savings of Php 1,000. She gained reasonable profit from her business. She uses her income to send all her children to college and pay everything that the school registrar asked from  tuition fees, books, projects, and exam permits to miscellaneous and laboratory fees. Aside from pigs, she also grows vegetables in her backyard to augment their income.

She is asking a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed for the pigs. Her loan will definitely help her expand her business. The more pigs she raises, all the more profit she gets.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of the WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage to make their business to grow.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thảo năm nay 56  tuổi , chồng chị không may mất sớm, hiện chị đang sống cùng 1 con tại Phường Hùng Vương thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiên tại chị đang kinh doanh và làm thợ may tại nhà. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm vải về may quần áo bán ch bà con địa phương
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thảo is 56 years old and lives with one of her children in Hùng Vương ward, in the town Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Unfortunately, her husband passed away at an early age. Mrs. Thảo has participated in the TYM Fund since 2004. Currently she works as a seamstress from her home. This is the main source of income for her family, earning her about 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy cloth to make clothes which she can sell to people in her community.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloth for tailoring business

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga C. owns a small "sari-sari" store, a Filipino name for variety store, where anyone sells different kinds of goods like rice, soaps, shampoos, drinks, sardines and other products. She is into retailing business since 1990. With her strong entrepreneurial spirit, she still has her store growing and more established. Her husband, Bebiano C. income in his job is not enough to feed and clothe well their family, so she rises to the challenge of venturing into business. Her income goes to pay the electricity, school fees and other needs of her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise in her store. This really could help her attract more customers and will lea to bigger and better sales of her store. 

CEVI is non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They provide credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage to help their clients manage well their business.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena D. R. R. vive Cantón La Nueva Encarnación, Magdalena tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, Magdalena se dedica a la venta de frijoles y verduras .Tras muchos años en este negocio hoy a logrado tener un puesto en el mercado lo cual le facilita vender más rápido sus productos por que sus clientes ya saben dónde encontrarla, es por ello que hoy Magdalena solicita un crédito por que la demanda de sus productos ha ido creciendo y necesita comprar mercadería para surtir mas su puesto y poder percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Magdalena D. R. R. lives in the region of La Nueva Encarnación. Magdalena is 43, is married, and has three children who are minors. Magdalena sells beans and vegetables. After many years in this business, today she has managed to have a stand in the market which makes it easier for her to sell her products more quickly because her customers know where to find her. This is why today Magdalena is requesting a loan because the demand for her products has been increasing, and she needs to purchase merchandise to stock her stand and to be able to make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia A. is a fish vendor. She is  not only to selling fresh fish in the market but also markets dried fish which became her business since 2007. "When I started my business, I was afraid because I might have gotten myself into a wrong decision", she said. "But, I was wrong, my business has helped me earn more for my family and able me to send my children to school", she added. Marcia is 34 years old already. She wants to grow more her business by putting up a small stall where she could display her fish to sell.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. The more display she could have in her stall in the wet market, all the more profit she will get. Her loan will truly help her expand her business.

CEVI is providing her the credit assistance that she needs. She also enjoys free trainings and insurance coverage after she joined the CEVI credit program.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Delfina García

texts.es: Delfina García D. E., vive en Ahuachapán en el occidente D. El Salvador. Delfina es una mujer casada D. 42 años D. edad vive con su esposo y 3 hijos. Delfina y su esposo se enfrentan  a múltiples gastos mes a mes; es por ello que delfina tiene que salir todos los días D. casa a trabajar en su  negocio D. esta manera  ayuda a su esposo en el peso económico que la familia lleva, Delfina  tiene un puesto D. productos D. primera necesidad en el mercado del pueblo en Ahuachapán, ella solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio y así poder percibir mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Delfina García D. E. lives in Ahuachapán in the western part of El Salvador. Delfina is a married woman, is 42, and lives with her husband and 3 children. Delfina and her husband face multiple expenses month to month. This is why Delfina has to leave her house every day to work at her business and to help her husband with the economic weight that the family carries. Delfina has a stand with basic goods in the market in the town of Ahuachapán. She is requesting a credit to supply her business and to be able to receive a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna L. is a herbal medicine dealer. She is 70 years old already, widow and has 6 children. Though she is old, she is still strong able to mange a business. She has been a CEVI client for 4 years already. She has a good repayment record and a good market of her business also.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more herbal medicines which she sells to her friends, neighbors and her other regular clients. She started selling herbal medicines last 1989 using her small savings of Php 10,000. 

Now, Benigna still markets her herbal medicine in their town. Because she is a CEVI client, she has access to credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services that CEVI gives to all their customers.

loans.use: To buy more herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Ostiana

texts.en:
Ostiana T. is 37 years old. She lives in Manutapen village, Kupang District. She became widowed in 2003. She has 2 children, they are Melkianus T., Grade 2 in Senior High School and Dervin T., Grade 3 in junior High School. She runs a kiosk business where she sells a variety of goods for household needs. She is requesting her  second loan from TLM amounting to Rp.3.000.000. The kiosk business is the main source of income for her to meet their daily needs and to finance her children's education.

TLM is the newest partner of Kiva operating in Kupang, West Timor, Indonesia.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Julio Del Transito

texts.es: Julio del Transito M. U., vive en Barrio el Santuario departamento San Vicente tiene 36 años de edad, Julio es un hombre soltero vive con su madre y él es el que lleva los gastos de la casa, Julio estudio hasta el nivel de bachillerato pero se le fue imposible continuar con la universidad, ya que no había quien cubriera los gastos familiares, allí cuando Julio comenzó aprender el oficio de la carpintería; y ahora con muchos años de experiencia tiene su propio negocio, que es una carpintería donde Julio elabora muebles y accesorios tallados en madera. Julio solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para elaboración de muebles.
texts.en:
Julio del Transito M. U. lives in the Santuario neighborhood in the department of San Vicente. He is 36, single, and lives with his mother. He is the one who is responsible for the home's expenses. Julio studied until college, but it was impossible for him to continue with university because there was no one to cover the family expenses. This is when Julio started to learn the carpentry trade. Now with many years of experience, he has his own business, which is a workshop where he makes furniture and accessories carved from wood. Julio is requesting a credit to purchase supplies to make furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for his business

location.town: Barrio el Santuario, departamento San Vicente

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa A. is a fish vendor. She is 43 years old and has 6 children. Her husband, Paterno A. is a fisherman. Whatever fish her husband catches, is what Nimfa sells to her regular buyers. They own a small pump boat. This what her husband uses to fish. Her children are also studying. She and her husband worked very hard to support their education. they want their children to graduate in college. They want them after school to have a good job to support their future children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to repair their pump boat to fish. Some of the loans will also be used to buy fish nets and bait for a good catch. She is also interested to look for some other possible business for her to help more in the family income.

CEVI porvides Nimfa credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage. CEVI helps their clients to start a new business and make it grow.

loans.use: To repair his pumpboat for fishing

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Thlang P. is a 56 year old villager who lives in a medium-size stone house in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He earns a living driving a taxi motorbike in and around his community. He also provides a photography service to visitors in a tourist area. Thlang is married with two children who are still young and are going to school. His wife Sophal (who is pictured above) is 27 years old and makes a living sewing clothes for the neighborhood.

Thlang is asking for a loan to use for his wife's business. They will purchase more sewing machines and other necessary tools in order to fulfill customer demands.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing machine and necessary tools.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trần Thị Bé năm nay 55  tuổi , gia đình chị có hai con đang học đại học. Năm 2007  chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh hàng nước. Anh Đức chồng chị hiện làm thợ sửa chũa xe đạp. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ từ kinh daonh và công việc sửa xe của chồng chị Bé không chỉ hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn mà còn có thêm điều kiện để đầu tư cho hai con đi học
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn mua thêm các loại chè, nước giải khát về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trần Thị Bé, 55 years old, has two children who are both attending university. In 2007, she became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in a business selling beverages. Her husband Đức works repairing bicycles. With a total monthly income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) from her business and her husband’s earnings repairing bicycles, Mrs. Bé was not only able to repay her loan on time but was also able to pay for her two children to go to school. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy various types of tea and soft drinks to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling tea and soft drinks

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle T. is a 39-year-old married mother of a high school student.  Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells the fish he catches at market.  Annabelle has applied for this loan to buy a new fishing boat for her husband to use; she hopes that one day they will be able to own two boats.  Annabelle says she has begun to save money to realize two dreams, one of renovating the family house, and the other of sending her child to college.

loans.use: To buy a new outrigger fishing boat.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 38  tuổi , chị đang sống cùng chồng và ba con đang tuổi đến trườngtại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện taị cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang chăn nuôi lợn gà và buôn bán rau quả tại chợ. Nhờ có sự giúp đỡ  của chồng nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh daonh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L., 38 years old, lives with her husband and three school-age children in the town Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Mrs. L. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, both she and her husband work raising pigs and chickens, and selling fruits and vegetables at the local market. With the help of her husband, the family businesses are doing extremely well and provide them with an income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in the family enterprises.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs, chickens, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cerena

texts.en:
Cerena is 27 year old, married and blessed with 1 child. She rents a tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar used a public utility vehicle) from her relative and let her husband drive it to earn income for them.  Students and the employees of her village who regularly commute to town center of San Jose are her passengers. 

She needs a load so that she can register the tricycle and be given a legal franchise to operate the vehicle as a public utility vehicle. 

She intends to save a part of her income to realize her dream to buy her own tricycle. She also dreams to send her son to school until he finishes his studies.

loans.use: For registration of the tricycle as a public transportation

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải  năm nay 40 tuổi , gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có  H. con đang học. Chị Hải tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Hiện tại chị đang chăn nuôi lợn tịa nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề đánh cá. Ngoài thời gian chăn nuôi chị Hải còn tranh thủ đi làm thuê để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Hải đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 1 con bò và mua thêm cá giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hải, 40 years old, has four children, of whom two are still in school. She has participated in the TYM Fund for the past ten years. Currently, she raises pigs, and her husband is a fish farmer. When she is not taking care of her animals, Mrs. Hải takes advantage of any spare time to earn some extra money working part time. With a total monthly income of 5,000,000 VND (288 USD), the financial situation of her family is improving and becoming more secure. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND (575 USD), to buy a cow and some breeding fish.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow and breeding fish

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is engaged in  a variety store business and her current loan will be utilized to purchase additional merchandise for sale like canned goods, softdrinks, etc. She started this business when she resigned from her previous job. Because her variety store is located very near in village square she sees the potential of expanding her business.

As she adds more stocks in her little store this may be the starting point of her plan to establish a larger convenience store for the future. She wants to be a progressive entrepreneur someday and build her dream house for her children.

loans.use: purchasing of canned goods, softdrinks

loans.name: Vevincia

texts.en:
Vevincia H. is a fish vendor. She is 49 years old and has 8 children. Her husband, Luis H. is a fisherman. Every time her husband catches plenty of fish, she sells them to the villagers for additional income. She was not happy to just sit in the house and wait for her husband. She wanted to help and contribute something in the family income. She loves her children very much. She wanted to send all of them to college. She dreamed that someday her children will find a good job that they could be proud for them to support their future families also.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing equipment like nets, baits and to repair his boat.  The loan will truly help Vevincia to sustain her business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization which helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients with credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia L. is engaged in several businesses. She sells cosmetics products and recently she markets shark's oil products that can treat pimples and other skin irritations. She is also a seamstress. When she is not busy in her cosmetics trade, she makes nice colorful dress for her customers. She is 50 years old and has only 1 child. She worked very hard to help her husband to support the needs of their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more shark's oil products to sell and repair her sewing machine. She is also interested to start a new business to augment more her income.

CEVI provides their client the credit assistance that they need to run their business. Aside from that, they give all their clients trainings and insurance coverage to make their business grow.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine and buy shark's oil products for sale

loans.name: Abdushukur

texts.en:
Abdushukur K. is 39 years old and has a public transport business. He drives a microbus “Gazelle,” which he bought with a loan from Orienbank. He’s worked in public transportation for two years, and during that time his business has done very well, which enabled him to purchase a second microbus with his own money. He is brigade-leader of route № 2, and drives one bus while leasing out the other. Abdushukur now wishes to expand his business by buying another microbus. For this reason he has applied for a loan of $3000 USD for the term of 12 months. With your support, he will continue to progress.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchasing of new microbus for expanding business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. owns a small sari-sari (variety) store. She sells goods like rice, soaps, sardines, instant noodles, edible oil, chicken feed, Coca-Cola and other canned goods to earn a living. Her profit helps her feed and clothe her family. Because of her store, she was able to pay the tuition fees, books, and other school projects of her 3 children. Her husband, Efren P. is a fisherman. Every night except for typhoons, her husband goes out to fish. When they have a big catch, they also sell fish in their village.

Evangeline is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her store. In that way, she believes, she can attract more customers. That will lead Evangeline to earn more profit and support her family's needs well.

CEVI is helping her sustain her business even more. She is provided with the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients. In this way, she can make her small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy additional  merchandise for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela M. G. vive en Lourdes, Blanca tiene 41 años de edad. Blanca se dedica día a día en su negocio, que lo ha podido mantener ya por 4 años. Como se puede ver en la fotografía Blanca tiene una pequeña tienda con una escaza variedad en productos, el sueño de Blanca es poder surtir su negocio, ya que vive en una colonia con mucha afluencia de personas pero lastimosamente no logra satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes porque carece de muchos productos que las personas llegan a comprar, es por ello que Blanca solicita un crédito para surtir su tienda y que sus clientes estén satisfechos por que encuentran lo que buscan y también Blanca lograra percibir mejores ingresos que le ayudaran a seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela M. G. lives in Lourdes. She is 41. She dedicates herself day after day to her business, which she has had for 4 years now. As you can see in the picture, Blanca has a small store with a scarce variety of products. Blanca's dream is to be able to supply her business since she lives in a town with a lot of people. Unfortunately, she isn't able to satisfy the needs of her customers because she lacks a lot of the products that people come to buy. This is why Blanca is requesting a credit: to be able to supply her store so her customers will be satisfied and find what they are looking for. Blanca will also be able to gain a better income, which will help her keep investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
For the past 4 years, Zarrina has sold children’s clothing. She is a married mother of four children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Zarrina is hard-working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Zarrina has a strong business base. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a new vending facility and expand her business. With the increased income, Zarrina plans to continue growing her business and to improve the financial situation of her family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing her working capital with the purpose of business development

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en:
K. Alijon is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 22 and lives with his parents. Alijon has a small grocery and sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. That's why he has applied to IMON International for a loan of 600 US Dollars. This loan will allow him to buy bigger amounts of goods for re-sale and to better provide for his family and save more money to be able to get married. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: Purchasing  foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Izzatillo

texts.en:
K. Izzatillo is a 45-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. Izzatillo works as an inspector for the government agency of social insurance and pensions. Since he earns little, he also runs a business raising and selling cattle. He has 10 years of experience in this field. 

Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Izzatillo has become a very successful businessman. Izzatillo has a friendly family who are always try to help each other. Thus with their cattle raising business, his wife and elder son help him. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now Izzatillo wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of 850 USD. He promises to repay the loan within 10 months and thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Izzatillo can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the family business

loans.name: Safarboy

texts.en:
Safarboy is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales.

This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Safarboy hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring in better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that will permit him to continue developing his business.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Minavar

texts.en:
S. Minavar is a 52-year-old widow. She has a son from her marriage. Minavar works cultivating a small farm, which she has done for more than 20 years. She grows different types of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. Every day she gets up very early. At 5 AM, Minavar drives to the produce market in the capital to sell her products, while her son takes care of the daily work on the farm.

Minavar is very proud of the work they've done together, she and her beloved son, and grateful that they've been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home. They have made good use of the loans since today it's very difficult without the extra help. Minavar is applying for a loan through IMON International for the fourth time. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticide that they need for their business.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
A. Rano is 48 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Rano has been running her business already for 5 years. With the assistance of her daughters, she fries and bakes pasties and patties with meat. They also have a small snack-bar serving their pasties and patties.

Rano and her daughters are very nice and polite people which allows them to have their clientele. The stability of business generates income for supporting the family. Today Rano requests 800 US Dollars in order to buy plates and dishes for her business and to repair the roof of her small snack-bar. Rano has gained a reputation for responsibility with her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.
