Currently, she makes funeral accesories (paper replicas of real world items burnt as offerings for the dead), and her husband Thu works as a glass window installer. She joined TYM Fund in 2008 to borrow funds for her funeral accesories business. After a year, with the additional fund and hard work, her family's income has become increasingly stable at 3,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying bamboo and paper for her funeral paper offerings business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Suria Yovanny

texts.es: Suria Yovanny  esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para terminar de construir la cocina, labora desde hace 5 años como docente de Educación primaria, inicio dando clase en la comarca la Hamaca a unos 18 kilometros de la colonia, hasta este año la trasladaron a dar clases en la zona Urbana de la colonia Jacinto Baca, Suria a pesar que ella no tiene hijos se encarga del cuido y los gastos de 2 hermanitos que tiene a su cargo, ya que sus padres se mantienen en la finca trabajando, actualmente los tiene estudiando el niño mayor estudia 5to grado y el menor 2do grado en el mismo colegio que ella trabaja, se caracteriza por ser una joven de buena conducta, buena maestra, responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora. Actualmente esta estudiando su 2do año en la universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea, su sueño esterminar sus estudios, ir mejorando su vivienda con cada crédito otorgado por AFODENIC, salud para su familia y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Suria Yovanny is requesting refinancing of her second credit to finsih constructing her kitchen. She has worked for five years as an elementary school teacher. She started teaching in the region of Hamaca, which is eighteen kilometers from her town. Last year they moved her to teach in the urban area of Jacinto Baca. Even though Suria doesn't have kids, she is responsible for the care and expenses of her two little brothers since her parents are at their family's farm working. Currently the oldest boy is in fifth grade and the youngest is in second grade in the same school where she works. She is a well-behaved young woman, a good teacher, responsible, honest, and very hard-working. She is in her second year in the URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea University. Her dreams are to finish her studies, to keep improving her home with each credit offered to her by AFODENIC, that her family has good health, and to have stable employment.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a kitchen

loans.name: Darwin Eddy

texts.es: El joven Darwin está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es la construcción de una habitación para darle mejores condiciones a su familia,  tiene un hijo de 2 añitos de edad, su esposa se encarga del cuido del niño y los quehaceres del hogar, Darwin  esta estudiando una licenciatura en la Universidad URACCAN, tiene munchos deseos de superación profesional y personal,  en el colegio donde el  labora es muy querido por sus alumnos, padres de familia y docentes porque se ha caracterizado por ser un joven muy humilde pero bien responsable con sus deberes,  Su sueño es  tener una vivienda digna como todo cuidadano desea , tener salud  y trabajo para ayudar a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos economico.
texts.en:
Young Darwin is requesting refinancing of his second loan to invest it in the improvement of his house, more specifically, the construction of a room to provide better conditions to his family. He has a son who is two years old. His wife is in charge of taking care of their child and the housework. Darwin is studying to get a BA at the URACCAN University. He has many professional and personal desires to get ahead. In the school where he works, he is much loved by the students, parents and teachers because he is known for being a humble young man who is responsible with his duties. His dream is to have a decent housing, as all citizens wish, to have his health and a job so he may help his family since they have scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Bich Loan

texts.vi: Chị Loan năm nay 27  tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương từ năm 2008. Hiện tại hai vợ chồng chị Loan đều tham gia kinh doanh buôn bán hàng khô. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi lấy các loại thực phẩm khô như  cá khô, tôm tép từ các nhà sản xuất về cho chị bán buônn, bán lẻ tại chợ . Công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển tốt và đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Loan is 27 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2008. Currently, Mrs. Loan and her husband sell dried goods. Her husband purchases goods such as dried fish and shrimp from factories for her to resell at the market. Her business is growing and brings her family an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim K., a local entrepreneur in Makeni City. Ibrahim is requesting a loan in order to give strength to his business. Ibrahim is a welder and would like to get a loan in order to buy working materials like metals, iron bars, etc.

Ibrahim is forty-two, married with five children. Four of his children are in secondary school and the last one is in nursery school. He was born in a small town called Kamabai about twenty-two miles from Makeni City. Ibrahim has been in the welding business for over fifteen years now. 

This will be the second loan Ibrahim will be receiving from KIVA through SMT. The previous loan made a tremendous impact on the life of this entrepreneur. With this new loan, Ibrahim will feel very good as it will enable his business to flourish, he told me.

loans.use: Buy working materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is fifty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three females and three males. According to her, all of her children are out of school and living independently. The last born, a male is a professional teacher. She lives with her husband and her last-born in a family house in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are in commercial activities.

Beatrice is a trader. She procures her goods from shops in her community at retail prices. She wants a bigger working capital so she can travel and buy directly from wholesalers at effective prices. Beatrice sells on a table top in front of her house to neighbors in her community. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure groceries  for re-sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị  Nguyễn Thị Nhàn  năm nay 44 tuổi, gia đình chị cps hai con đã trưởng thành và đều có công việc làm ổn định.  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm 2009 và đang  chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà. Anh Tứ  chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập 70.000đ/ ngày. Hnàg tháng ngoài thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và lương làm thợ xây của chồng gia đình chị còn có thêm sự hỗ trợ của các con với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 44 years old. Her family has two grown children with stable jobs. She joined TYM Fund in 2009 to invest in raising pigs at home. Her husband Tu works as a construction worker with an income of 70,000 VND per month. Each month, the combined income of her husband's salary, her business and her children's financial help is at 4,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 5,000,000 VND to buy more pigs for raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama Ataa-Asomani is married and the mother of one girl. She is 50 years old. Her child is in the basic school. Ama lives with the daughter and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi (a gold mining town) in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai are into commercial activities. Her husband runs a provisions store, while she is a seamstress by profession.

She buys fabrics and other accessories from Kumasi and sews items for sale. She also sews for clients who come with their own materials. She says she procures the materials and sews for people who place orders but pay no deposit amount. Ama’s shop is located at the market square. She has been in business for over 20 years and has trained a number of apprentices who have graduated and are running their own businesses. She still has some apprentices who are under training.

Ama says she wants a loan to buy a variety of materials in bulk. It is her dream to help her husband put up a structure for the family and give their child the best education.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. Fati tells us her two youngest children are currently in school and the rest are married and live independently with their spouses. Fati lives with her husband and their two younger children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Bekwai, close to Obuasi, a gold-mining town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. The majority of the inhabitants of Bekwai engage in commercial activities.

Fati trades in fresh yam to earn some income to support her husband and cater for the family. She procures the fresh yam all the way from Ejura in the Brong Ahafo region, where prices are more economical. She then distributes the yam to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for eight years.

Fati wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure yam tubers in bulk. She hopes to support her husband so that they can improve upon their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati M. is a 26-year-old local restaurant operator currently living with her parent. She is single and has one child who is in school. Fati has been in food provision for over ten years now. She understands customer ethics and focuses on quality and excellent service.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku, and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, Fati has attracted lots of local customers. It has therefore become necessary to employ assistants to help her with food delivery.

Fati tells us that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare her meals. She is grateful for this assistance. She also hopes to receive GH¢ 600 to expand her business by restocking her inventory.

Fati belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Aubierge

texts.fr:
Née le 20 Août 1974 à Sèmè-Podji dans le département du LITTORAL,G. A. Aubierge est originaire de la ville historique d'ABOMEY dans le département du ZOU. Aubierge est photographe et reporteur-vidéo de formation. C'est par manque de moyens financiers pour s'acheter des appareils afin d'exercer sa profession qui fait qu'elle s'est lancée dans le commerce. Aubierge est Mariée à DJIHOKIN Basile un mécanicien vélo moteur de formation.  Aubierge est mère de 2 filles et d'un garçon tous scolarisés. La famille d'Aubierge vit en location à Hlacomey, un quartier périphérique de la ville de COTONOU où elle mène depuis 15 ans l'activité de vente de divers (savons, riz en sac de 5Kg, 10Kg et 20Kg, laits concentrés, tomates en boîte, huile d'arachide, des détergents, des papiers de toilette, des cartons de sucre, des pâtes alimentaires comme des spaghettis, des fournitures scolaires, etc.). Depuis 4 ans maintenant, Aubierge a ouvert un télécentre à Tokpa , le marché international du BENIN où elle vend des cartes de recharges de tous les réseaux téléphoniques au Bénin.  Aubierge dispose de quatre combinés téléphoniques pour permettre aux usagers du marché d'émettre et de recevoir des appels téléphoniques. C'est Aubierge elle-même qui s'occupe du télécentre au marché Tokpa. A la maison  Aubierge se fait aider par l'une de ses sœurs dans la vente de divers. Aubierge a 5 personnes en charge; ce qui fait qu'elle dépense en moyenne 3000 FCFA par jour pour les dépenses alimentaires de sa famille. Aubierge envisage créer encore un étalage de divers à côté de son télécentre au marché Tokpa. C'est pourquoi Aubierge sollicite un troisième crédit.


p> 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born on August 20, 1974 in Sèmè-Podji, in Littoral County, Ms. G. A. Aubierge traces her roots to the historic city of ABOMEY, in Zou County. Aubierge is a photographer and video-reporter by training. Because she lacks the financial means for buying cameras, so as to practice her profession, she got started in commerce.

Aubierge is married to Mr. DJIHOKIN Basile, a motorbike mechanic by training. She is the mother of two girls and a boy who are all in school. Her family lives in a rental in Hlacomey, an outlying district of the city of COTONOU, where her business of 15 years has been in selling various goods (soaps; rice in sacks of 5-, 10-, and 20-kg; evaporated milk, canned tomatoes; peanut oil; detergents; toilet paper; boxes of sugar; pasta such as spaghetti, school supplies, etc.)

Four years ago now, she opened a telephone center in Tokpa, the international marketplace of BENIN, where she sells recharge phone cards of all the telephone networks in Bénin. She has four phones allowing market-goers to make and receive phone calls. Aubierge herself is the one who takes care of the telecenter at the Tokpa marketplace.

Back at the house, she has the help of a sister of hers in selling various goods. Aubierge has five people to support, which means she spends 3,000 francs CFA on average for food per day for her family.

She envisions creating another display of goods next to her telecenter at the Tokpa marketplace. This is why she's requesting a third loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, rice, other grocery items, and school supplies

loans.name: Jose Celestino

texts.es: Flavio Julio es un pequeño productor agropecuario que desde muy joven a dedicado su vida a la siembra de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, cuenta con la experiencia en las actividades productivas. Su familia esta compuesta por 6 personas, todos sus hijos son mayores y trabajan en coordinacion familiar para la siembra de arroz, su esposa atiende el hogar despachando muy temprano a su marido hacia sus areas de cultivo; don Flavio sueña con participar en la construccion de un trillo y se materializara con la presente solicitud de este credito.
texts.en:
Flavio Julio es un pequeño productor agropecuario que desde muy joven a dedicado su vida a la siembra de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, cuenta con la experiencia en las actividades productivas. Su familia esta compuesta por 6 personas, todos sus hijos son mayores y trabajan en coordinacion familiar para la siembra de arroz, su esposa atiende el hogar despachando muy temprano a su marido hacia sus areas de cultivo; don Flavio sueña con participar en la construccion de un trillo y se materializara con la presente solicitud de este credito.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aporte para construccion de trillo arrocero

loans.name: Sehllin Liseth

texts.es: La joven Sehllin vende ropa, nueva, usada, zapatos y electrodomésticos, negocio que inicio desde hace siete años, con capital propio y ayuda que dio su mama. Tiene 29 años de edad, reside en Loma linda en la ciudad de Managua, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad, su esposo es maestro de obra. Con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de ropa variada, zapatos y comprar tres pacas de ropa para ofrecer a su clientela y poder mejorar los ingresos a través de sus ventas. El  objetivo de este inventario es la captación de nuevos clientes. Sus planes para su hijo es poder hacerle un cuarto para que tenga privacidad.
texts.en:
Young Sehllin sells new and used clothing, shoes and appliances, a business she started seven years ago with her own money and help that her mother gave. She is 29 years old and lives in Loma Linda in the city of Managua. She has a five year old child. Her husband is a construction foreman. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of varied clothing and shoes and to buy three bales of clothing to offer to her customers and to be able to improve her earnings through these sales. The objective of this inventory is to capture new customers. Her plans for her child are to be able to make a room so he may have privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults and shoes.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Damascene N. in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean Damascene is 40 years old and is married with three children.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he sells bed covers and bed sheets at Nyabugogo market in Kigali. He has owned the business for three years and employs one person to help him to run the business. He works every day from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 150,000 Rwandan francs per month (about $275).

Jean Damascene N. is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 Rwandan francs from Vision Finance Company S.A. With the increased profits that result from his loan, he plans to pay school fees for his child and to reinvest in his business. The loan will be repaid over eight months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To increase stock of bed covers and bed sheets to sell at market.

loans.name: Ndagijimana

texts.en:
Greetings from entrepreneur D. Ndagijimana in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda!

D. Ndagijimana is 31 years old and married with 1 child. He owns a small shop in Kigali city center where he sells various cosmetic products such as creams, lotions, powders, perfumes, lipsticks, nail polish, makeup, permanent waves, hair colors, hair sprays and gels, deodorants, baby products, bath oils, butters and many other products. He has owned his business for nine years and employs one person to help him to run the shop. He works every day from 7:00am to 8:30pm and earns a profit of approximately 180,000 Rwandan Francs each month ($315 USD).

D. is requesting a loan of 400,000 Rwf from VFC, which he will repay on monthly basis over eight months. He hopes to pay school fees for his child and reinvest in his business with the increased profits that result from this loan.

loans.use: expand his business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
O. Fatima est née vers 1966. Fatima est mariée et mère de quatre 4 enfants: deux sont scolarisés et les deux autres sont en apprentissage. Fatima vend de la nourriture au quartier Saint-Martin, non loin de la perception, à proximité de son domicile. Fatima est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé et à son deuxième crédit avec Kiva. Fatima a pu développer et maintenir son activité de restauration grâce différents prêts qu'elle a eu de ALIDé et de Kiva. Fatima sollicite encore de  crédit pour développer un peu plus son entreprise de restauration populaire afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de façon conséquente. 

p> 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
O. Fatima was born around 1966. She is married and the mother of four children: two are in school, and the other two are in apprenticeships. She sells food in the Saint-Martin district, not far from the tax collector's office and near her home. Fatima is on her fourth loan with ALIDE and her second loan with KIVA. She was able to develop and maintain her restaurant business, thanks to different loans she had with ALIDE and with KIVA. She's requesting a loan again in order to develop her popular restaurant enterprise a little more. The demand from her customers may then be satisfied substantially.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of rice, 3 boxes of pasta (macaroni), 10 liters of peanut oil, and also some condiments

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es: Doña Rafaela es una mujer con mucho deseo de superación a sus 51 años de edad sigue trabajando, medio tiempo trabaja de cocinera, en un comedor y por las tardes vende ropa, y productos de cosmético que desde hace diez años inicio este negocio que lo comenzó con dinero propio. La señora Rafaela reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua Memorial sandino, con dos hijos 19 y 15 años de edad, ambos están estudiando. Sus anhelo es poder poner su propio negocio en su casa y no andar ambulante, este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic lo cual ha sido de beneficios para su desarrollo y seguimiento en el crecimiento de su inventario. Con este crédito va a comprar cosméticos y perfumes para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad. A futuro es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para que sus hijos estén cómodos.
texts.en:
Rafaela is a woman with much desire to get ahead. At 51 years of age, she continues to work. Half the time she works as a cook in a cafeteria and in the afternoons she sells clothing and cosmetic products, a business she started ten years ago with her own money. Rafaela lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua with her two children who are 19 and 15 years old. Both are students. Her desire is to be able to establish her own business in her home, as opposed to on foot. This is her fourth loan with Afodenic, which has been beneficial to her development and the source of growth of her inventory. With this loan, she is going to purchase cosmetics and perfumes to offer variety to her customers. In the future, she wants to be able to improve the infrastructure of her home so that that her children are comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Murekatete

texts.en:
Greetings from Murekatete J. in the Kicukiro district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! J. is a 43-year-old widow who takes care of four children.

This entrepreneur owns a sewing workshop and also has wedding clothes to rent. Her shop is located in the Kigali city center. She has owned the business for 10 years and employs three people to help her with its operation. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. and earns a profit of approximately 250,000 Rwandan Francs each month (about $325). With the increased profits that result from her loan, J. hopes to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

Murekatete J. is requesting a loan worth 500,000Rwf from Kiva's partner, Vision Finance Company s.a, which will be repaid over eight months on monthly basis.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor lives in Kahovka in the Kherson region. After he resigned from his previous job, he decided to start his own business to allow him to earn a decent living. Today Igor owns a footwear-sales business and sells his inventory by traveling to different markets in his region. The business is the only source of income for him. Igor works very hard in order to bring in enough income.

Igor has been in this business for seven years. Currently, his turnover capital is over 60,000 Grivnas. Igor would like to get a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to generate additional profit. One of his long-term plans is to eventually expand his trade.

We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Igor develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other entrepreneurs will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Sandem

texts.en:
Sandem L. is 39 years old. She is married and has six children. All her children are still in school except her last-born, who is being breastfed. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and other foodstuffs like tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts, etc. to increase her inventory.

She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She also hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. Sandem belongs to a village bank called "Bamali Allah," which means "It is only God who can do it."

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana N. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids who are currently all in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She sells in a community called Bekwai in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She has been selling yams for almost four years to support her family. Diana also sells second hand footwear through hawking, in addition to her existing business. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply of yams. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk and footwear to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her kids in school. She also hopes to use the GHS700 loan to develop her business by restocking her inventory. Diana belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk and footwear to retail to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Doña Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, estado civil casada, su esposo es taxista tiene su vehiculo propio. Dentro de sus proyecto esta la terminación de la construcción de su casa para brindarse seguridad y protección a su pequeño hogar. Ella se desempeña como trabajadora social desde hace siete años, con esta solicitud la Señora. Rosa va ha invertir en materiales de construcción como: cemento, perlines, arena y hierro para terminar de construir y elevar el nivel del techo de su casa. Sus planes a futuro es poder seguir ayudando a los niños de la calle.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old and lives in Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. She is marreid. Her husband is a taxi driver and he has his own vehicle. Among their projects is to complete the construction of their house in order to provide security and protection to their small home. She has worked as a social worker for seven years. With this loan, Rosa is going to invest in construction materials such as cement, wood frames, sand and iron in order to finish constructing and elevating the roof level of her home. Her future plans are to be able to continue helping the street children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials in order to finish her home.

loans.name: Isheitu

texts.en:
Isheitu S. started her trading business fifteen years ago at Bekwai, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Isheitu prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality smoked fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots, green peppers, etc. in the community market. She is now 45 years old and married with five children, who are currently in school. Her husband is a security man for a cocoa company in Kumasi. She has been struggling with a lack of funds to develop her business. 

She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted fishes and vegetables to increase sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. She also hope to use the GHS700 loan to restock her inventory. Isheitu belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables like pepper, tomatoes, smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Olinda Lucinda

texts.es:
RAMÍREZ D. GARCÍA OLINDA LUCINDA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. José Gálvez N° 120 ed distrito D. Yarinacocha, tiene 66 años, 02 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo independiente.

Ella se ha dedicado al servicio D. alquiler D. cuartos por eso el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invirtió en refaccionar un cuarto con el que pudo tener un ingreso para cubrir sus letras. 

Como vio que es rentable el alquilar cuartos, ella ha decidido refaccionar mas cuartos.
Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500. Nuevos Soles, podrá refaccionar más cuartos para darle el acabado y seguridad que necesita para estar en optimas condiciones para dar en alquiler.

Por el momento se encuentra muy contenta con Manuela Ramos y espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Olinda belongs to the Las Alemendras ("The Almonds") Community Bank. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha, is 66 years old, has two children, and her spouse has an independent job. She is dedicated to renting out rooms. As a result, her first loan of 300 Soles was invested in the remodeling of a room with which she was able to have income to cover her bills. Since she has seen that renting rooms is profitable, she has decided to repair more rooms. With this loan of 1,500 Soles, she will be able to remodel more rooms in order to give them the finish and security that is needed to be in optimal conditions for renting. For the moment, she is very happy with Manuela Ramos and hopes to continue to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will serve to remodel rooms that will be rented.

loans.name: Alhasan

texts.en:
Alhasan B. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of five kids. She lives in Bekwai zongo community with her husband. Her husband is a security man for a company. Zongo in Ghana is a place which is dominated by Muslims.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernel, and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual labour to help produce larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more towards her children's education. Alhasan belongs to a village bank called ‘Jordan’. She hopes to receive GHS700 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor Juan Francisco tiene 31 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación, su esposa le tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando, ella vende ropa. El trabaja como operario de centro de servicio desde hace cinco años inicio con ayuda de un amigo que lo recomendó y por su buen desempeño ha logrado mantener su trabajo. Con esta solicitud de crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa como cambiar el techo, cambiar unas puertas. Sus planes es poder tener toda las condiciones de una vivienda para que su familia este bien y poder gozar de las mejoras que gracias Afodenic ha logrado hacer parte de sus proyectos y espera seguir adelante y con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Francisco is 31 and lives in Villa Reconciliación. He and his wife have 4 children who are in school. His wife sells clothing. He has worked at a service station for 5 years. He started with the help of a friend who recommended him and because of his good performance, he has been able to keep his job. With this request for a credit, he wants to purchase construction materials to make improvements to his house like replacing the roof and some doors. His plans are to have all of the conditions of a home that his family needs to be well and to be able to enjoy the improvements. Thanks to Afodenic, he has managed to complete part of his projects, and he hopes to get ahead and have his home be in better condition.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to repair his roof and replace some doors

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa R. is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of two kids who are currently in school. She lives in Bekwai, Zongo community with her husband. Her husband works with the local council in the community. Zongo in Ghana is a place which is dominated by Muslims.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual labour to help produce larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more towards her children's education. Hawa belongs to a village bank called ‘Allah Febiri’. She hopes to receive GHS500 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Zaratu

texts.en:
Zaratu I. is a 57 year old mother of four children. She is very hard working and resourceful for her family. She lives with her husband and the children at Bekwai, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband is a "Mallan" which means someone who looks into the future, can also heal you when you are sick, and can also protect you spiritually etc.

She trades in charcoal in her neighborhood, something she has done for four years. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Zaratu obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Obuasi, where she purchase them from specific villages like Eduporsu and Awhiam in the Ashanti region, where she lives, and then retails the charcoal to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy charcoal in bulk to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings and pay for her children's educational fees. She would be grateful for your assistance. Zaratu belongs to a village bank called ‘Shei Allah’. She also hope to receive GHS900 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr:
H. Adèle est née le 31 Décembre 1975 à Cotonou, la capitale économique du BENIN. Adèle est  couturière de formation; elle exerce son métier dans son atelier situé dans la rue opposée à l'église Saint Michel de Cotonou. Adèle s'est mariée à YEBA Augustin, garçon de salle au Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire du Bénin. Adèle est mère de deux enfants dont l'aîné fait la maternelle. Adèle est actuellement à son quatrième crédit et elle sollicite ce crédit pour mieux s'approvisionner en certains produits qu'elle n'arrive pas à vendre jusque là faute de moyens financiers. Adèle met beaucoup de rigueur dans la gestion de son activité afin de pouvoir bien rembourser son crédit et bénéficier d'autre prêt. Car les crédits qu'elle obtient lui ont toujours permis de fidéliser ses clients et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
H. Adèle was born on December 31, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN. She is a dressmaker by training and works at her trade in her shop, located on the street opposite the church of Saint Michel de Cotonou. Adèle is married to YEBA Augustin, a room assistant at the Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire du Bénin. She is the mother of two children, the eldest being in kindergarten.

Adèle is currently on her fourth loan and is requesting this loan to supply herself better with certain goods she has not been able to sell so far due to a lack of funds. She puts a lot of rigor into managing her business, so as to be sure to repay her loan and to obtain other loans. This is because loans always enable her to win the loyalty of her customers and to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two bolts of cloth and some sewing-related items

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es: Doña Johana vende ropa desde hace veinticinco años, que inicio con dinero propio y préstamo que Afodenic ha otorgado, este negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia, tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa reconciliación con cuatro hijos dos de ellos mayores de edad, los cuales trabajan, su esposo trabaja de conductor es por eso que desea crecer en inventario ya que el salario de su esposo es bajo y todo esta caro, lleva once créditos en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa para niño, damas y caballeros, también va invertir en la compra de prendas de plata que se esta vendiendo mucho. Con esto espera obtener mejores ingreso y captar clientes.
texts.en:
Johana has sold clothing for 25 years, something she started doing with her own money and with a loan that Kiva partner Afodenic authorized. She started this business with the goal of helping her family. She is 42 years old, living in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood with four children, two of whom are older and working. Her husband works as a conductor, ** and this is why she wants to build her inventory - because her husband's salary is low and everything is expensive. She has received 11 loans from Kiva partner Afodenic, and with this one she will purchase clothing for children, women, and men, as well as purchase silver pieces, which are selling well. Through this, she hopes to earn more income and attract more customers. **Translator's note: The meaning of the word "conductor" is slightly vague. It is most likely that Johana's husband is a driver for some type of public transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for children and adults, as well as silver pieces

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
T. P. OLGA LUZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Agustín Cauper N° 458 del distrito de Calería, tiene 33 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo como estibador.

Ingresó al negocio de lácteos, y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, pudo comprar leche y dedicarse a elaborar  yogur, queso, manjar y otros, pero el negocio demandaba mucho tiempo y cuidado, por lo que inició el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, zapatos, artículos de limpieza y belleza. Por ello para incrementar su negocio le caerá muy bien este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual comprará zapatos, zapatillas, camisas, faldas, medias para la campaña escolar y también un surtido de materiales de limpieza y  de belleza.
Manuela Ramos le ayudo mucho a desarrollarse, a tener un negocio propio y no ser dependiente del cónyuge, sino a administrar ella misma sus ganancia y contribuir con la familia.
texts.en:
Olga Luz T. P. belongs to the "Las Alemendras" Communal Bank in the district of Calería. She is 33 years old, has three children, and her husband works as a stevedore. She entered the dairy business, and with her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy milk and produce yogurt, cheese, manjar, etc. This business, however, required a lot of time and care, so she began another business buying and selling clothing, shoes, and cleaning and beauty products. This loan of 1,500 soles would do well to help expand her business. She will use it to buy shoes, slippers, shirts, skirts, tights for school uniforms and also a supply of cleaning and beauty supplies. Manuela Ramos has helped her develop a great deal--she has her own business, isn't dependent on her husband, is in charge of her own income and contributes to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, slippers, shirts, skirts, tights, cleaning and beauty products

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: Alimatu S. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Through this business, Alimatu has supported two of her children to finish senior high school, and the others are currently in school. Alimatu lives with her husband, who is a security man, together with their children. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey as well as maize, something she has done for twenty years. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, because many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, as well as firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. Alimatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Jordan’. She also hope to receive GH800 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, as well as firewood.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura tiene 56 años, es natural de la ciudad de Loreto, viven con su esposo Víctor y su hijo José de 16 años de edad, ellos viven en su casa propia. Se dedica desde hace 2 años a la elaboración y venta de artesanías, las cuales elabora en su casa, ayudada por su esposo y su hijo; entre los 3 realizan la producción de hasta 1000 pulseras, collares, y otros accesorios tejidos a base de hilos, ellos trabajan a pedido, los cuales se exportan hacia el extranjero. La producción en la que trabajan actualmente está destinada al país de Ecuador, lugar donde estas pulseras son muy cotizadas por sus llamativos colores y bonitos diseños, pero su elaboración no es nada fácil ya que demanda mucho tiempo, dedicación, precisión y además una buena visión para lograr los acabados finales. Maura y su esposo tienen problemas con esto último; ya que los años, como ellos mismos dicen, no pasan en vano y el producir en grandes cantidades hace que muchas veces les salga ampollas y callos en las manos complicando más su trabajo. A pesar de estos inconvenientes están felices ya que es un buen negocio, el cual les arroja buenos ingresos económicos y así solventan los gastos de su hogar y de los estudios de su hijo, es por eso que siguen trabajando con mucha fé en el futuro esperando progresar cada vez más. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de hilos en variedad de colores, además de algunas herramientas para poder producir con mayor facilidad sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Maura is 56 years old and a native of the city of Loreto. She lives with her spouse, Victor, in their own house with their 16-year-old son José. For the past two years, she has produced handicrafts in her home with the help of her husband and son. Among the three of them, they have produced up to 1,000 bracelets, necklaces and other woven accessories. They make products to order, which they export abroad. The products they currently work on are headed for Ecuador, where the bracelets are known for their striking colors and beautiful designs. They are not easy to make--they require a great deal of time, dedication, precision and also good vision to achieve the finished product. Maura and her husband have problems with the latter; the years, as they say, do not pass in vain and producing such large quantities by hand often leaves them with blisters and calluses. Apart from these inconveniences, they are happy because it's a good business that brings them a good income and allows them to cover their expenses and support their son's studies. Because of this, they work with much faith in their future, hoping for more progress each time. With this loan, they will buy more thread in a variety of colors, as well as some tools that will allow them to produce their handicrafts more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for handicrafts

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Through this business, Alimatu has supported all her children to finish senior high school and they now work on their own. Mariama lives with her husband at Bekwai zongo community in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Mariama owns milling machines in her community, where people come to mill their stock of cereals. Currently, she owns cassava, tomato, and maize milling machines. She happens to be the major operator in the area for the community. Of late, she has been losing a few customers because of the frequent breakdown of her machines. She has been operating these machines for close to eleven years now, and has lots of experience. She wants to purchase new machines to replace the current ones because they are giving her problems every day. Mariama requests a loan amount of GH¢600 to change her milling machines in order to remain in business. She believes this would help her to provide for her grandchildren. Alimatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Jordan’.

loans.use: To buy milling machines.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Doña Julia V. reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 58 años de edad y su hijo mayor es casado y trabaja. Su negocio es una pulpería que inicio desde hace varios años el cual comenzó con prestamos en Afodenic lleva once ciclos trabajando y han sido de muchos beneficios en su vida personal como en su negocio, con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer las paredes de su casa de concreto ya que son de madera y esta en mal estado lo que mas ah anhelado es poder tener una vivienda digna y sentirse orgullosa que a pesar de ser una mujer soltera, puede hacer sus objetivos realidad. Con su negocio espera incrementar mas productos de consumo diario para mejorar las ventas a si como captar clientes.
texts.en:
Julia V. lives in Laureles Sur in the city of Managua. She is 58 years old, and her eldest son is married and working. Her business is a grocery store she started a few years ago with loans from Afodenic. She has worked through 11 loan cycles, and has had as many benefits in her personal life as in her business. With this loan, she wants to buy construction materials to make concrete walls in her house, as they are currently made of wood and in poor condition. What she wants most is to have a worthy home and feel proud that despite being a single woman, she is able to achieve her goals. In her business, she hopes to increase the amount of consumer goods she sells to improve her sales and bring in more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make concrete walls in her home

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina A. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. All her children are currently in school. Rosina lives with her husband, who is a farmer, together with their children in a community called Bekwai in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She has been in business for the past ten years in food production. 

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernel, and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual labour to help produce larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more towards her children's education. Rosina belongs to a village bank called ‘Allah Febiri’. She hopes to receive GHS600 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, natural de Iquitos, reside en la ciudad de Lima hace 20 años, vive con su hijo de 26 años en su casa propia. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de productos variados, como adornos de porcelana, canicas, botones, etc., en una pequeña tienda que puso en su casa, en la cual atiende a sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes. A Mary le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es muy tranquilo y le permite generar ganancias para su manutención, pero algunas veces el trabajo le resulta cansado, debido a que por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar en la casa donde viven los sacerdotes, al costado de la parroquia, y a partir de las 2 de la tarde se dedica de lleno a su negocio propio hasta promediar las 10 de la noche. Mary quiere generar mayores ingresos para poder dedicarse exclusívamente a su tienda y ser más independiente, es por eso que quiere un espacio más grande para comprar mayores productos y equipar mejor su tienda. Con el dinero que solicita comprará material de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, etc., para la ampliación de su tienda, vender más, obtener más ganancias y pronto dedicarse sólo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old, a single mother and native of Iquitos. She has lived in the city of Lima for 20 years. She lives with her 26-year-old son in her own house. For three years, she has sold various products like porcelain decorations, marbles and buttons in a small store she put in her house. She attends to her neighbors, who are her primary customers. Mary really enjoys her work, as it is very laid-back and allows her to generate an income to support herself. But sometimes her work leaves her tired because in the morning she works as a maid in the priests' house next to the parrish, and then works in her own business from 2 o'clock in the afternoon until about 10 at night. Mary wants to generate a better income so she can devote herself exclusively to her store and be more independent. For this reason, she wants a larger space so she can buy more products and better-equip her store. With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, etc. to expand her store, sell more, obtain a better wage and soon devote herself solely to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand shop space

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu H. is 70 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. All of her children are independent, and she is now living with four of her grandchildren. She has been trading on top of a table for twenty years now.

She prepares and sells corn dough, cassava dough, and other food ingredients in the community market where she lives. She also sells dried fish and smoked fish in addition to her other products. She purchases most of her goods from the main market of Kumasi and retails them to the community. She has been struggling to buy more from the market.

She requests a loan to buy foodstuffs like maize, cassava for the preparation of dough, and other food ingredients like tomatoes and spices. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. Mariama belongs to a village bank called ‘Bamali Allah’ which means ‘It is only God who can do it’.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize, spices and smoked fishes

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C., 35 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Kabendou depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des arachides, les faire décortiquer pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle veut  renforcer son captal. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Khady C., age 35, is married and has six children to support. She has been a member of the village lending group Kabendou for three years. Her work consists in buying peanuts and shelling them to make peanut butter to sell. She wants to boost her capital. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce and sell peanut butter

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr:
G. Prisca est née vers 1988 à Dja  dans la commune de Sèmè kpodji. Prisca est célibataire sans enfants. Prisca mène comme activité la vente des produits vivriers tels que le maïs, le haricot, la farine de manioc localement appelée gari et le charbon de bois. Prisca va s’approvisionner souvent à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin.Prisca a pour clientèle les habitants de son quartier Avotrou  de Cotonou.Prisca est à son quatrième crédit et souhaite avoir celui-ci pour renforcer son activité.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Prisca was born around 1988 in Dja, in the community of Sèmè Kpodji. She is unmarried and has no children. Her work involves selling staple foods, such as corn, beans, cassava flour (locally called gari), and charcoal. She is going to supply herself often in Tokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of charcoal, a sack of corn, and a sack of beans

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza I. is a 40-year-old mother of three boys. Her first child is now a trained teacher, whiles the rest are still in school. She is very hard-working and resourceful. She lives with her husband and the children at Bekwai, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband works for a metal products company.

Adiza has traded charcoal and grocery products in her neighborhood for five years now. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Adiza obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages. She purchases them from specific villages like Eduporsu and Awhiam in the Ashanti region where she lives, and she retails them to her customers.

She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal, sugar, evaporated milk, and other grocery products to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to pay her children's educational fees. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Adiza belongs to a village bank called ‘Shei Allah’.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal and grocery products.

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es: La señora Ivania tiene 39 años de edad, reside en laureles norte en la capital de Managua, con dos años de 2 y12 años de edad, su esposo es conductor. Su negocio es una pulpería que administra desde hace diez años la cual inicio con ahorro y prestamos, las dificultades es cuando el cliente no le paga y son perdidas a su capital. Este es su cuarto crédito el cual va a comprar materiales de construcción como perline para cambiar los cuartones de madera que están en mal estado,  y lo menos que desea es que su casa se le caiga, por eso da gracias a Afodenic por que esta haciendo posible la reparación de su vivienda lo cual va estar mas segura con su familia. Sus planes es seguir hacer creciendo su negocio mediante productos variados, educar a sus hijos para que sean hombres de bien ante esta sociedad.
texts.en:
Ivania is 39 years old and lives in Laureles Norte in the capital city of Managua with her children, aged two and 12, and her husband, a driver. Her business is a general store which she has run for 10 years and started with savings and loans. She has difficulties when customers don't pay her and she loses capital. This is her fourth loan, which she will use to buy construction materials to repair her home, which is in poor condition. At the very least, she hopes to keep her house standing, and gives thanks to Afodenic for allowing her to repair her home to make her family safer. Her plans are to ensure the growth of her business through various products, and educate her sons so they will grow up to be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home repair

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is 42 years old. She is married and a mother of three. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. She has been selling plantains for a year now to support her family. Her husband sells fuel like petrol.

She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of plantains in bulk from the plantain farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. With this loan, she wants to buy plantains in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her kids in school. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home. Ama belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: Ama wants to buy a bunch of plantains

loans.name: Aishetu

texts.en:
Aishetu I. is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. All of her children are currently in school. Aishetu lives with the husband, a butcher, and their children in a community called Bekwai in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She has been in business for the past seven years in food production.

She prepares and sells local foods like banku and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves; therefore, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in delivering the food.

Aishetu says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She hopes to receive GH¢700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava dough, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

Aishetu belongs to a village bank called ‘Bamali Allah’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr:
D. Diane est née le 20/01/1988 à Zogbohouè, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou situé derrière le stade de l’amitié de KOUHOUNOU. Mais D. Diane est originaire de la commune d’Allada; elle est célibataire sans enfant. Diane gère une cabine téléphonique dans laquelle elle vend des cartes de recharge téléphonique de tous les réseaux au Bénin. Diane acquiert ses cartes à G8 qui est un point de vente en gros situé non loin de son domicile. La cabine téléphonique de Diane se situe devant son domicile. Diane est à son quatrième crédit et sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner davantage en cartes de recharge téléphoniques.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
D. Diane was born on January 20, 1988 in Zogbohouè, a district in the city of Cotonou located behind Amitié Stadium of KOUHOUNOU. However, she traces her roots to the community of Allada. She is unmarried, has no children, and manages a telephone booth, where she sells recharge phone cards of all the networks in Benin. She acquires these cards at G8, which is a wholesale outlet not far from her home. Diane's telephone booth is situated in front of her home. She is on her fourth loan and is requesting this loan to supply herself with more recharge phone cards.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge telephone cards of all the phone networks in Benin

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Amparo es costurera, desde muy joven aprendió la costura el cual ha sido su medio de vivir, gracias a sus padres que le pagaron un curso a prendió, trabaja haciendo los encargos y también hace ropa para vender. Tiene 56 años de edad, reside en  villa Venezuela con cuatro hijos mayores que la apoyan con los gastos. El préstamo que esta solicitando es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en su casa para estar más segura con su familia ya que la delincuencia es día a día. Sus planes es poder comprar muchas telas para hacer vestido, vender más lo cual le generara mejores ganancias y poder seguir haciendo su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Amparo is a seamstress. She learned how to sew when she was very young, and this has been her way to make a living, thanks to her parents who paid for a course for her so she could learn. She works by taking orders and also makes clothing to sell. She is 56 and lives in Villa Venezuela with four adult children who help her with the expenses. The loan she is requesting is her fourth with Afodenic, which she will invest in the purchase of construction materials to make a wall in front of their house so they will be more secure since delinquency happens every day. Her plans are to be able to purchase many different fabrics to sell more clothing so she can make more profits and continue constructing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make a wall

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
S. D. P. NORMA ISABEL, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. 29 D. Mayo Mz. 206 Lt. 25  del distrito D. Calería, tiene 62 años, 04 hijos, y su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura y pesca.

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, y empezó a comprar productos que provienen D. la chacra y a revenderlos, y también empezó a vender en las mañanas mazamorra D. maíz con maní, plátano y leche.

Con el préstamo D. S/.1,200. Nuevos Soles, se invertirá en la compra D. maíz, maní, plátano, también comprará trampas para pescar y vender pescado en el mercado La Hoyada.

Se encuentra muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos ya que tiene préstamos a mujeres D. acuerdo a sus necesidades, y si una socia quiere sacar más le dan y si quiere poco también le dan.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel S. D. P. belongs to the communal bank, "Las Almendras." She is 62 and has 4 children. Her husband works in farming and fishing. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, and she started to purchase products from the farm to resell them. In the mornings, she also started to sell a corn pudding along with peanuts, plantains, and milk. With this loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of corn, peanuts, and plantains, and she will also buy traps for fish and sell the fish in La Hoyada market. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos since they loan to women in accordance with their needs. If a member wants to receive either more or less, they give it to her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, peanuts, and plantains.  To purchase traps to fish with and sell the fish in La Hoyada market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es:
SÁNCHEZ RÍOS DINA LUZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Asentamiento Humano Cesar Vallejo Mz. B Lt. 13 del distrito de Calería, tiene 64 años, 04 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene invalidez permanente.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en la compra de algunas prendas de vestir usadas y las vendió a un mejor precio, y con el tiempo ha notado que es un negocio que le da para vivir sin mucha preocupación. Por eso va invertir más en ese negocio, y sobre todo darle unos arreglos a algunas prendas de vestir, por ello en su  inversión actual, del préstamo que recibirá fue de S/.1,700. Nuevos Soles,que comprará una máquina de coser, agujas e hilos, cierres y botones y todo lo necesario para darle un impulso a su negocio.
Me gusta Manuela Ramos es un bonito programa que saca de muchos apuros y nos reúne para distraernos.
texts.en:
DINA LUZ SÁNCHEZ RÍOS belongs to the communal bank "Las Almendras" ("The Almonds") and lives in the Cesar Vallejo settlement in the district of Calería. She is 64 years old with four children and her husband is permanently disabled.

Her first loan was for $300 nuevos soles (about $100 US) which she invested in the purchase of some used clothing which she resold at a higher price. Over time, she has realized that it´s a business that helps her get by without a lot of worry. For this reason, she is going to invest more in her business, specifically in repairing the used clothes before selling them. With this loan of $1700 nuevos soles (about $550 US) she will buy a sewing machine, needles and thread, fasteners and buttons, and everything else necessary to grow her business.

"I like Manuela Ramos, it's a beautiful program that helps out those in a tight spot, and we can get together and forget our troubles."


Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine, needles and thread, fasteners and buttons.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
A. K. Ama est originaire du Togo, elle est née le 26/05/1973 à Lomé. K. Ama est mariée à KOUKPAGAN Christophe qui est comptable à UNITEC-Bénin. Ama a quatre enfants dont un garçon et trois filles qui sont tous scolarisés. L’ainé Jonathan est en classe de sixème. Ama vend des boissons de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie(SOBEBRA) du Bénin et des galettes faites à base de maïs. Ama est à son quatrième crédit. Ama sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. K. Ama traces her roots to Togo. She was born on May 26, 1973 in Lomé. She is married to KOUKPAGAN Christophe, who is an accountant at UNITEC-Bénin. She has four children, a boy and three girls who are all in school. Jonathan, the eldest, is in the 6th grade. Ama sells beverages from Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA) in Benin and also galettes made from corn. She is on her fourth loan and is requesting this loan to bolster her business.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of corn and six cases of drinks

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim K., a local entrepreneur in Makeni City. Ibrahim is requesting a loan in order to give strength to his business. Ibrahim sells second-hand clothes and second-hand traveling bags. He would like to get a loan in order to buy two bales of traveling bags and one bale of men’s t-shirts.

Ibrahim is aged thirty-eight, and married with four children. Two of his children are in secondary schools, one in nursery school and the last one is still very young. Ibrahim was born in Makeni City, and he has been a businessman for eighteen years now. 

This will be the first loan Ibrahim is receiving from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, Ibrahim will be able to improve on his business. Things are now expensive, he told me, but with a loan, he will be able to buy quality clothes thereby attracting many customers. Getting this loan will therefore make Ibrahim feel very good, happy and proud because of the improvement it will bring to his business.

loans.use: To buy two bales of second hand traveling bags and one bale of men's T-shirts

loans.name: Raquel Yamileth

texts.es: Doña Raquel tiene una óptica Daylop  que inicio hace varios años con ayuda de su esposo, luego que salio de su carrera universitaria, surgió la idea de poner su propio negocio, lo cual no fue fácil al inicio ya que el mercado esta saturado. Tiene 34 años de edad, reside en villa Venezuela, tiene dos hijos que estudian, su esposo es maestro de obra. Con esta solicitud quiere invertir en la compra de equipos que le permitan mejorar la calidad de su trabajo y estar a la altura de la tecnología. Sus objetivo es poder crecer a nivel nacional y ser reconocida, sus planes a futuro es poder dar los estudio a sus hijos, mejorar su nivel económico.
texts.en:
Doña Raquel has an eyeglass store that is named Daylop that she started several years ago with help of her husband after she finished her degree at the university. She had the idea to start her own business and it was not an easy start since there was a lot of competition. Doña Raquel is 34 years old and she lives in villa Venezuela. She has two children that are in school. Her husband is a craftsman. With this request for a loan she was wants to invest in buying equipment for her business that allow her to improve the quality for her work and to have the latest technology. Her objective is to expand her business to the national level and it to be well-known. Her plan for the future is to be able to give her children a good education and to improve her own economic level.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more modern equipment to better serve her customers

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.es:
R. R. SARA MIGUELINA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Manco Capac N° 270 del distrito de Calería, tiene 63 años, 01 hijo, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo eventual independiente.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inició un trabajo en cuero, tales como carteras, sandalias, zapatos, y otros a pedido del cliente.

El préstamo que recibirá e de S/.1500. Nuevos Soles, con el que le servirá para refaccionar unos cuartos, dándole el acabado y seguridad respectiva para alquilarlos, por lo que invertirá en cemento, arena fina, chapas y cerrojos. Además piensa implementarse con gaseosas, galletas y golosinas para los inquilinos y transeúntes.

Muy agradecida comenta que Manuela Ramos es un buen programa que saca de muchos apuros a las mujeres de Ucayali, dándoles la oportunidad de emprender un negocio.
texts.en:
Sara Miguelina R. R. is a member of the "Las Almendras" community bank. She lives on Jr. Manco Capac in the district of Calería. She is 63 years old, has one son and her spouse has his own independent source of income. Her first loan for S/.300 soles was used to start a leather business making items such as wallets, sandals, shoes and such at the request of her customers. This loan for S/.1,500 soles will be used to refurbish some rooms to give them the finish and security to be able to rent them. She will buy cement, fine sand, finger plates and bolts. She is also thinking of stocking up on soft drinks, cookies and candies for the tenants and passersby. She is very grateful and mentions that Manuela Ramos is a good programme which gets a lot of the women of Ucayali out of trouble, giving them the opportunity to open a business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish some rooms; she will invest in cement, fine sand, finger plates and bolts.  She will set herself up with soft drinks and cookies for the tenants

loans.name: Edith Adelada

texts.es:
R. D. R. EDITH ADELAIDA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Manco Capac N° 323 del distrito D. Calería, tiene 65 años, 03 hijos, y es viuda.


El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual invirtió en cultivo y cosecha D. una parcela D. plátano.

Con el crédito D. S/. 1,500 nuevos soles, al tener experiencia en el cultivo D. plátano, invertirá en sembrío y mantenimiento D. 2 hectáreas D. plátano y una hectárea D. yuca, el producto lo venD. en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, a conocidos y una parte al mercado.


Agradece a Manuela Ramos por facilitarle el dinero para poder invertir y subsistir, por lo tanto ella se siente muy comprometida en ser muy puntual con sus cuotas y corresponder a  la confianza que le tienen.
texts.en:
Edith Adelaida R. D. R. is a member of the "Las Almendras" community bank. She lives in the district of Calería; she is 65 years old, has three children and is a widow. Her first loan was for S/.300 soles which she used to grow and harvest a field of plantain. With this loan of S/.1,500 soles and with her experience growing plantain, she will invest in the sowing and maintenance of two hectares of plantain and one hectare of cassava. She sells her produce in the city of Pucallpa to acquaintances as well as at the market. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing her with the money to invest and survive. She feels very committed to repaying her loan punctually and to repaying the trust you are showing her.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow and maintain two hectares of plantain and one hectare of cassava.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
RÍOS C. CONZUELO, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Manco Capac N° 323 Int. A del distrito de Calería, tiene 43 años, 01 hijo, y es madre soltera.

Fue invitada a participar en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, aunque fue poco, le ayudo a emprender su pequeño negocio de venta de Juane en las tardes, en el frontis de la casa donde vive.   

Con el préstamo de S/.1,500. Nuevos Soles, con el que podrá implementar mucho mejor su negocio, ya que comprará un surtido de insumos que son necesarios para ampliar y consolidar su negocio, por ellos ha planeado comprar arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite y otros por sacos y cajas respectivamente, también tiene una parcela de plátano, que esta cultivando para tener plátano a disposición para su negocio y también  pueda venderlos. 
Esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos y desea que pueda seguir apoyando a más mujeres en esta región, sobre todo a madres solteras como ella que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Consuelo R. C. belongs to the community bank "Las Almendras". She lives in the district of Calería, is 43 years old and is a single mother of one son. She was invited to join Manuela Ramos [a Peruvian MFI] and her first loan was for 300 soles.
