Although the loan was for a small amount, it helped her start her small business selling juanes in the afternoons in front of the house she lives in. With this 1,500 soles loan she will be able to better set up her business as she will buy a good quantity of the ingredients she needs to expand and consolidate her business. She has decided to buy rice, sugar, salt, oil and other ingredients by the bag and by the crate, as well as a field of plantain which will be farmed to supply her with plantain for her business as well as for retail. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos and hopes the organization will be able to continue helping more women in this area, especially single mothers such as herself who truly need the help.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her business with the purchase of rice, sugar, salt, oil and so on by the bag and by the crate.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora S. G. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Los Pinos Nº 538, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 52 años y es madre de 4 hijos, uno que todavía depende de ella. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia, decidió vender relojes. Tiene 09 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, que se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Nº 02 de Tarapoto.
 Con el préstamo de S/2,200.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, desea invertirlo, implementando mas su negocio  comprando relojes  de todas las marcas y modelos, para damas, caballeros y niños, así como correas, pilas  para relojes y lentes de sol , etc.

Ambos, ella y su pareja, toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, nos cuenta, que se siente muy independiente y segura de si misma.

Isidora, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y mujer.
texts.en:
Isidora S. G. is a member of the community bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz”. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She is partnered, 52 years of age and the mother of four children, one of whom is still a dependent. With her first loan of 300 soles, which she took on her own initiative, she decided to sell watches. She has been working with the bank for nine years. Today she is still in this same business, located in the Market Nº 02 of Tarapoto. With this loan for 2,200 soles, which she will repay over six months, she was to invest in her business by buying more watches of various brands and styles for women, men and children as well as watchbands, watch batteries and sunglasses and so on. She says that both she and her partners make decisions about the profits from the business, that she feels very independent and sure of herself. Isidora is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches for women, men and children as well as watch batteries, and sunglasses

loans.name: Guldith

texts.es:
La señorita Guldith N. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en la Av. Micaela Bastidas Nº 355, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y no tiene hijos.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 que fue motivada por su familia a sacar el préstamo para aumentar sus productos de abarrotes. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con negocio de venta de abarrotes en un ambiente ubicado en su propia casa.

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de papel higiénicos, detergentes, galletas, útiles de higiene personal y del hogar en cajas, también  verduras en kilos,  gaseosas en docenas, huevos en javas., para así estar bien abastecida y tener contentos a sus clientes.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, y en lo personal se muestra mas comunicativa y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.  
 
Guldith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Guldith N. R. is a member of the "Nuestra Señora de la Paz” community bank. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She is 41 years old, single and has no children. Her family encouraged her to borrow her first loan of 500 soles to increase her stock of groceries. She has been working with the bank for four years. She is still running her grocery store business from her own home. She will invest this 2,000 soles loan to be repaid in six months in the bulk purchase of toilet paper, cleaning supplies, cookies, personal hygiene items and home cleaning items, as well as buying vegetables by the kilogram, soft drinks by the dozen and eggs by the crate so that she can be well supplied and satisfy her customers. She makes all the decisions with respect to the income from her business. She has become more outspoken and has a great desire to succeed. Guldith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toilet paper, detergents, cookies, personal hygiene items and items for the home. To buy vegetables, soft drinks and eggs

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena B. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. José Gálvez Nº 630, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años, y es madre de 05 hijos, 01 que todavía depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, por propia iniciativa se inicio con un pequeño negocio en venta de abarrotes. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio es así que con el préstamo de S/1,200.00 que cancelará en 06 meses, comprara más productos, como aceites, fideos, leche, enlatados de pescado, galletas dulces y saladas en cajas, bebidas como gaseosas y agua mineral en docenas,, para su surtir su negocio.

En lo personal, ambiciona implementar y surtir más su negocio y desarrollarse como una exitosa empresaria.

Maria Elena, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Maria Elena B. A. belongs to the community bank, “Las Moralinas.” She lives at Jr. José Gálvez Nº 630, Morales District, San Martín Department. She is married, 51 years old, and is the mother of 5 children. One still depends on her.

With her first loan of S/300.00 ($100 USD), she took the initiative to begin her own small business selling groceries. She has worked with the bank for two years.

Today she continues with this same business, and with this loan of S/1,200.00 ($375 USD), which she will pay off in six months, she will buy more products, such as oils, noodles, milk, canned fish, boxed cookies and crackers, and drinks such as soda and mineral water in 12-packs, to supply her business.

She aspires to further set up and supply her business and to develop its success.

Maria Elena gives thanks to Manuela Ramos for letting her grow as an entrepreneur and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oils, noodles, milk, canned fish, boxed cookies and crackers, and drinks such as soda and mineral water in 12-packs

loans.name: Lusgarda

texts.es:
La señora Lusgarda T. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara”, vive en el Jr. Cuzco Nº 396, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre 02 hijos, que todavía depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por una amiga empezó vendiendo frutas en el Mercado de Tarapoto.
Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas, anticuchos asados y juanes, ubicada en el Jr. Cuzco Nº 396, donde vende a sus clientes, vecinos y moradores de la comunidad y con el préstamo de S/1,300.00 que cancelará a plazo de 04 meses, desea invertirlo, implementando su negocio, comprar más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas y así dar una mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.

En lo personal, desea ampliar más su negocio, y hoy se siente más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Lusgarda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lusgarda T. P. is a member of the community bank Santa Barbara. She lives at Jr. Cuzco Number 396 in the Tarapoto district in the department of San Martín. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of two dependent children. With the first loan of 300.00 soles, and motivated by a friend, she began selling fruits in the Tarapoto market. She has been working with the bank for 1 year. Now she sells prepared meals, such as grilled kabobs and “juanes” (a traditional dish). Her business is located at Jr. Cuzco number 396. She sells to customers, neighbors and residents of the community. With this loan for 1,300.00 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will build up her business. She will buy tables, chairs, glasses and pots. This will make her customers more comfortable, and allow her to provide better service. Personally, she wishes to expand her business. She now feels more responsible about making her payments and making her own decisions. Lusgarda is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a business person and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more tables, chairs, glasses and pots

loans.name: Luz Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Luz Consuelo A. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”, vive en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 1298, Distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los tres mayores de edad, que ya no dependen de ella. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 motivada por su comadre se inicio en la venta de ropa. Tiene 05 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa, que los comercializa entre su amigos y conocidos. Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06  meses, Comprará pantalones, faldas, polos, blusas, en variedades de tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

 
Luz Consuelo, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Luz Consuelo A. A. is a member of the "Tesoro Escondido" community bank. She lives in the district of Juanjui in the department of San Martín. She is married common-law, is 50 years old and the mother of three children. Her children are adults and no longer dependent on her. With her first loan of S/ 300 soles, encouraged by a relative, she began selling clothing. She has now been working with the Bank for five years. She currently sells clothing, mainly to friends and acquaintances. With this loan for S/ 2,000 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy pants, skirts, polos, blouses of all sizes for women, men and children. She is the person making the decisions for the business. She is considered a go-getter, consistent and responsible in her repayments. Luz Consuelo is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, polos, blouses of all sizes for women, men and children

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La señora Lucy V. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Victoria Vásquez Nº 273, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 33 años, y es madre de 02 hijos.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia  se inicio vendiendo refrigerios en el cafetín de un centro educativo. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, en un local especialmente acondicionado en su propia casa. 

Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos, como  arroz, azúcar  en sacos, aceite, galletas dulces y saladas; conservas de pescado en cajas, fideos en paquetes, productos para aseo personal y del hogar surtir su negocio y satisfacer a su clientela.
Ella es quien maneja los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, ahora es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Lucy, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Lucy V. C. is a member of the "Las Moralinas" community bank. She lives in the district of Morales in the department of San Martín. She is single, 33 years old and the mother of two children. With her first loan of S/.300 soles which she applied for on her own initiative, she began selling snacks in the snack bar of a school. She has been working with the bank for four years. She now sells groceries in a room she has specially set up in her own home. With this loan for S/2,000 soles which she will repay in six months, she will buy more goods such as rice, bags of sugar, oil, sweet cookies and savouries, crates of canned fish, packages of noodles, personal hygiene products and household products to stock her business and satisfy her customers. She is the person managing the expenses and revenues of her business. On a personal level, she is now a woman with a great desire to progress. Lucy is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, cookies, canned fish and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Lucinda Esther|

texts.es:
La señora Lucinda Esther R. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Victoria Vásquez Nº 273, Distrito de Morales, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviente, madre de 03 hijos y tiene 56 años.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por su  esposo y sus hijos se inicio vendiendo golosinas en los colegios y ropas usadas en los pueblos. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la elaboración de kekes utilizando su horno a gas los mismos que los comercializa en las bodegas de la ciudad, además  vende  ropa usadas por las tardes. 
Con el préstamo de S/2,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando harina y azúcar en sacos , mantequilla en kilos, huevos en javas, leche en cajas, esencia de vainilla en botellas, gas en balones.

Ella y su esposo son los manejan los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. Ahora se siente una Mujer independiente, más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Lucinda, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela R. por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucinda Esther R. S. belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Moralinas.” She lives at Jr. Victoria Vásquez Nº 273, Morales district, San Martín department. She is married, is a mother to 3 children, and is 56 years old. With her first loan for S/. 300.00, motivated by her husband and children she began selling candy at the schools and used clothing in the towns. She has been working with the Bank for 4 years. Today she makes cakes with her gas oven and sells them in the grocery stores in the city, in addition she sells used clothing in the afternoons. With the loan for S/2,000.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of flour and sugar, kilos of butter, crates of eggs, boxes of milk, bottles of vanilla extract, and cylinders of gas. She and her husband take care of the expenses and income from her business. Now she feels like an independent woman, more assured, responsible with her loan payments and making her own decisions. Lucinda thanks Manuela R. for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, milk, gas.

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Catalina R. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos de madera como canastos y sombreros y a la vez vende almohadas y panas de plástico.

Es muy visitada a diario y como mujer muy trabajadora y sabia ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de un crédito para la compra de los productos y así continuar comercializándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega city Central market Mrs. Catalina R., with great effort, sells her wood products such as baskets and hats and also sells pillows and plastic items. She has many customers every day and as a very hardworking and wise woman she has approached Ceprodel because she needs a loan to buy her products and in this way continue selling them in her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products

loans.name: Perla Sughei

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Perla Sughei con gran dedicación labora en su negocio propio de  pulpería el cual atiende muy amablemente a toda la clientela que le visita.

Actualmente debido a la situación adversa que pasa con respecto a su economía, ella ha decidido adquirir un crédito de Ceprodel para la compra de su mercadería y es por eso que espera muy confiadamente en que será beneficiada y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega city Central market Mrs. Perla Sughei, with great dedication to her general store business, pleasantly attends to all the customers that visit her. Today due to the adverse situation that has effected her economically, she has decided to acquire a loan from Ceprodel to buy merchandise and therefore she confidently hopes that she will be granted and in this way she will be successful with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La venta de especies es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Candida D. en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que a raíz de su necesidad económica ha buscado la forma de cómo llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las especies  ya que requiere de estos productos para continuarlos ofertando en su establecimiento en el mercado Central de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Selling spices is the business that Mrs. Candida D. has in the Chinandega city Central market. She is a woman who as a result of economic necessity has looked for a way to support her home. It is important to note that today she has approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy the spices that she requires to continue offering them in her establishment in the Chinandega Central market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spices

loans.name: Eusebia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y con un gran espíritu de superación por su negocio, todas las mañanas la señora Eusebia abre las puertas de su establecimiento para vender los productos tales como granos básicos y productos personales en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Actualmente ella dedica su tiempo a esforzarse mas en el negocio y por esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así adquirir los granos básicos para continuar ofertándolos en su establecimiento.
texts.en:
With much enthusiasm and great spirit to have her business succeed, every morning Eusebia opens the doors of her establishment to sell products such as basic grains and person products in the Central market of Chinandega city. Today she dedicates her time strengthening her business and therefore she has approached Ceprodel to be the beneficiary of a loan and in this way acquire the basic grains to continue offering them in her establishment.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains to sell in her store

loans.name: Manrique Zamir

texts.es:
El señor Manrique Velasquez se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos varios siendo una pequeña pulpería el cual ha logrado surtir gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos en su negocio.

Ceprodel ha sido un apoyo fundamental para él por lo que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en su negocio directamente y hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le proporcione el otro crédito para la compra de los productos que tanto requiere adquirir.
texts.en:
Mr. Manrique Velasquez sells various products in his small general store which he has stocked thanks to his great efforts in his business. Ceprodel has been a fundamental support for him in providing loans that he has used directly in his business and today he hopes that Ceprodel will grant him another loan to buy the products that he so needs to acquire.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his store

loans.name: Loicith

texts.es:
La señora Loicith V. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Mateo Pumacahua Nº 329 – Pueblo Joven, departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 33 años y es madre 01 hija, que depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por su esposo  se inicio vendiendo en su casa,  golosinas, galletas, caramelos.
Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica al servicio de Internet y con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá implementando su negocio con 02 cabinas de locutorio para llamadas telefónicas locales, nacionales e internacionales..

Ambos; ella y su esposo toman las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. Ahora es una Mujer independiente, más segura, responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Loicith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Loicith V. R. belongs to the Communal Bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace). She lives at Jr. Mateo Pumacahua Nº 329 – Pueblo Joven, San Martín department. She is married, 33 years old, and the mother of 1 daughter who is dependent upon her. With the first loan for S/.300.00, motivated by her husband, she began selling candy, cookies, and caramels from her home. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Today she provides Internet service and with the loan for S/2,500.00 that will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in adding 2 phone booths for local, national and international phone calls. Both she and her husband make the decisions regarding the expenses and income from her business. Now she is an independent woman, more assured, responsible with her loan payments and making her own decisions. Loicith thanks Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install 2 phone cabins

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega el negocio de la señora María C. es la venta de bolsas plásticas las cuales ella comercializa con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Vende todo tipo de bolsas en todos los tamaños y para toda actividad. La razón por la cual hoy en día ella hace uso de Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bolsas ya que al agotársele requiere volver a llenar su estante para su comercialización.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega city Central market Mrs. María C. sells plastic bags in order to support her family. She sells all types of bags in various sizes for all kinds of activities. The reason today she seeks a loan from Ceprodel is to buy bags because upon selling all her supply she needs to restock her stand in order to continue selling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
La señora Lleny M. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Los Andes Nº 591, Distrito de Morales, departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, pedido por sus clientes de acuerdo al catálogo.
  
Con el préstamo de S/2,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas caballeros y niños, desodorantes, esmaltes, lociones y así  tener en stock sus productos para venderlos a  precio de catálogo  generándole una mayor ganancia.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Lleny, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lleny M. V. belongs to the “Las Moralinas” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Los Andes Nº 591, Morales district, San Martín department. She is married, 36 years old, and is the mother of 2 children. Today she sells cosmetics, which her customers order by catalog. With the loan for S/2,500.00, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy beauty products on sale such as perfume for women, men and children, deodorant, nail polish, lotions, and in this way have in stock products to sell them at the catalog prices, generating greater profits. She is the one who makes the decisions regarding the income from her business, is assured in offering her products, and she considers herself a hard-working woman, constant and responsible with her loan payments. Lleny thanks Manuela Ramos for permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, deoderants, lotions, nail polish

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana T. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara”, vive en el Jr. Circunvalación Nº 1671, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 27 años y es madre 01 hijo, que todavía depende de ella.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, motivada por su pareja , empezó vendiendo en su casa comidas preparadas, y a la venta de pollos vivos. Tiene 08 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, asados y juanes, ubicada en la Plazuela Fernando Belaunde Terry, donde vende a los moradores de la comunidad. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 04 meses, desea invertirlo, ampliando e implementando su negocio, y comprar más mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, e insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos.

Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Liliana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana T. P. belongs to the “Santa Bárbara” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Circunvalación Nº 1671, Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is married, is 27 years old, and is the mother of 1 son who is dependent upon her. With the first loan for S/.300.00, motivated by her husband, she began selling prepared meals from her home and selling live chickens. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 8 years. Today she sells food, bbq, and “juanes” (a traditional dish), in the Plazuela Fernando Belaunde Terry, where she sells to the residents of the community. With this loan for S/1,000.00 which will be repaid in 4 months, she wishes to invest it in expanding her business, buying tables, chairs, glasses and pots and ingredients used to daily prepare her meals. She usually makes the decisions regarding the earnings from her business. Today she feels like an independent woman, responsible for her loan payments and making her own decisions. Liliana thanks Manuela Ramos in permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business by buying more tables, chairs, glasses and ingredients

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
La señora Leonina P. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Sucre Mza. A – Lte. 05, Distrito de Morales, departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 39 años y es madre 02 hijos.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia, empezó vendiendo ceviche en el centro de Tarapoto todos los días. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.
En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta de comidas preparadas, anticuchos asados y juanes, ubicada al costado de la Empresa Ejetur, donde vende a chóferes, pasajeros y moradores de la comunidad. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá, comprando mesas, sillas, baldes, termos, vasos y ollas, para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Ella mayormente toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, desea ampliar más su negocio y se siente más segura con el pago de sus cuotas. 

Leovina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonina P. D. belongs to the “Las Moralinas” Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Sucre Mza. A – Lte. 05, Morales district, San Martin department. She is married, 39 years old, and mother of 2 children. With the first loan for S/.300.00, which she sought on her own, she began selling ceviche in downtown Tarapoto every day. She has been working with the Communal Bank for 4 years. Today she sells prepared meals, such as grilled kabobs and “juanes” (a traditional dish) at the side of Empresa Ejetur, where she sells to drivers, passengers, and residents of the community. With this loan for S/1,500.00 which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy tables, chairs, buckets, thermoses, glasses and pots to provide better service to her customers. She usually makes the decisions regarding the earnings from her business. Personally, she wishes to expand her business and she feels assured in repaying her loan. Leovina thanks Manuela Ramos in permitting her to grow as an entrepreneur and woman.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables, chairs, buckets, thermoses,  glasses and pots to provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Lauristela

texts.es:
La señora Lauristela E. D. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Ulises Reategui Nº 302, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 56 años.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, motivada por su esposo aperturò  un negocio D. venta D. golosinas  en su propia casa. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

 Con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06 meses, comprará más productos para implementar más su negocio con galletas dulces y salada en cajas caramelos, chocolates, chicles  en bolsos, kekes, panes, gaseosas y agua minerales en paquetes D. docenas para venD. a los alumnos D. una escuela cercana a sus vecinos y moradores D. la comunidad.

Ella es quien maneja los gastos y ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, ambiciona implementar y surtir más su negocio. Y ahora es una Mujer independiente y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas y toma sus propias decisiones.

Lauristela, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Lauristela E. D. P. is a member of the community bank "Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She is married and 56 years old. She was encouraged by her husband to borrow her first loan of S/.300 soles, with which she opened a candy store in her home. She has been working with the bank for two years. With this loan of S/1,500 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy more products to stock her business with: sweet cookies and savouries by the case, caramels, chocolates, bags of chewing gum, cakes, breads, soft drinks and mineral water by the dozen to retail to the students of a nearby school, to her neighbours and people from the community. She is the person managing the expenses and revenues from her business. On a personal note, she wants to establish her business and stock it more. She is now an independent and responsible woman in her repayments and makes her own decisions. Lauristela is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods such as cookies, sweets, chocolates, chewing gum, soft drinks, breads, mineral water

loans.name: Lady Vivian Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Lady Vivian Carolina M. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Tesoro Escondido”,  vive en el Jr. Eduardo Peña Meza Nº 294, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente,  tiene 29 años y es madre de un niño, que todavía depende de ella.
Tiene 07 años trabajando con el Banco. 

Actualmente, se dedica a la venta de uniformes, y lo vende a sus alumnas del Instituto donde también trabaja como secretaria en el mismo lugar, nos cuenta que sus ventas aumentaron, ya que es muy carismática y sonriente, con sus alumnos.

 Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelará a plazo de 06  meses,  invirtirá en la compra de 100 juegos de uniformes de damas y varones  para satisfacer la demanda de los alumnos(as) del  Instituto.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y tranquila, ya que es ella quien tomas sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera. 

Lady Vivian, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Lady Vivian Carolina M. C. is a member of the "Tesoro Escondido" community bank. She lives in the district of Juanjui in the department of San Martín. She is in a common-law marriage, is 29 years old and has one son, who is still a dependent. She has been working with the bank for seven years. She currently sells uniforms to the students of the institution where she also works as a secretary. She says that her sales will increase because she is very charismatic and cheerful with her students. With this loan of S/ 3,000 soles which she will repay in six months, she will buy 100 sets of girls' and boys' uniforms to satisfy the demands of the students. She now feels more independent and calm as she is making all her own decisions with respect to the business and to the income it generates. Lady Vivian is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 sets of girls' and boys' uniforms

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana A. D. Diaza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. 28 D. Julio, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 10 hijos, 04 D. ellos ya fallecidos y el resto todos independientes. 

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, motivada por uno D. sus hijos  emprendió su  negocio propio. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, en su bodega ubicada en su misma casa. 

Con el préstamo D. S/1,300.00 que pagará en un  plazo D. 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos , papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. 
 
Juana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana A. D. Diaza is a member of the “Amistad y Paz” (Friendship and Peace) Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Juanjui district of the department of San Martín. She is a 69-year-old widow with 10 children, 4 of whom have passed away while the others are independent.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained after much encouragement from one of her children, she started her own business.

She currently sells goods in her general store, which is located within her own home.

With this 1,300.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase more products to re-stock her shop, such as sacks of rice and sugar, packages of bathroom tissue, crates of milk and canned fish, household cleaning products, and various other goods in order to keep her customers satisfied.

She is the decision-maker in her business. She personally feels that she is more sociable, more confident, and more responsible with her repayments. Juana expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La señora Flor D. Maria H. D. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 629, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 71 años y es madre 05 hijos, que ya no dependen D. ella.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, que fue por iniciativa propia se dedico a la venta D.  comida preparada y a la crianza D. gallinas . Tiene 08 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad solamente se dedica a la venta D. comidas preparadas con entrega a domicilio, donD. ella prepara a diario sus alimentos y parrilladas.

 Con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06 meses, desea invertirlo, comprando insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como carnes en sus diferentes variedades, cereales, verduras, todo esto al por mayor a fin D. estar abastecida , asimismo comprara ollas mas grandes y embases especiales para la distribución D. la comida. 

Ambos; ella y su esposo toman las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, siente que sus ventas se incrementaron. Se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Flor D. Maria, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Flor D. Maria H. D. D. is a member of the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace) Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Tarapoto district of the department of San Martín. She is a 71-year-old married mother of 5 independent children.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained on her own initiative, she decided to sell meals and raise chickens. She has been working with the institute for 8 years.

She currently prepares the meals in her own home, then delivers them to her customers’ doors.

She hopes to invest this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, in purchasing the wholesale supplies she needs to prepare her different meals (various meats, grains, vegetables) so that she can be well-stocked. She also wants to buy bigger pots and special containers so that she can distribute her meals.

Both she and her husband make the decisions regarding the business’ expenses and profits. She personally feels that her sales have increased. She feels like an independent woman who is responsible when making payments.

Flor D. Maria expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food preparation supplies

loans.name: Amarilis

texts.es:
La señora Amarilis T. D. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en el Jr. Sucre Nº 354, Distrito D. Morales, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre D. 02 hijos.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que fue por iniciativa propia, inició vendiendo productos,  pensión D. comida a estudiantes y alquiler D.  cuartos. Tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la Venta D. cosméticos, como talcos, colonias refrescantes, Shampoo, cremas que los compra por catálogos a pedido D. sus clientes etc.
 
Con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 a plazo D. 06  meses, comprará más cosméticos y una vitrina para  exhibir sus productos. Ella es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, se siente más segura al ofrecer sus productos, se considera una mujer luchadora, constante y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Amarilis, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Amarilis T. D. L. is a member of the “Las Moralinas” Microfinance Institute. She lives in the district of Morales, in the department of San Martín. She is a 53-year-old married mother of 2 children.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained on her own initiative, she started selling products, offering meals to students, and renting out rooms. She has been working with the institute for 2 years.

She currently sells cosmetics, such as talcum powder, body splashes, shampoo, and lotion by catalog to her customers.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase more cosmetics and a glass display case for her products. She is the decision-maker in her business, which makes her feel more comfortable when selling her products. She considers herself to be a hardworking and persevering woman who is responsible with her payments.

Amarilis expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics and a glass display case

loans.name: Celia Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora Celia Esperanza R. tiene 71 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Celia tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Doña Celia es la venta de ropa, golosinas  y plásticos. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio ella comercializa los productos de manera ambulante por lo que tenia que buscar la forma de suministrar ingresos a su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Celia son de seguir manteniendo a sus clientes ya que sin ellos no podría ofrecer sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calcetines, ropa para bebe, golosinas y compra de bolsas. Su sueño más grande es obtener un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 4.400 córdobas.
texts.en:
Celia Esperanza R. is 71 years old and single. Doña Celia has 4 children, and all of them work. Doña Celia sells clothing, candy and plastic goods. She has worked in this business for more than five years. She sells her products as a street vendor, as she has to find a way to supply her family with an income. Doña Celia’s goal is to maintain her clientele, since without them she wouldn’t be able to offer her products. This loan is for working capital to buy socks, baby clothing, candies and shirts. Her bigger dream is to obtain a stable place from which to sell her products. The loan is for C$4,400 córdobas ($225 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sergio Noel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Estelí el señor Sergio A. con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de venta de accesorios de celulares siendo este su negocio que desde hace varios años ha logrado mantener. También se ha destacado en la reparación de celulares siendo este su único negocio con el cual sustenta a su familia.

Actualmente el señor Sergio ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los accesorios de celulares para su respectiva venta y por este motivo es que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Estelí, Sergio A. is enthusiastically dedicated to his business in cellular phone accessories. He has run his business successfully for a few years. He stands out by also repairing cellular phones, this being his only business to support his family.

Today Sergio turns to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy cellular accessories for his business, and he is very confident that Ceprodel will grant him this credit so that his business can move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Alicia Hidalgo

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Hidalgo S. D. Q., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Martínez D. Compagñon Nº 981, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada,  tiene 46 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, 02 mayores D. edad y 01 que todavía depenD. D. ella.

Alicia se inició sola, con un capital D. S/. 300.00,  vendiendo condimentos, ubicada en el Jr. Tahuantinsuyo cdra. 07. Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.

Actualmente sigue con el mismo negocio y con el préstamo D. S/1,500.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06  meses,  desea implementar su negocio, y comprar mas productos como ají panca, pimienta, cominos, orégano  en kilos,   esencias especiales para preparación D. comidas en kilos, así como  vinagre y sillao en cajas, etc. 

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien tomas sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera. 

Alicia, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia Hidalgo S. D. Q. belongs to the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” Community Bank. She lives at 981 Jr. Martínez D. Compagñon St. in the Tarapota district of the San Martín region. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. Two of her children are adults and 1 is still a dependent.

Alicia started on her own with 300.00 PEN. She sold condiments on Jr. Tahuantinsuyo St., block 7. She has worked with the Bank for 4 years.

She is currently in the same business. She would like to help her business with the loan of 1,500.00 PEN that she will pay back in 6 months. She will buy more products like chili powder, pepper, cumin, oregano in kilos, special spices in kilos to prepare food as well as vinegar and soy sauce in boxes, etc.

Today she feels more independent and confident since she is making her own decisions about her business and the income it generates.

Alicia is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help her business and buy products like chili, pepper, cumin, oregano, vinegar and soy sauce

loans.name: Adith Mego

texts.es:
La señora Edith Mego V. D. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara”, vive en el Jr. José Olaya Nº 1066, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 50 años y es madre D. 2 hijos, los dos mayores D. edad, que ya no dependen D. ella. Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. Mercería, como (Zapatillas, calculadoras, toallas, libros, hilos, etc), en un ambiente D. su propia casa.

Con el préstamo D. S/1,000.00 que cancelará a plazo D. 06  meses, lo invertirá comprando útiles escolares como: Cuadernos, libros, lápices, lapiceros, mochilas, así como zapatillas en variedad D. tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños.

Ella; es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea ampliar su negocio y mejorar el ambiente donD. ofrece sus productos. 

Adith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith Mego V. D. C. belongs to the “Santa Bàrbara” Community Bank. She lives at 1066 Jr. José Olaya St. in the Tarapota District of the San Martín region. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. Both children are adults and are no longer dependents. She has worked with the Bank for 1 year.

She currently sells notions such as (sneakers, calculators, towels, books, thread, etc.) in her own home. She will payback the loan of 1,000.00 PEN in 6 months. She will invest in school supplies such as: notebooks, books, pencils, pencil holders and backpacks as well as sneakers in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

She makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. Personally she tells us she would like to increase her business and improve the area where she sells her products.

Adith is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies: notebooks, books, pencils, backpacks.  Purchase sneakers for women, men and children.

loans.name: Adith

texts.es:
La señora Adith C. L. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. Juanjuicillo S/Nº, Distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 56 años y es madre de 2 hijos, los dos mayores de edad, que ya no dependen de ella. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 motivada por su hija y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendieron su negocio. Tiene 06 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, que los ofrece a los moradoras de los pueblos aledaños. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,500.00 que cancelará en 06  meses, desea invertir comprando ropa usada en fardos, con variedades de tallas, con modelos para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Ambos; su esposo y ella, toman las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, nos cuenta que también desea variar su negocio con el  sembrío de cacao (cosecha de cacao).

Adith manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adith C. L. belongs to the “Amistad y Paz” Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Juanjuicillo St. in the Juanjui District of the San Martín region. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. Both children are adults and not dependents.

She started her business with her first loan for 300.00 PEN, motivated by her daughter and with the support of her husband. She has worked with the Community Bank for 6 years. She currently sells used clothing to the people from bordering towns. She will payback the loan of 1,500.00 PEN in 6 months. She would like to invest in bundles of used clothing in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

Both she and her husband make the decisions about the earnings from her business. Personally she tells us she would also like to vary her business by growing cocoa (cocoa crop).

Adith is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of bundles of used clothing in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina R. D. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz”, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1226, Distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada,  tiene 53 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, 03 que todavía dependen D. ella.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 por iniciativa  empezó su negocio vendiendo pollo vivo desviscerado. Tiene 06 años trabajando con el Banco. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, en un puesto alquilado del Mercado Central, donD. brinda el servicio, a los moradores D. la comunidad y amas D. casa y con el préstamo D. S/3,000.00 que cancelara a plazo D. 06  meses,  comprara  pollos vivos en jabas y con parte del dinero lo invertirá también implementando su Piscigranja, para la crianza D. peces D. la especie gamitada.

Hoy, se siente mas independiente y segura, ya que es ella quien toma sus propias decisiones en su negocio y en los ingresos que genera.

Marina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina R. D. R. belongs to the “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz” Community Bank. She lives at 1226 Jr. Leoncio Prado St. in the Tarapoto District of the San Martín region. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. Three of the children are still dependents.

She started her business selling chickens with the first loan of 300.00 PEN. She has worked with the Bank for 6 years.

Presently she is in the same business at a rented stall in the Central Market where she serves people from the community and housewives. She will buy live chickens in crates with the loan of 3,000.00 PEN that she will payback in 6 months. She will also invest part of the money in her fish farm, to raise “gamitada” species fish.

Today she feels more independent and confident since she makes her own decisions about her business and the income it generates.

Marina is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase live chickens in crates and help her Fish farm raising fish.

loans.name: Flavio Julio

texts.es: Flavio Julio es un pequeño productor agropecuario que desde muy joven a dedicado su vida a la siembra de arroz en pequeñas cantidades, cuenta con la experiencia en las actividades productivas. Su familia esta compuesta por 6 personas, todos sus hijos son mayores y trabajan en coordinacion familiar para la siembra de arroz, su esposa atiende el hogar despachando muy temprano a su marido hacia sus areas de cultivo; don Flavio sueña con participar en la construccion de un trillo y se materializara con la presente solicitud de este credito.
texts.en:
Flavio Julio is a small scale farmer who has dedicated most of his life to growing modest amounts of rice. Because he has so much experience, he is quite productive. His family has six members and all of his children are grown. They help sow the rice, and Flavio's wife takes care of the home and dispatches him to work in the fields early every morning. Flavio has always dreamt of participating in the construction of a thresher that he could use on his fields and now, thanks to this loan, he will be able buy parts and do just that.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy thresher parts

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Maricruz L. se dedica a dos actividades siendo una de ellas la ama de casa el cual atiende su hogar y dedica su tiempo a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar y la otra es la venta de ropa ambulantemente en las calles del municipio.

Ella ha logrado combinnar las dos actividades y es por esto que ha logrado salira adelante en el negocio. Hoy en día se le ha agotado la ropa y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra y así continuar con su comercialización en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, Mrs. Maricruz L. works two jobs: first, as a housewife, taking care of her household and spending time with her small school-aged son, and second, selling clothes on the streets. She has succeeded in combining these two activities, and because of this has succeeded in advancing her business. Now she has run out of clothing and is looking to Ceprodel for a loan so she can buy more and continue her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Thelma Janeth

texts.es:
La venta ambulante require de mucho esfuerzo por el desgaste físico y la exposición al sol que afecta fuertemente. En el municipio de El Sauce, la señora Thelma N. se dedica a su actividad de venta ambulante de calzados con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Los calzados son vendidos de diferentes medidas y para todos los gustos. La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual comprar la mercadería como lo son los calzados para seguir comercializándolos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Traveling vendors require much effort, strongly affected by physical exertion and exposure to the sun. In the municipality of El Sauce, Mrs. Thelma N. sells footwear to sustain her family. She sells shoes of all sizes to suit all tastes. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to get credit so she can buy merchandise to keep selling in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es muy empeñosa en las cosas que realiza, pues tiene que alimentar a tres pequeños hijos y hacerse responsable de su educación, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, de quien está separada hace varios años. Una de las actividades que realiza con más frecuencia es la venta de tamales, los cuales son consumidos a la hora del desayuno, pues son unos deliciosos aperitivos a base de maíz con relleno de carne muy solicitados por las madres de familia. Doña Juana hace 12 años se dedica a la preparación de estos productos, pues tiene el don de la cocina y sus  tamales son lo mejor que sabe preparar, es por ello que son muy solicitados en los mercados y las ferias. Además cuando ha habido oportunidad, los ha preparado para grandes eventos o ferias de gastronomía. Juana desea seguir preparando estos deliciosos tamales, pero su mayor limitación es que no tiene una movilidad para trasladar sus productos a los diversos lugares donde tiene que entregar sus pedidos, es por ello que su máximo sueño es adquirir un auto para movilizarse, minimizando de esta manera sus gastos de producción. Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP, y desea seguir perteneciendo a este grupo de trabajo, pues junto a sus amigas aprendieron administrar su dinero, ya que tienen autonomía para organizarse y desarrollar habilidades dentro de su banco comunal. Juana  tiene pensado invertir 3500, por lo pronto, en la compra de un molino para agilizar la preparación de sus tamales, pues el que tiene es muy antiguo y necesita algunos repuestos.
texts.en:
Juana is very tenacious with the things she does, as she supports three small children and is also responsible for their education, and can no longer count on the support of her partner, with whom she separated many years ago. One of the activities Juana does frequently is to sell tamales, which are eaten at lunch time. They are delicious snacks made with corn and filled with meat and are very sought-after by other mothers.

Juana has been preparing these products for 12 years. She has a gift for cooking, and her tamales are the best she knows to make. It is because of this that they are so sought-after in the markets and fairs. She also has made them for large events and food festivals.

Juana would like to continue to prepare these delicious tamales, but her biggest limitation is that she is unable to transport her products to fill her orders. Due to this, her greatest dream is to acquire a vehicle to move her products, minimizing the costs of production.

This is her tenth loan with MFP (a Kiva Partner), and she wishes to continue her membership with this group, as together with her friends, she was able to learn to administer her money, and she had the autonomy to organize and develop her skills with her community bank. Juana hopes to invest 3500 as soon as possible, to buy a new mill to speed the production of her tamales, as the one she has is very old and needs repair.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new mill for corn

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 40 años, dedica su vida al cuidado de su esposo y sus dos hijos integrantes de su  familia que la llena de alegría. A pesar de la distancia para realizar sus actividades laborales María siempre viaja a su pueblo para estar pendiente de su ganado. Esta actividad la inició hace 15 años junto a su esposo, quien es el que está más pendiente del negocio pues se queda en el pueblo, mientras que María viaja a la ciudad para atender a sus hijos quienes están estudiando en Lima y requieren de sus cuidados. Cada quincena de mes regresa a su pueblo, aunque los viajes la agitan mucho, le reconforta saber que gracias a esta actividad puede brindarle a sus hijos una educación y desarrollo profesional. Cuando sus hijos terminen su educación María anhela incrementar su ganado y tener una gran hacienda que provea carne de primera calidad a los mercados de las  ciudades más comerciales. Hace seis años que trabaja con MFP, este es su 13avo préstamo y junto a su banco comunal logró adquirir experiencia en trabajo de equipo y la oportunidad de aprender a hacer crecer sus ingresos, administrando adecuadamente sus ganancias, pues las charlas educativas le han ayudado mucho. María invertirá 3000 soles en la compra de ganado de raza, los cuales brinden mayores ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, and dedicates her life to the care of her husband and her two children who fill her life with happiness. Because of the distance she needs to travel to work, María always travels to and from her village to take care of her flock. She began this lie of work 15 years ago with her husband, who cares for the business from their village, while María travels to the city to be with the children as they are studying in Lima and require her care. Every 15th of the month, she returns to her village, and although the travel agitates her, she takes comfort in the fact that this activity will bring her children an education and professional development. When her children finish their education, María would like to increase her livestock and to have a large farm that provides meat of the best quality for the markets in the most commercial cities.

She has worked with MFP for 6 years. This is her 13th loan and in conjunction with her communal bank, she was able to gain experience working in a team and the opportunity to learn to grow her income, administrate her earnings adequately. These educational lectures have been very helpful.

María will invest 3000 Peruvian Soles in the purchase of livestock, which will bring more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Juana Sarabia

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Juana vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Juana compra tara, tuna, cochinilla en su comunidad, luego de acopiar los comercializa a intermediarios. Además Juana los días sábados y domingos vende comida en el estadio de la ciudad.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Juana son tener casa propia, un carro e implementar una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank Orcasitas. She lives in the community of Orcasitas, which is located about 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Juana lives with her partner, is 23 years old, and has one child. She buys tuna (a local fruit), tara powder (for tanning leather), and cochineal (a dye obtained from an insect) in her community. She then sells these to middlemen. Juana also sells food on Saturdays and Sundays in the town stadium. Juana needs this loan of 900 Soles to invest in the purchase of tara powder. Juana dreams of having her own home and car and setting up a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tara powder

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María, es muy amigable con las personas, rasgo que refleja el amor que tiene en su hogar, pues su esposo e hijo son su mayor apoyo, lo cual le da más que un motivo para sentirse feliz. Su capacidad por aprovechar las oportunidades la llevó a instalar su propio negocio en la esquina de su casa, pues se dio cuenta que con la conglomeración de personas en esa zona, era un área perfecta para el comercio, y así hace 10 años vende desayuno todas las mañanas desde las 6 hasta el medio día. Pero su actividad no termina allí porque al llegar a casa prepara algunos aperitivos que también vende desde ahí. Esta actividad es muy cansada, sobretodo por las mañanas, pues el frío o el calor la desaniman, pero al ver a sus comensales y saber que al final del día tendrá las ganancias suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus seres queridos, la motivan en salir con mucho esmero y con una gran sonrisa en el rostro. Para el futuro María desea acabar de construir su casa para instalar un restaurante y dejar de salir todas las mañanas a la calle. Con MFP María tiene tres años, este es su sexto préstamo y hasta ahora está muy a gusto con el trabajo que viene desempeñando como parte de la junta directiva de su banco comunal, aprendiendo a desarrollar sus capacidades. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios y de algunos accesorios para mejorar la atención a sus clientes y hacer que se sientan muy a gusto en su puesto de comida.
texts.en:
María is very kind with people, with a face that reflects the love she has in her home, as her husband and son are her biggest supporters, and give her more than enough reason to be happy. Her ability to take advantage of opportunities led her to create her own business in the corner of her home, as she realized that with the amount of people in her area, it was the perfect place for her business. For the last 10 years, she has sold breakfast foods each morning from 6 a.m. until mid-day. But her activities don't end then, because upon her return to her home she prepares snacks that she also sells in her area.

This activity is very tiring, above all during her early mornings, as the cold or the heat will tire her. But upon seeing her clients and knowing that at the end of the day she will have sufficient earnings to fulfill the needs of her loved ones, she is motivated to put forth much effort and do it with a big smile. For the future, María would like to finish construction on her home to install a restaurant and leave behind all those early mornings in the street.

María has been with MFP (a Kiva Partner) for 3 years. This is her sixth loan and she has been very pleased with the work and her post as part of the directorial committee of her communal bank, and learning how to develop her skills. The money she seeks she will invest in the purchase of utensils and of a few accessories to improve her service to her clients and to make sure they enjoy her food stand.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Erica vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Erica es conviviente y tiene 20 años, Erica tiene una tienda en la casa de sus suegros en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, carne. Además Erica en temporadas compra tuna que luego vende a intermediarios.
Erica necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares y cereales.
Los sueños de Erica son tener casa propia, implementar un minimercado.
texts.en:
Erica is a member of the "Orcasitas" village bank. She lives in the community of Orcasitas, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Erica is 20 years old and lives with her spouse. Erica has a store in her in-laws house which sells groceries in general, fruits, vegetables and meat. Erica also seasonally buys prickly pear cactus fruit to sell to intermediaries. Erica needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of school supplies and cereal. Erica's dream is to have her own home and implement a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de útiles escolares y cereales.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Alicia A. se dedica a su negocio de venta de golosinas teniendo su propio establecimiento el cual es abierto todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente ella ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y con mucho esfuerzo busca la forma de salira adelante y  por esto es que una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las golosinas y así continuar atendiendo su negocio que tanto requiere de su pronta inversión.
texts.en:
In Nicaragua's capital city of Managua, Mrs. Alicia A. has her own establishment where she sells sweets. It's open every day from the early hours of the morning. She has managed to advance her business through much effort. She is looking for a way to advance further, and she has once again looked to Ceprodel for credit to purchase more confections and thereby continue attending to her business, which requires investment.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 44 años, siempre soñó con formar una familia, ahora tiene tres hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y junto a su esposo lograron adquirir una casa donde pudieron brindarles seguridad y estabilidad a sus pequeños. Su afán de progresar la llevó a desempeñarse en múltiples actividades en el trascurso de su vida, optando por ejercer el oficio de cosmetóloga hace 2 años, pues fue una de las actividades que mayores ingresos le producía, ya que solo invertía en la compra de productos, pues su capacidad y creatividad como estilista era lo suficiente para hacer de ella una persona competente. En el trascurso de los meses viendo la gran demanda que tenia, tuvo la iniciativa de instalar un salón de belleza, pero no contaba con los recursos suficientes, más su pareja realizó su sueño, pues ambientó el primer piso de su casa para el salón de belleza que requería y desde entonces las cosas han mejorado, ya que ahora Martha presta sus servicios muy alegremente durante todo el día. Sin embargo, ahora desea incrementar algunas máquinas de última tecnología para realizar su trabajo con mayor eficiencia. Ella está iniciando su primer préstamo con MFP, y el recibimiento dentro del grupo fue muy ameno y acogedor, Martha espera seguir formando parte de este equipo. El dinero que solicita será Martha invertido en la compra de insumos; tales como tintes, líquidos para peinar, entre otros productos que requiere para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha is 44 years old and had always dreamt of starting her own family. She now has three children who are her greatest treasure. She and her husband managed to obtain a house in which they could offer their young ones safety and stability. Her thirst for progress drove her to partake in several business activities throughout her life, finally settling on cosmetology 2 years ago. This was one of the businesses that brought in the most profits for her because she only invested in purchasing products, and her skills and creativity as a hairstylist were enough to make her a competent person. After a few months passed and she realized that her services were in demand, she took the initiative to set up a beauty salon, but she did not have enough funds to do so. Nevertheless, her husband materialized her dream by converting the first floor of their home into the beauty salon that she needed. Since then, things have improved because Martha now gladly offers her services all day long. However, she now needs to increase her number of cutting-edge equipment in order to work more efficiently. This is her very first loan with MFP, and she received a warm welcome from the group. Martha hopes to continue being a part of this team. The money that Martha is requesting will be invested in purchasing supplies such as dyes, hair products, and other things that she needs to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela  es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Adela vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Adela es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Adela junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos crudos y el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Adela son construir su casa de material noble y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Orcasitas Microfinance Institute. She lives in the community of Orcasitas, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Adela is a 36-year-old, married mother of 4 children. She and her husband produce handmade bricks, for which they have the support of laborers. They sell their products in their own community. Adela needs a loan of 900.00 PEN, which she will invest in purchasing raw clay and paying the laborers. Adela dreams of building a house with sturdy materials and seeing her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw clay and pay laborers

loans.name: Blanca Asunción

texts.es:
Nicaragua es un país que se caracteriza por tener mujeres muy trabajadoras que llevan el sustento a su casa de habitación. Tal es el caso de la señora Blanca L. el cual se dedica a su actividad de venta de leña en su casa de habitación.

La razón por la cual la señora Blanca ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la leña y es por este motivo que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para así obtener dicha leña  y venderla en su localidad donde muy dignamente mantiene su hogar.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is a country that is known for its very hardworking women who maintain their household. Such is the case of Blanca L., who sells firewood in her home.

The reason why Ms. Blanca L. now turns to Ceprodel is that she needs a loan so that she can purchase firewood and sell it in her area where she earns a decent living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood
